loans.name: Diana Jamileth

texts.es: La señora Diana Jamileth, resise en el barrio Villa Flor en la capital de Managua, tiene 31 años de edad, con tres hijos de 4,12 y 14 años de edad, los cuales estudian, su negocio es la venta de cosméticos que desde hace dos años inicio con el objetivo de apoyar a su esposo con los gastos, el trabaja de bodeguero en una librería, pero su salario es bajo. Con estas ventas ha logrado estabilidad económica para su familia. y el préstamo que esta solicitando es para comprar mas mercadería de cosmético como: perfumenes, pinturas, cremas entre otros encargos que le hacen con esto espera captar clientes nuevos y obtener mejores ganancias. Sus planes es poder ayudar a sus hijos con los estudios, hacer mejoras en la vivienda. Da las gracias ala institución por hacer posible el incremento de su negocio.
texts.en:
Diana Jamileth lives in the Villa Flor neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She is 31 years old and has three children ages 4, 12 and 14, who are in school. Her business is cosmetics sales, which she started five years ago with the aim of helping her husband with the household expenses. He works as a shopkeeper in a bookstore, but his salary is low. With these sales, she has managed to obtain financial stability for her family. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of more beauty supplies such as: perfumes, makeup, and creams, as well as other products that customers request from her. With these supplies, she hopes to attract new customers and increase her earnings. Her plans include helping her children obtain their educations and making improvements to her home. She gives thanks to the institution for making it possible for her to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies such as: creams, makeup and perfumes.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama Y. is 33 years old, married, and has four children—a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high school and others are in the junior high and the primary schools. They live in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a farmer. She sells cereals such as maize, beans, millet, and so forth. Mariama buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells them in the market square in her community. She sells to food vendors and retailers. She also treks to other markets to sell her products. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Mariama aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Jasminez Group

texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Jasminez D. Yaureccan is part of the Wari I Project.  Its members are from the community of Yureccan, in the District of Locroja, of the Province of Churcampa.  The community is located 12,303 feet above sea level.  The activities of the community are agricultural, including growing potatoes, barley, beans, and wheat, and also raising livestock.

Maria is a single mother with one 6-year-old daughter.  Maria began her business selling dairy products, and now she has a shed where she obtains milk and later produces cheese and butter, products that she sells in the Churcampa fair.  Also, she buys and sells grain.  With the loan, she will buy more grain.  Maria’s dream is to have her own vacation in Pamparaccay, and she is saving for her daughter’s Christmas gifts.

Felicitas is married and has four children. She buys cheese in the fairs and in her community.  Afterwards, she sells them in the Churcampa fair, and she also buys and sells small animals.  She will use the loan to buy more small animals and cheese.  Felicitas’ dreams are to buy a shed to produce dairy products and buy the things that she needs for her home.

loans.use: To purchase grain, small animals and cheese

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr:
Cette dame exerce depuis 1999 comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de jus de différentes sortes et des yaourts. Beaucoup de personnes aiment ses yaourts parce qu’elle le fait très bien, aussi  à la sortie des classes les élèves viennent se rafraîchir chez elle, de même que certains ouvriers qui travaillent à proximité du lieu d’exercice de son activité. Actuellement le congélateur qu’elle utilise pour rafraîchir ses jus est en panne, elle veut acheter un autre congélateur c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 1 congélateur.
Elle est mariée et mère de 03 enfants.
texts.en:
Since 1999, this woman has been earning an income from selling different kinds of juices and yoghurts. Many people like her yoghurt products because she does a good job making them. Plus, when classes are over, students come to her for refreshments, just like certain laborers who work near where she operates. Right now, the freezer she uses for cooling her juices is broken down. She wants to buy another freezer. This is why she’s requesting her first loan from WAGES. She is married and the mother of three children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer

loans.name: Eveling Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Eveling Dávila tiene la edad de 34 años, reside en el barrio Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, casada y con dos hijos de 9 y 13 años de edad, su negocio es hacer manualidades y belleza a domicilio lleva diez años  trabajando, inicio con recursos propios de su liquidación de su trabajo. Con este crédito lo invertirá en infraestructura en la compra de materiales de construcción, para hacer mejora a un cuarto y poderlo alquilar para obtener un ingreso que le ayude. Con esto espera estar solvente para poder apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios. Este es su quinto crédito en Afodenic y da las gracias por el apoyo que le han prestado con los plazos accesibles y así poder proyectarse en sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Eveling Dávila is 34 years old and lives in the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the capital city of Managua. She is married and has two children ages 9 and 13. Her business is making handicrafts and providing beauty services, which she carries out in her home. She has been working for ten years, having started with her own resources from a job-related severance pay. With this loan, she will invest in construction materials for improving a room in her house that she hopes to rent for additional income. With this, she hopes to be solvent and be able to help her children with their educations. This is her fifth loan with Afodenic, and she gives thanks to the organization for the support it has provided her through accessible loan terms that allow her to forge ahead with her goals.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make improvements to a room in her home.

loans.name: Armandina

texts.es:
La socia ARMANDINA, es natural de la provincia de Calca  en el distrito de Huarán S/N, perteneciente a la ciudad del Cusco, sitiado a 1 hora y 30 minutos desde la misma ciudad.

Nuestra socia es casada, ella tiene 50 años de edad y tiene 4 hijos, el último de sus hijos que aún las acompaña tiene 23 años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con las manualidades, ella teje en todo tipo de lanas, y en macramé, diversos bolsos, gorros, sandalias, bufandas, chompas, guantes, y mucho más, la socia desea el préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de materiales y así tener mayor producción y mejorar sus ventas.

Nuestra socia agradece y valora la ayuda brindada en razón de que en el distrito donde la socia vive no se cuenta con la banca financiera. Ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de la deuda.
texts.en:
This member, Armandina, originates from the Calca province in the district of Huarán, part of the city of Cusco and located 1 ½ hours from the same. Our member is married, 50 years old, and has 4 children. The youngest of her children, who still lives with her, is 23 years old. She alternates her homemaking activities with creating handicrafts. She knits all types of yarns, macramé, different styles of purses, hats, sandals, scarves, sweaters, gloves, and many other items. The member wishes to receive a loan to invest in the purchase of raw materials so she can increase her production and, therefore, her sales. Our member gives thanks for and greatly values the help provided, particularly because in her region there are no financial institutions. She commits to repaying the loan in full.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her knitted crafts.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel A. is forty-five years old. He is married and has four children, a son and three daughters. His children are currently in the senior high, junior high and the primary schools. Sammy lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. His wife is a trader.  Sammy also trades in utensils, men’s footwear and printed textiles. He buys his goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in his community. He treks to other markets to sell as well. Sammy has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He aspires to expand his business and sponsor his children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: To buy utensils and other bulk goods for sale

loans.name: Florencia

texts.es:
La señora Florencia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús D. Praga” que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chucuito, Departamento D. Puno, tiene 45 años D. edad, es casada y madre D. 04 hijos, y tiene estudios D. secundaria completa y habita en el Barrio 15 D. Agosto.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 5 años, con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, ella  tiene su negocio D. compra y venta D. ropa. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 2000.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio, la compra y venta D. ropa, Florencia comprará medias por docena, pantalones, camisas, blusas y chompas, los cuales venD. en su puesto del mercado D. Yunguyo.

Su deseo es poder capitalizar su negocio y vender su mercadería al por mayor. A ella le gustan las reuniones y los encuentros que Manuela Ramos realiza.
texts.en:
Florencia is a member of the Communal Bank "Niño Jesús D. Praga”, which is located in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 45 years old, married and the mother of 4 children. She finished secondary studies and lives in Barrio 15 D. Agosto.

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement since 5 years ago. Her initial loan was 300 nuevo soles. She runs a business buying and selling clothes.

Now she is requesting a loan of 2000 nuevo soles to invest in her business. She will buy stockings by the dozen, pants, shirts, blouses and sweaters, all of which she sells at her stand in the Yunguyo market.

Her desire is to be able to capitalize her business and sell her merchandise wholesale. She enjoys the meetings run by Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To by stockings, pants, shirts, blouses and sweaters

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana A. is 43 years old, married and has four children—a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high school and some are in the the junior high and primary schools. The family lives in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a cocoa farmer. She sells food items such as plantain, cassava, yam, and so forth. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells them in the market square in her community to chop bar operators and other retailers. Susana also treks to other markets to sell her products. She has been in business for over 15 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Susana aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy food stuffs

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace C. is 43 and married. She has given birth to four children, a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in senior high while others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband works with a local timber firm. 

Grace is a food vendor. She sells rice and stew in her neighborhood. She prepares the food in her residence and sells by the roadside. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from Kumasi at affordable prices. Grace has been in business for more than 17 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children to higher levels in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a appris le métier de menuiserie, en 2006 il a ouvert son atelier de menuiserie qu’il a appelé « menuiserie CMPO ». Actuellement il a reçu des commandes de ses clients malheureusement il ne dispose pas des matières nécessaires pour exécuter ses commandes, il sollicite alors de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 90 planches  et 60 chevrons. Ces matières lui permettront d'exécuter ses commandes et de vite livrer ainsi il pourra gagner plus la confiance de ses clients.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who learned the trade of carpentry. In 2006, he opened his own woodworking shop that he calls “Menuiserie CMPO”. He currently has orders from customers but unfortunately lacks the supplies necessary to fulfill them. He’s therefore requesting his first loan from WAGES to buy 90 planks and 60 rafters. These supplies will enable him to fulfill his orders and to deliver them quickly. Thus, he’ll be able to earn more trust from his customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana Amoako, 43, is married with five children: two daughters and three sons. A couple of her children are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a teacher by profession. Susana trades in stationery materials and owns a shop at the lorry station. She sells all kinds of books and other logistics such as pen, pencil, chalk, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in the business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Susana aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy stationery in bulk

loans.name: Condoray Group

texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Condoray is part of the Wari I Project.   Its members are from the community of Condoray, in the District of Tambillo, of the Province of Huamanga.  It is located about 90 minutes from the city of Ayacucho.  The principal activities of the community are the rearing of small animals as well as agriculture.

The members partake in different businesses, such as the rearing of animals, the buying and selling of grains, bread, the buying and selling of products from a native Peruvian tree called tara, and cochineal insects, which are of commercial value.

For example, Haydee, who lives with her partner, raises guinea pigs, and in recent months has improved her shed, which she sells products from in the city of Ayacucho.

The loans of these members will be used to buy grain, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.use: To buy grain, guinea pigs, and pigs.

loans.name: Koryor

texts.en:
Koryor T. is sixty years old. She is widowed and has given birth to six children (two daughters and four sons). Some of her children are currently in the senior high while the others are in the junior high or the primary schools. She lives with her children in a family house in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region of Ghana. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Koryor is a food vendor. She runs a chop bar (a simple eatery) in her locality. Koryor wants a loan to buy foodstuffs such as plantain, cassava, yam, maize, etc. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. Koryor has been in business for over twelve years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Mambo (Greetings!) from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Jennifer M. from Mbeya. She is married with two children between the ages of 1 and 4. Additionally, she is responsible for supporting two dependents because their parents can’t take care of them. 

Jennifer has been running a “kuku” business since 2006. "Kuku" is Swahili for chickens. Raising kuku is a popular micro-business in Tanzania, especially amongst SELFINA clients, for a number of reasons. One of the many reasons is that they require little start-up capital. You can start with one or two, and either add to them as you go, or wait for them to multiply naturally! Another reason is that they require little space, so sometimes you can just let them run around in your garden or compound. 

Jennifer works at the business for 4 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by her two young sisters. She currently earns about 700USD a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to buy feed for her chickens. In the future, she plans to increase the quantity and the range of her business. Jennifer thanks you for your support!

ABOUT SELFINA:
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy feed for her chickens

loans.name: Dédé

texts.fr:
Cette jeune femme aidait avant sa mère dans ses activités commerciales, en 2007 elle s’est lancée dans le commerce en de produits cosmétiques, chaussures pour dame et des sacs, elle exerce cette activité dans sa propre boutique. Elle s’approvisionne dans les magasins du grand marché de Lomé. Elle a beaucoup de clientes ce qui lui permet de réaliser de bonnes recettes. Une partie de stock est épuisée, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite par conséquent de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 10chaussures de dames, 10 sacs de sortie pour dame et divers autres produits de beauté.
Le revenu de son commerce lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille
texts.en:
This is a young woman who used to help her mother in commercial businesses. In 2007, she got started in the commerce of cosmetics, women’s shoes, and bags, all in her own shop. Her goods are gotten at the stores at the grand marketplace of Lomé. She has many customers, so she realizes a decent income. A portion of her inventory is exhausted. She wants to stock up again and is consequently requesting a loan from WAGES to buy ten women’s shoes, ten handbags, and various beauty products. The income from her commerce enables her to support her family

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoes, bags, and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A., 45, is a married mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. While few of her children have completed school and are working, others are still in senior and junior high school. She lives with few of her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She trades in printed textile and ladies wear. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. Hannah also hawks to sell. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Las Dorcas De Pomacocha Group

texts.en:
The members of Dorcas de Pomacocha are from the Pomacocha community in the Vischongo District of Vilcashuaman province. The principal activities of the community are agriculture, livestock, and trade. 

Zenaida is married and has five children. She sells groceries and vegetables (from her land) during fairs held throughout the region, and sells CDs that she buys in Lima with the help of her children. She would like to use the loan to buy mO. groceries and seeds. Zenaida dreams of educating her children and making them qualified professionals.

Another member, Elena, is married and has four children. She has a small shop at her house, where she buys and sells small animals and grains, which she acquires from surrounding communities. With the loan, Elena will buy mO. groceries and small animals. Elena aspires to educate her children and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, groceries and small animals

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther D. is a mother of one child, a son who is currently in the primary school. She is twenty seven years old and married. She lives with her son and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

She is a seamstress by profession and trades as well. She sells crates of eggs. She supplies retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. Esther buys crates of eggs from nearby poultry farms. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy eggs in bulk. She desires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma K. is a mother of six children, three sons and three daughters who are all currently in school (senior high, junior high and the primary schools). She is fifty-seven years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

She is a baker. She bakes bread in her community. She supplies retailers and beverage sellers in her community and hawks to sell. Emma buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for over thirty-eight years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: San Francisco De Asis Group

texts.en:
The Banco San Francisco de Asis is part of the Wari I Project.  Its members are from the community of Ccollpacucho in the District of Vischongo of the Vilcashuaman Province.  The community has a population of about 250 people and they dedicate themselves to agriculture and livestock.

For example, Margarita is married and has two children.  Margarita sells general groceries which she acquires from the city of Ayacucho.  She also sells grain that she buys in different communities throughout the region, which she does with the help of her husband.  She will use her loan to buy grain.  Margarita’s dreams are to leave her community to allow better opportunities for her children.

Justina is married and has one son.  Justina buys and sells animals, which she buys in different communities in her area.  She was taught this practice by her parents.  Her loan will be used to buy more barley.  Justina’s dreams are to save enough for her retirement.

loans.use: To purchase cereals, barley and groceries

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia N. is thirty years old and married. She is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters. All of her children are still in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Emilia is a trader. She trades in printed textiles and ladies’ wear – dresses, underwear, footwear, etc. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. She has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy ladies’ wear in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more bananas in bulk.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul K. is forty-three years old, married, and has four children: a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. He lives with his wife and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. His wife is a trader.

K. also trades in cereals such as maize, beans, millet, etc. He buys his goods from nearby communities at affordable prices and sells at the market square in his community. He supplies to food vendors and retailers. K. also treks to other markets to sell. He has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. He aspires to expand his business and sponsor his children in school.

loans.use: To buy cereals in bulk

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 35 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en la casa de sus suegros. Hace 4 años decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes en su casa porque en su barrio no existía una tienda cercana, con el apoyo de su esposo con en el capital que requería pudo implementar su tienda, la que ahora atiende todos los días incluyendo los domingos. Para Betty este trabajo es una actividad tranquila, que le permite estar en su misma casa para atender a sus hijos; además, es una fuente adicional de ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, lo que la hace sentir satisfecha por su labor. Para un futuro cercano, Betty desea incrementar la cantidad de sus productos para ofrecer mayores opciones de consumo para sus  clientes, ya que por el momento sólo vende los comestibles de básicos. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos y en fortalecer la unidad de su grupo. El dinero que está solicitando será destinado a la compra de mercadería para abastecer su pequeña bodega.
texts.en:
Betty is 35 and lives in her in-laws' house with her husband and 2 children. Four years ago she decided to open a grocery store in her home because there isn't one near her neighborhood. With help from her husband she had the capital she needed to open her store, which she now tends every day, including Sundays. This is a laid-back job for Betty because she can be in her own house where she can care for her children. It also provides an additional source of income to support the household, which makes the work very satisfying. In the near future, Betty would like to expand her inventory so her customers can have more products to choose from. At present she offers only basic food items. This will be Betty's first loan with MFP, so she is committed to making prompt payments and building up the unity of her group. She plans to use her loan to buy merchandise to stock her small grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Erasmo Francisco

texts.es: El señor Erasmo Francisco Manzanares A., tiene la edad de 59 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio, junto a su esposa, la cual trabaja para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tienen siete hijos, el de 24 y 23 años le apoyan con los trabajos agrícolas y el de 20, 17, 13, 11,10 años .Estudian, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones del techo ya que en tiempos de lluvia filtra mucho el  agua. Don Erasmo desde hace veinte cinco años se dedica a la agricultura,  el inicio esta actividad por medio de la reforma agraria, los planes hacia un futuro en sus cultivos es poder establecer obras de conservación de suelo. Con el financiamiento obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para aplicar al cultivo y lograr una buena producción y vender a mejor precio en el mercado, da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que esta
texts.en:
Erasmo Francisco Manzanares A., 59, lives with his wife in the Caralampio neighborhood. She works to help with the household expenses. They have seven children. The 24 and 23 year olds help with the farm work. The children who are 20, 17, 13, 11, and 10 go to school. The plan for the family is to improve the condition of the roof since it leaks a lot when it rains. For 25 years Erasmo has been a farmer. He started this work by means of the agrarian reform. His future plan for his crops is to be able to do work that conserves the soil. He will use the loan to buy fertilizers and manure to apply to his crops, achieve good production, and sell at a better price in the market. He thanks Afodenic for their support.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy manure and fetrtilizer to apply to his crops

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia O. is forty-five years old and married. She is the mother of three children, all sons. Some of her children are in the senior high while others are in the junior high. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Cecilia’s husband is a farmer.

Cecilia is a trader. She sells printed textiles. She sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell as well. She also hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell in her community. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She desires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy printed textiles in bulk

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is thirty-five years old, married, and currently has no child. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a farmer.

Mary trades in utensils. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells at the market square in her community. She treks to other markets to sell as well. Mary has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils in bulk

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 49 años, vive en una casa alquilada con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 27 y 21 años de edad. Desde hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de zapatos de todas las tallas y para todas las edades, vende de manera ambulante en las ferias locales de su ciudad y en cualquier ocasión que se le presente. Su trabajo de comercialización lo realizan por lo general de manera ínter diaria y sus hijos la apoyan en el transporte de la mercadería y también en las ventas. Las ganancias obtenidas le dan la oportunidad de recuperar su capital de inversión y así mantener estable su negocio. Esto anima a Gladis a proyectarse a tener un puesto fijo de ventas para sus zapatos, además de también empezar a vender ropa. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta por ser parte de su banco comunal, donde quiere continuar realizando un buen trabajo con su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de más zapatos para su próxima campaña de ventas por el día del padre.
texts.en:
Gladis is 49. She lives in a rented house with her husband and two children who are 27 and 21. For 10 years she has been selling shoes of all sizes for all ages. She sells on foot in the local fairs in her city for whatever occasion that presents itself. She generally sells every day, and her children help her transport and sell the merchandise. The money from the sales gives her the opportunity to recuperate her investment capital and keep her business stable. This encourages Gladis to plan to have a fixed place to sell her shoes. She also plans to start selling clothes. This is her third loan with MFP. She is very happy to be part of her community bank. She wants to continue doing a god job with her group. The money she is asking for will be used to buy more shoes for the next sales campaign for Father’s Day.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Mavis A. is thirty-five years old, married, and currently has no child. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband works with a cocoa marketing company.

Mavis trades in secondhand clothes – ladies’ underwear such as bras, etc. She buys her goods from Kumasi and sells at the market square in her community. She treks to other markets to sell as well. Mavis has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She aspires to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more crops in bulk

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce A. is twenty-seven years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two daughters and two sons. Some are currently in the junior high while others are in the primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Joyce is a food vendor. She fries and sells yam and beans in her locality. She sells by the roadside in the afternoons. Joyce wants a loan to buy tubers of yam and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. Joyce has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy tubers of yam

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
La señora Lidia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en el Jr. La Libertad S/Nº, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 41 años, 04 hijos, que están estudiando y dependen de ella.

Lidia, es una mujer muy joven, se siente capaz de seguir adelante y trabajar hasta donde Dios le de fuerzas, se siente muy bien con lo que hace, ya que se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, que ofrece en el Mercado Municipal de San Hilarión y sus ventas le van muy bien ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes. Esta muy contenta con lo que hace y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos. 

En la actualidad tiene una clientela ya fidelizada que a diario acuden a su puesto de mercado a comprar todo lo necesario que la ama de casa necesita, es ella quien personalmente les atiende  con una sonrisa que la caracteriza.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando racimos de plátanos, naranjas, mandarinas, limones cidras, taperibas y verduras en diferentes variedades para dar una mejor atención a sus clientes y que encuentren lo que necesiten. 

Se siente una mujer luchadora, y contenta por haber cumplido algunas metas que tenia trazada en su vida. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar en su negocio y la ayuda que brinda a muchas mujeres que quieren desarrollarse en lo personal y en el negocio.
texts.en:
Lidia belongs to the El Triunfo Community Bank. She lives at Jr. La Libertad S/Nº, San Hilarión district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 41, married, and has four dependent children who go to school. Lidia is a very young woman. She feels capable of getting ahead and working as long as God gives her strength. She feels very good about what she does. She sells fruit and vegetable in the Mercado Municipal of San Hilarión. Her sales are going very well; she is well known by her customers. She is very happy with what she does, and she has the support of her children. She currently has a loyal customer base that goes every day to her stand in the market to buy everything that a housewife needs. She personally waits on them with her characteristic smile. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she wants to buy bunches of bananas, oranges, mandarins, lemons, citron, golden apples, and different varieties of vegetables. She wants to buy these items to give her customers better attention and provide what they need. She is a fighter, and she is happy that she has met some of the goals she has planned for her life. She is thankful to Manuela Ramos for helping her set up her business and for the help they offer many women who want to develop themselves on a personal and on a business level.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fruits like bunches of bananas, oranges, lemons, and various vegetables

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 34 años, vive en la casa de su tía con su esposo y sus 5 hijos de 12,10,8,6 y 2 años. Desde hace más de 5 años, junto a su esposo, se dedica al cultivo de la papa, la cual cosechan  y procesan, sancochando en grandes cantidades, sacando la cáscara y posteriormente haciéndola secar al sol; luego la venden en el principal mercado de su ciudad. Por la gran demanda de papa, Gloria y su esposo optaron por darle un valor agregado a su producto, vendiéndola como “papa seca” la cual es usada para varios platos regionales y así es más rentable para ellos. Para un futuro cercano esperan sembrar en más extensiones de terreno para que su producción sea en mayores cantidades. Este es el primer  préstamo que tiene con MFP, Gloria está muy entusiasmada por el trabajo que va a realizar en su banco comunal, por lo que se compromete a ser muy puntual en sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de costales y de más papa de otros agricultores para procesar en mayores cantidades.
texts.en:
Gloria is 34-years-old and lives in her aunt's house with her husband and five children, who are 12, 10, 8, 6, and 2. For more than 5 years she and her husband have earned their living growing potatoes, which they harvest and process; they parboil them in large quantities to remove the skin, and let them dry in the sun. Then they sell them in their city's main market. To increase profitability, and because potatoes are in such high demand, Gloria and her husband have opted to provide some added value by selling their product as "dried potatoes", which are used in a variety of regional dishes. In the near future, they want to plant on more plots of their land to increase production. This will be Gloria's first loan with MFP. She is very excited about the work she'll be doing with her village bank, so she is committed to making prompt payments. She intends to use her loan to buy sacks, and more potatoes from other farmers so she can increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks and potatoes

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 23 años, vive en la casa de su madre junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 1 año y otro de meses de nacido. Desde su niñez se ha dedicado a las tareas de la agricultura, actualmente lo hace en las tierras de cultivo que ha heredado; produce principalmente la papa, junto a su esposo siembran en pequeñas cantidades para luego hacerla secar al sol y que así sirve como ingrediente básico en la preparación de un plato típico de su zona. Con las ventas obtenidas han podido crecer económicamente y reunir un capital considerable para iniciarse, hace 3 meses, en la crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, lo cual es un ingreso económico adicional para su familia. Hasta el momento estas actividades le han resultado rentables porque siempre tiene clientes que consumen estos  productos. Maribel ve el futuro con grandes opciones de desarrollo, pues quiere incrementar la cantidad de papa que siembra y tener una granja de animales más  grade y bien equipada. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, debido a la información que obtuvo sobre la dinámica de trabajo de un banco comunal ha decidido formar parte de uno, de manera muy comprometida. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de más cuchillos para el pelando de la papa, así como también adquirirá más cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
23-year old Maribel lives in her mother’s house together with her husband and their two children—the elder is 1 year old and the younger just a few months old. Ever since she was a young girl, Maribel has worked in agriculture, and she now farms land that she inherited. Her principal crop is potatoes; she and her husband grow them in small quantities which are then dried in the sun. The dried potatoes form the main ingredient in a local dish. With the sales of the potatoes they have been able to make financial progress and save enough capital to start, three months ago, raising young animals such as guinea pigs and chicks. This endeavour has provided a further economic boost for the family. Their farming activities have always been profitable because there are always customers to eat these products. Maribel sees a number of development options for the future: she wants to increase the quantity of potatoes that she grows and also to have a bigger, well-equipped farm. This is the first time she has asked for a loan with Kiva partner MFP. Because of the information she obtained about how a community bank worked, she decided to become a member and get involved. The money that she is asking for will be used to buy more knives for peeling the potatoes, and more guinea pigs and chicks.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy knives and young animals

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza tiene 39 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y a sus 3 hijos de 20, 17 y 9 años. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la venta de ropa a pedido, su metodología consiste en ir de casa en casa de sus clientes con la mercadería que tiene, de acuerdo al pedido reparte y posteriormente cobra por partes, controlando sus cuentas minuciosamente en un cuaderno de apuntes donde tiene su lista de clientes y pedido. Maritza se abastece cada mes de nueva mercadería y siempre está a la búsqueda de nuevos clientes para incrementar sus ventas, pues para ella su trabajo es una gran satisfacción, aunque no le gusten las largas horas de caminata, pero este esfuerzo es compensado con las buenas ganancias que recibe. Para un futuro cercano quiere tener una tienda de ropa en una zona comercial del centro de su ciudad. Esta es la tercera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, está muy contenta de trabajar en un banco comunal y siempre recomienda a otras personas que trabajen de esta manera, pues para ella es una forma efectiva de progresar; por ello, renueva su compromiso de responsabilidad con su grupo. El dinero que viene solicitando será invertido en la compra de más prendas de vestir para distribuir los numerosos pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Maritza is 39 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their 3 children, who are 20, 17 and 9 years old. She has been selling clothes for the last 15 years. She takes clothes' orders from her customers and once she gets the order, goes to their homes and delivers the merchandise. She sells by a schedule of payments and keeps track of her client’s orders in a notebook.

Maritza restocks new merchandise every month and is always in search of new customers to increase her sales . The work is a great satisfaction to her, but she doesn’t like the long hours walking. Although this effort is compensated by the good profits she receives. She hopes to have a clothing store in a shopping center in downtown in the near future.

This is her third loan with MFP. She is excited to work in a community bank, and always recommend it to others, because it is an effective way to move forward; therefore she renews her commitment to the group. The money requested will be invested in buying more clothing to comply with orders that she has.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Yaricza Ivania

texts.es: La señora Yaricza Ivania Pérez V. , tiene la edad de 30 años , habita en el barrio Buena Vista , junto a su esposo , el cual le apoya con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen dos hijos de nueve y siete años de edad, estudiantes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace dos años labora para zona franca desempeñándose como operaria ,  la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que su salario no le da para comprar materiales de construcción y sus sueños es lograr ver terminada su vivienda , con el préstamo va a comprar materiales de construcción y poder terminar el porche de su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yaricza Ivania P. is 30 years old and lives in the Buena Vista neighborhood with her husband, who supports her with the household expenses. They have two children who are 9 and 7 years old and go to school. She plans to improve her family living conditions. She has been working for the last 2 years as an operator for the free trade zone “Zona Franca”. Her biggest challenge is that she does not make enough money to buy building materials and her dream is to see her home finished. She is asking for a loan to buy building materials and be able to finish the porch of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 27 años, vive con su madre y su hermana en la casa de sus padres. Todos los días, desde que tuvo 8 años, sale por las mañanas a vender periódicos, ofreciendo a sus clientes diversas opciones. Junto a su madre, desde las 4 de la madrugada adquieren los periódicos para repartirlos en los diferentes puestos de venta que están ubicados en una de las calles más céntricas de su ciudad y abastecer su propio puesto. Adicionalmente, vende revistas, folletos, y los fascículos o libros que vienen como promoción con cada periódico, según la temporada. Para Miguel las ganancias que obtiene con su negocio son rentables y les han servido por durante todo estos años para solventar los gastos de la familia. Para un futuro cercano quiere incrementar sus ventas implementando más puestos en otras calles de su ciudad. Esta es la cuarta vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, él es una de las personas más dinámicas de su banco comunal, siempre promueve la unidad y es muy responsable con sus pagos. El dinero que viene solicitando será para invertirlo en la compra de libros, fascículos y más revistas para implementar su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Miguel is 27 years old and lives with his mother and sister in his parents' home. He has been selling newspapers every day since he was 8 years old, offering his customers various options.

He goes at 4 am along with his mother to buy the newspapers to distribute them in the different booths that are located in one of the central streets of their city, and to restock their own booth. He sells magazines, pamphlets and promotion books that come with each news paper according to the season. Miguel thinks his business is profitable and has served throughout these years to meet the family expenses.

He plans for the near future to increase his sales by opening more booths in different streets of the city. This is his 4th loan with MFP. He is one of the most dynamic people of his community bank and promotes unity; he is always very responsible with payments. The loan will be invested in the purchase of books, booklets and magazines.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy books, booklets and magazines

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dolly Elena

texts.es:
La señora Dolly Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte Nº 517, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 40 años, 03 hijos y 02 de ellos aun dependen de ella.

Su espíritu luchador que siempre la ha caracterizado y las ganas de salir adelante con sus propios medios le ha servido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de Juanes, ubicada en un local muy bien acondicionado, donde poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes y hoy nos cuenta que le va muy bien en este tipo de actividad. 
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio donde vende sus ricos juanes todas las noches. Tiene años trabajando en este negocio y se siente muy contenta con lo que hace.
 
Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos como sacos de arroz, huevos, gallinas criollas para sus juanes, utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad y reemplazar a los antiguos.

Dolly se siente muy tranquila y contenta con lo que hace y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Dolly Elena is a member of the Community Bank "Las Nazarenas". She lives at 517 Alfonso Ugarte in the Bellavista district of San Martin. She is 40 years old and she lives with her common-law husband. She has 3 children, two of whom are still under her care.

She has always been known as a hard worker and together with her will to prosper motivated her to start hr won business selling "Juanes", a very traditional food of the Peruvian rainforest. She makes her sales in a well-equipped restaurant where slowly she has gained recognition among her clients. Her business has seen ample success.

Currently she still carries on with the same business, selling Juanes in the evenings. She has been working this business for many years and she loves it completely.

With this loan of S/.1000 she will invest in the purchase of ingredients such as rice, eggs, and chicken to make Juanes, as well as to replace aging kitchen equipment.

Dolly feels comfortable and happy with what she does, and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for helping her meet her goals and realize her dreams.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as rice, eggs, and chicken; and to replace aging kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.en: Mr. Celedonio V. lives in the city of Fernando de la Mora and is married to Mrs. Gregoria Genez, with whom he has several children who all live outside of the home.  Celedonio works as a carpenter and makes furniture.  He sells his furniture in the capital as well as in the interior of the country.  He started working as a carpenter around 1991, and began saving a little bit of capital.  As time went on and he got better at his work, Celedonio had to invest more and more in his business.  Due to this need for support, he introduced himself to the Fundación Paraguaya and applied for credit.  The credit he has now is for the purchase of merchandise and raw materials.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Federico Samuel

texts.en:
Mr. Federico is 26 years old and lives in the Palermo neighborhood of the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. He is single and lives with his parents and sister, who is 22 years old. He is a young entrepreneur, and from a very young age he helped his parents, which gave him the initiative to start his own business.

His diner is strategically located on Route Transchaco, a main road, and is next to the grounds for the Paraguay Rural Association, or the Expo, as well as is in the vicinity of a local factory. His diner is painted with the colors and logos of Coca-Cola, the most famous soda brand in the world.

Mr. Federico gets up early every morning to drive to downtown Mariano Roque Alonso, where he goes to the supermarket to buy his merchandise. He buys everything he needs for the day there.

Mr. Federico is using his loan to buy ingredients for his delicious meals, which use meat, noodles, vegetables, and breads. He’s also going to buy sodas and beer. One of his aspirations is to be able to expand his diner to drink sales as well, including sodas and beers.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for cooking and drinks to sell

loans.name: Gladys Ramona

texts.en:
Mrs. Gladys Ramona was born in Asunción and has been married for more than 30 years to Miguel Angel G., who works at a service station. She has two children: one 31-year-old daughter and a 28-year-old son.

She has a booth in her house, located in the Molino district of Luque, which she uses as a convenience store where she sells drinks and general food items. She has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since the year 2000 and, thanks to the credits she has been given, she has been able to increase her business and have a larger income.

loans.use: To purchase beverages and food items in general

loans.name: Liliana Zoraida

texts.en:
Mrs. Liliana A. is 27 years old, and has been with Claudio Alvarenga for five years, with whom she has a four-year-old son. 

Before, Liliana worked as a secretary in a boutique but, with the support of her parents, she was able to open her own tailor shop. She has a well-formed clientele and makes a variety of suits for women.

In the future, she would like to get a larger space in order to give better attention to her clients. She would also like to go to college, as she has not been able to yet.

loans.use: To purchase silk fabric, lining for dresses, and thread

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.es:
La señora Adelfa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, vive en el Jr. Alfonso Ugarte cdra. 01, Distrito Banda de Bellavista, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 38 años, 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Adelfa, se dedica a la Venta de Cocos Heladitos, nos cuenta que ya lleva varios años dedicándose a este tipo de negocio, pero para implementarse y aumentar mas su negocio, decidió sacar un primer préstamo de S/. 300.00.
Vende sus cocos por las calles en una carretilla y también en su casa, sus clientes ya la conocen y saben del trabajo que realiza.

En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio y ahora ya tiene una clientela fija que día a día compran sus cocos, entre ellos están sus amigos, familiares y vecinos, le va muy bien y mensualmente genera sus propios ingresos y sus ventas le salen a pedir de boca.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando 500 cocos, y una parte del dinero también lo utilizara cancelando la última cuota de la congeladora de segunda mano que compró, la cual le es de gran ayuda en su negocio.

Adelfa se siente muy contenta por lo logrado, feliz por que en su negocio le va muy bien. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla en iniciar su negocio y en la ayuda que brinda a muchas mujeres que quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Adelfa is a member of the Community Bank "Las Nazarenas". She lives at 1 Alfonso Ugarte in the district of Bellavista in San Martin. She is 38 years old and she lives with her common-law husband and her son who is still under her care.

Adelfa sells frozen treats. She says that she has running this business for many years now. She sought out her first loan of S/.300 to invest in her business. She sells coconuts in the streets from a wheel barrow, as well as from her home. She is well known to her clients and they know of the attention she gives to her work.

Currently she is still running the same business but now she has a steady clientele that buy from her on a daily basis. Among them are her friends, family and neighbours. She earns a good monthly income and her sales better than she can hope for.

This loan of S/1000 will be invested in the purchase of 500 coconuts, and a part of these funds will be used to pay off the balance owed from the freezer she bought second hand. It has been of enormous help to her business.

Adelfa is very happy for what she has achieved and because her business is prospering. She is very grateful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for the support provided in the start up of her business, and for the help provided to so many women who want to develop their businesses.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 500 coconuts.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Mrs. Eliza is 49 years old and is married to Pedro Chamorro, who is 51 and is an electronics technician. They have a son who is 14 years old and is in eighth grade.

They began selling jewelry on their own, but it didn’t go very well. Then they decided to start a diner about five years ago. The diner is now having very good results. Additionally, Eliza’s husband owns a TV repair shop. They would like to expand their business by adding a small grocery store or a chicken shop to their diner, as they are located in a very populated neighborhood and have many clients.

loans.use: To purchase meat, eggs, bread and drinks

loans.name: Oscar Luis

texts.en:
Mr. Oscar M. has been married to Mrs. Yolanda Armoa for eight years. They have a seven-year-old son named Oscar. 

Oscar began working with his uncle, who is a brick-laying contractor. One day his uncle told him he should study to be an electrician so that they didn’t have to hire another person. Oscar studied to be an electrician about nine years ago and now he has his own tools and works for himself. Thanks to Fundación Paraguaya he has his own vehicle to help him transport things for work such as cable.

In the future he would like to open his own hardware store where he could sell all of the things for construction like cable, electrical boxes, circuit breakers and other items for electricians.

loans.use: To purchase cable for electrical installation

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.en:
This committee is named Esperanza, meaning Hope. It was formed by Alice L., who invited her neighbors to form a committee with her. She had already been part of another committee, but when she moved she formed this one. This group is in their first cycle of this program for women entrepreneurs in the Fundación Paraguaya. It is made up of 19 participants who invest their money in their respective activities. 

1. Ana María S. is a dressmaker. 
2. Cecilia G. is an interior decorator.
3. Catalina M. sells undergarments. 
4. Alice L. M. sells food. 
5. Pabla S. sells food. 
6. Juliana M. has a small grocery store.
7. Liliana L. has a grocery store.
8. Felipa S. sells clothing. 
9. Liliana P. has a general store. 
10. Elodia T. has a general store.
11. Candida B. sells food. 
12. Marina M. sells food. 
13. Yeny Ramirez sells clothing. 
14. Amelia Melgarejo sells clothing. 
15. Vanesa C. sells food. 
16. Valeria C. sells food. 
17. Vania C. sells food. 
18. Maxima V. sells clothing. 
19. Barbara V. sells food.

loans.use: To purchase food, charcoal, sodas, clothing, personal care items, etc.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Mr. Virgilio B. is 64 years old and is a self-employed construction worker. He was married for almost 38 years to his wife, Catalina Simon, who passed away three years ago. They had four children together, all of whom are older and have their own families.

When Virgilio's wife was alive, the couple owned a small grocery store in their house, which his wife attended to, while Virgilio worked in his profession in order to pay the living expenses. Virgilio then decided to start his own business with his sons, providing lighting for large events. One of his children had already been working in this industry for years.

According to Virgilio, the business has had a lot of success in its few years of operation. Working with the Fundación, Virgilio has been able to purchase a truck for transporting his equipment to places where his services are needed. The credit given to him will go to tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and acessories for lighting

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo” vive en la Av. Amazonas Nº 463, del Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 44 años; es madre de 06 hijos y 03 que aun dependen de ella. 

Una mujer luchadora que vio la forma de cómo generar sus propios ingresos en su hogar, sin ningún jefe, ni horario. Emprendió su propio negocio de venta de cosméticos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, por iniciativa propia. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio que ofrece a sus clientes fijos, amistades y vecinos. Nos cuenta que le va muy bien y que tiene mucha clientela que hace sus pedidos por catalogo o por el stock de cosméticos que tiene. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, invertirá comprando cosméticos como perfumes, colonias, lociones y desodorantes para damas y caballeros; polvos, cremas y maquillajes para el rostro, para aumentar su stock, de tal manera que pueda tener variedad para ofertar a su clientela y así encuentren de todo en un solo sitio. 

Beatriz manifiesta que el Banco Comunal es una excelente propuesta para las mujeres que desean trabajar y progresar, hoy se siente una mujer independiente y responsable, con ganas de seguir adelante e implementar un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Community Bank "El Triunfo", meaning Triumph. She lives at 463 Amazonas in the district of San Hilarion in San Martin. She is married, 44 years old and mother to 6 children, three of whom are still under her care.

As a hard worker, she figured out a way to generate an income for her household, work without a boss, and without a set schedule. She took up cosmetics sales with the first loan she received amounting to S/.300. She contiues with that same business and she has established a solid clientele, mostly friends and neighbors. It has been going very well and she counts on a large client base, taking orders through a catalogue and selling the inventory of cosmetics she has on hand.

This loan of S/.1500 she will invest in the purchase of products such as perfumes, colognes, lotions and deodorants for ladies and gentlemen, body powders, creams and make up. She wil replenish her inventory so that she will have selection to offer her clientele, so that they will find all they need in one spot.

Beatrz says that the Community Bank is an excellent resource for women wishing to work and advance themselves. Today she is an independent and responsible woman, with a strong desire to keep going and develop her business even more.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics (perfumes, colognes, lotions, deodorants and make up) for ladies and gentlemen.

loans.name: Abelardo

texts.es: Abelardo tiene 33 años, al independizarse de sus padres encontró en la labor de zapatero una buena opción de trabajo. Esta actividad la ejerce desde hace 15 años dentro del mercado principal de su distrito donde hay mayor concurrencia de personas, por lo tanto mayor demanda, lo cual le favorece. Su puesto está abierto desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde, tiempo en el cual logra atender a gran cantidad de personas. Abelardo recuerda que se inició como ayudante de zapatero y ahora no sólo repara zapatos, sino que adquirió una máquina con la que confecciona calzado según el modelo solicitado. Él considera que este progreso pudo lograrlo sólo con el apoyo de su familia, por lo que espera seguir creciendo y conseguir pronto un puesto independiente, ya que el que tiene actualmente lo comparte con otros zapateros. Este es su 8vo crédito con MFP y está muy contento porque dentro de su banco comunal la participación de todos los miembros es muy activa, teniendo una misma meta como grupo, el progreso. Los 1000 soles que solicita le darán la posibilidad de comprar materiales para la elaboración de  nuevos modelos de zapatos que desea exhibir para incrementar sus pedidos.
texts.en:
When 33-year old Abelardo left home 15 years ago, he found good work as a shoe mender in the busy market in his neighbourhood. The greater the demand for his work, the better off he becomes. His stall is open from 8am to 6pm, and during these hours he sees many customers. Abelardo remembers his beginnings as a shoe mender’s assistant; now he not only repairs shoes, he has also acquired a machine that makes shoes according to the style asked for by the customer. He believes that he could only have achieved all this with the support of his family, and for this reason he hopes to continue expanding his business and eventually owning his own stall. At the moment he shares a space with other shoe menders. This is his eighth loan with Kiva partner, MFP, and he is very happy to be part of a community bank where all the members are very active and have the same goal: to make progress. The 1000 soles loan will give him the opportunity to buy materials with which to make new styles of shoes to display and earn him more orders.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shoe mending materials

loans.name: Roque

texts.en:
Mr. Roque J. is 40 years old and is married to Mrs. Olinda, who is 28 years old. The couple has two children who are in school. They live in their own home in the city of Villa Florida.

Roque is the owner of a small grocery store and a butcher shop that is connected to the store. In this store he sells general items, as well as clothing (winter clothing and undergarments). This business has been running for over six years and is attended to by his wife and himself.

When Roque started his business he started with a very small investment and with very little merchandise in his grocery store. As time passed, his business grew substantially and he formed a stable clientele base. This business helps him pay off any debts he has.

loans.use: To purchase winter clothing

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos tiene 52 años, está casado y es padre de 6 hijos, por quienes viene trabajando arduamente; entre otras cosas, construyó con sus propias manos la casa donde ahora habitan, por lo que su familia aprecia el esfuerzo que diariamente realiza. Hace 30 años viene trabajando como maestro de obras en construcción según los contratos que tiene con las edificaciones de viviendas en su distrito, donde es muy conocido por la eficiente labor que realiza. Esta actividad la aprendió desde muy joven de su padre y él la ha ido perfeccionando con el paso del tiempo. Su labor demanda mucho esfuerzo físico, pues tiene que cargar los diversos materiales de construcción y operar con mucho cuidado cada máquina que utiliza, por lo que la experiencia le ha enseñado a ser muy cuidadoso y prevenido. Para un futuro cercano, Carlos desea  adquirir su propia maquinaria para dejar de pagar los costos del alquiler de éstas. Este es su 9no préstamo con MFP, donde el entusiasmo y cooperación que hay en su grupo han sido determinantes para el crecimiento de su banco comunal. Con los 2000 soles que solicita renovará algunas herramientas que ya están deterioradas por los años de uso y son indispensables para su labor.
texts.en:
52-year old Carlos is married and has six children; he works hard to support his family. Amongst other projects, he built the house where they all live with his own hands. They really appreciate the amount of effort he puts in every day. He started work 30 years ago as a construction foreman building houses on contract in the area where he lives. He is well known for his efficient work. As a young man, he learned this trade from his father and has been perfecting it ever since. The work requires much physical strength because he has to carry various kinds of construction materials, and to operate very carefully each of the machines that he uses. His work has taught him to be very careful and well organized. In the not too distant future, Carlos wants to acquire his own equipment so that he doesn’t have to pay the cost of renting it. This is his ninth loan with Kiva partner MFP. The enthusiasm and cooperation amongst the members of his group have been determining factors in the growth of the community bank. With the 2000 soles loan, Carlos will buy new tools to replace the ones that are worn out from years of use. Without these tools he would not be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy new construction tools

loans.name: Claudelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Claudelina F. is single and owns her own well-furnished home.  She is a small entrepreneur who buys and sells men's and women's clothing from Buenos Aires, Argentina.  Claudelina sells the clothing to her clients, who are public workers.  She has her own vehicle that she uses to transport her inventory.  She has a very steady customer base.  

Claudelina is requesting a loan of 3,500,000 Paraguayan guarani (or about $700 US) for the purchase of merchandise such as polos, jackets, etc.  She purchases her articles in bulk, which helps her make a larger profit from her operations.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise and clothing

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 49 años, es soltera y su prioridad es el cuidado de sus padres. Desde muy joven le agradaron las manualidades y mientras aprendía a realizarlas se involucró también en la confección de ropa, posteriormente se especializó para ser sastre, pues considera que esta actividad es muy hermosa por la elegancia de las prendas que elabora. Este oficio lo viene ejerciendo formalmente desde hace 20 años en su misma vivienda, notando que los pedidos de sus clientes son cada vez más numerosos, puesto que la calidad de su trabajo es muy buena. En su negocio, la rentabilidad se basa en que los precios que cobra son altos, debido a la calidad de las telas con las que trabaja y por el acabado que realiza. Sin embargo, para mejorar su eficiencia requiere de maquinaria, por lo que espera ahorrar lo suficiente para adquirirlas. Este es 9no crédito que tiene con Microfinanzas PRISMA y en estos 5 años ha trabajado con mucho esmero para mantener unánimes a todas sus compañeras en beneficio de su banco comunal. Con los 1000 soles que solicita comprará las telas que requiere para la confección de las prendas que tiene pendientes por entregar.
texts.en:
Carmen is 49 years old, single, and lives in the city of her parents. Since she was very young, doing craftwork has given her pleasure and while she learned to do them she also got involved in making clothing. Later she specialized in being a tailor, since she considered this activity to be very beautiful because of the elegance of the dresses that she made. She has been practicing this trade for twenty years in her own home, taking notice that the requests have always been increasing in number due to the quality of her work. In her business, the profitability is based on the high prices that she charges, due to the quality of the fabrics with which she works and the finishing job that she does. Nevertheless, to improve her efficiency she needs a machine, for which she is hoping to save enough to purchase. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and in these five years she has worked with much care to benefit her community bank. With this 1000 Soles that she is requesting, she will buy fabric that she needs to make the dresses that she still needs to deliver.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny tiene 20 años, su mayor anhelo es el progreso de su familia, vive con sus padres y con ellos comparte grandes sueños de progreso. Desde pequeña se interesó por la actividad de su madre, quien le enseñó lo necesario para ejercer el oficio de costurera; sin embargo, sus ansias de aprender fueron mayores y decidió estudiar la carrera técnica de confección durante 3 años. Al ampliar sus conocimientos y habilidades abrió un taller de costura en el segundo piso de su vivienda donde trabaja confeccionando diversos diseños de prendas deportivas, puesto que generalmente trabaja con algunos colegios que la contratan para elaborar los uniformes para alumnos y profesores. Debido a la gran demanda por su trabajo se asoció con su madre para incrementar su producción. Es así que juntas tratan de atender todos los pedidos que reciben, sobre todo en las épocas escolares donde hay mayor demanda; lo cual la obligan, en ocasiones, a trabajar toda la noche, sacrificio que tendrá su recompensa cuando logre su anhelo de ampliar su taller con maquinaria nueva. Ser parte de su banco comunal la ayudó a relacionarse con sus vecinas con quienes comparte buenos momentos en su grupo dentro de MFP, ya que todas se involucran en el desarrollo y progreso de su organización. Los 1600 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra tela para la confección de las prendas de su último pedido, para cumplir a tiempo con la entrega.
texts.en:
Jenny is 20, and her biggest wish is for the family’s progress. She lives with her parents, and they share big dreams of progress. Since she was little she has been interested in her mother’s activity. He mother taught her the importance of sewing. Nevertheless, she was worried about learning. She decided to study tailoring for three years. With her increased knowledge and skills, she opened a seamstress shop on the second floor of her house. That is where she makes various designs of sports garments. She usually works with some colleagues she has hired to make uniforms for students and teachers. Due to the great demand for her work, her mother has joined her in order to increase production. Together they try to fill all of the orders they receive. The biggest demand is when school is in session. During this time they sometimes have to work all night. This sacrifice will be worth it when she is able to make her wish, expanding her shop with new machinery, come true. Being part of her community bank helped her to connect with her neighbors. They share good times in their group within MFP. All of them are involved in the development and progress of their organization. The 1,600 PEN that she is asking for is to buy fabric to make garments in order to complete her last order on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
Nicolasa runs a small grocery store with her sister.  When her husband had an accident at work, Nicolasa was obliged to work in order to support the living expenses of her family.  She sold lottery tickets for a while.  After saving some money, she was able to open her grocery.  The store grew little by little and, eventually, her sister transferred all her rights to Nicolasa, so that she is now the sole owner of her small business.

Nicolasa applied for this loan in order to purchase goods such as sugar, herbs, rice, noodles, breads, dairy porducts, and beverages.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise such as sugar, herbs, rice, noodles, breads, dairy products and drinks

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Nazarenas”, vive en el Jr. Bolognesi Nº 224, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 56 años y un hijo que aun depende de ella.

Deseando ver profesional a su hijo y tener sus propios ingresos, decidió emprender su propio negocio. Nos cuenta que en su vida paso por muchos problemas, su carácter emprendedor que la caracteriza y las ganas de salir a adelante, le ha valido para iniciar su propio negocio de venta de comidas preparadas. Hilda vende sus comidas en su misma casa, en un espacio acondicionado para atender a sus clientes. Poco a poco fue haciéndose muy conocida entre sus clientes que son sus vecinos, amigos y familiares. Por su buena sazón sus ventas le van muy bien, vende comida en las mañanas y en las tardes.

Con este préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, invertirá comprando insumos para sus preparados como: sacos de arroz y azúcar, pollos y huevos en javas, plátanos en racimos, fideos y aceites por docena, asimismo utensilios de cocina para brindar un servicio de calidad.  

Hilda, aún se siente con muchas fuerzas para seguir con la venta de comidas, posteriormente desea implementar mas su negocio con un Restaurant bien acondicionado para brindar a sus clientes un mejor servicio y atención. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  con el cumplimiento de sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Hilda belongs to the Las Nazarenas Community Bank. She lives at Jr. Bolognesi Nº 224, Bellavista district, San Martín province, San Martín department. She is 56, married, and has one son who is still dependent upon her. She wanted her son to see her as a professional with their own income, so she decided to start her own business. She has had many problems in her life. But her enterprising character and her desire to get ahead served her well in order to start her own business of selling prepared meals. Hilda sells her meals in her own house. She has set up a space to wait on her customers. Little by little she has become very well known for her good cooking among her customers who are her neighbors, friends, and family. Her sales are going very well. She sells food in the mornings and in the afternoons. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy ingredients like sacks of rice and sugar, chicken, crates of eggs, bunches of bananas, noodles, oil by the dozen, and cooking utensils to prepare her meals and offer quality service. Hilda still feels that she has a lot of strength to keep selling her food. In the future, she would like to set up her business as a restaurant that is able to offer her customers better service and attention. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to the fulfillment of her dreams and goals.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies (rice, sugar, eggs, chicken, bananas, and cooking utensils) in order to provide better service

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela es una madre de familia que lucha por el bienestar de sus seres queridos, sobre todo de su pareja quien se encuentra delicado de salud, y por sus hijos quienes son muy colaboradores con las actividades dentro de su casa. Desde que su esposo tuvo problemas de salud se hizo cargo de su taller de carpintería y gracias a que siempre estuvo involucrada en esta actividad no le fue difícil hacerlo. Es por ello que desde hace 3 años se dedica a la administración del negocio, la compra de los materiales y la realización del acabado de algunos muebles, puesto que la elaboración en sí de los muebles está a cargo de otras personas a quienes contrata. Uno de los mayores beneficios es que su taller se encuentra en su propia casa, lo cual le ayuda a estar pendiente de todos los pedidos y entregas que realizan durante el mes, de esta manera las personas pueden acudir a cualquier momento del día al taller y las atiende durante todo el día. Para un futuro cercano, Marcela desea incrementar su maquinaria para agilizar el trabajo y para que sus hijos, quienes vienen aprendido esta labor, puedan ayudarla en la producción. Este es su 9no crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, son casi 5 años los que viene trabajando junto a las compañeras de su banco comunal, quienes tratan siempre de relacionarse en armonía y cooperación mutua. Con los 1000 soles que solicita adquirirá la madera que necesita para la producción de los muebles que requiere para cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Marcela is a housewife and mother who is always striving to provide well-being to her loved ones, particularly to her partner who is ill, and to her children who are very helpful around the house.
