She has been managing the carpentry shop ever since her husband started having health problems, which she has been able to do without problems, because she was used to that type of work. This is why since about 3 years ago she has been managing the business, including the purchasing of materials and the finishing work on some furniture pieces; the fabrication of furniture is done by people whom she employs. The fact that the shop is located in her home is very helpful, because it helps her to be on top of the day-to-day activities, such as the control of deliveries and purchases, as well as giving her the ability to be available for clients at any time during the day. In a not to distant future, Marcela would like to increase the number of machines in order to expedite the work so that her children, who have already learned this trade, can help her with production. This is her ninth loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and it's been about five years that she has been working with her peers from the community bank, who always maintain a cordial and harmonious mutual relationship. The 1000 soles that she has requested will be used to buy wood for the production of the furniture needed to satisfy orders.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de madera

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra tiene 25 años, su interés es ayudar a su familia con los gastos del hogar y aminorar las preocupaciones de su madre por las necesidades dentro de casa. Desde hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa al crédito, visita a gran cantidad de personas   en sus domicilios con la finalidad de recibir sus pedidos, esto lo realiza de lunes a viernes, puesto que los fines de semana, en especial a fin de mes, compra su mercadería en las fábricas de ropa y en el mercado central de su ciudad. Sandra les da la facilidad a sus clientes de pagarle en cuotas pequeñas durante el mes, tiempo en que las visita periódicamente para cobrarles. Todo este proceso es muy cansado, debido a la distancia que tiene que recorrer para sus visitas, lo cual es una inversión en tiempo y dinero que tiene que saber aprovechar debidamente. Su mayor  anhelo es conseguir una tienda donde pueda vender sus prendas y dejar de realizar estos largos recorridos, además de establecerse en un local donde la puedan visitar sus clientas. Este es su 9no crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA, ella está muy contenta en su banco comunal porque existe armonía e identificación con el logro de sus metas. Con los 1800 soles adquirirá la mercadería que requiere, ya que se quedó sin prendas por la falta de capital de inversión.
texts.en:
Sandra is 25 years old. She is interested in helping her family with household expenses, thus ameliorating her mother's worries about the running of the household. For about three years she has been selling clothing on credit, visiting a great number of people at their homes in order to receive their orders. She does this from Mondays through Fridays, utilizing the weekends to purchase her merchandise at the wholesale clothing shops and the central market in her town. Sandra gives credit to her clients who pay her in small installments during the month, when she visits them regularly to collect. This entire process is very labor intensive and tiring, due to the long distances she has to cover in her visits. This is large investment in time and money which she has to manage quite carefully. Her biggest desire is to obtain a shop where she can sell her articles and stop making all those trips, as well as establish herself in a permanent location where her clients can visit her. This is her ninth credit with Microfinanzas PRISMA. She is very happy with her community bank, because there is harmony and recognition of her accomplishments. With the 1800 soles that she will obtain she will buy merchandise, since her stock is totally depleted from lack of funds to replenish it.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza I Group

texts.en:
The committee Nueva Esperanza (“A New Hope”) was formed on July 2nd, 2008, and is made up of eighteen women from the city of Itá.  This group formed thanks to Mrs. Nancy S., who talked to a loan officer in the area about starting a group in the Women Entrepreneurs program.  She was very enthusiastic and anxious to be able to work with this program, and the group is now in their fourth cycle with the Fundación Paraguaya. 

The average credit given to an individual in the committee is 800,000 Paraguayan guarani.  The participants use their credit towards their respective activities.

1	Yohana V.--Clothing making/sales 
2	Francisca B.	--Clothing sales 
3	Graciela D.--Dressmaking
4	Elvira A.--Plant sales
5	Claudia C.--Food sales and recycling
6	Nancy S.--Clothing making/sales
7	Lidia S.--Small grocery store
8	Aída S.--Clothing, fruit and vegetable sales
9	Saturnina Benítez--Meat sales
10	María R.--Purchase and sale of recycling
11	Celsa J.--Fruit sales
12	Lorenza F.--Small grocery store
13	Teresa L.--General store
14	María D.--Food sales
15	Mirian C.--Fruit and vegetable sales
16	Silvia R.--Dressmaker
17	Justina G.--Clothing sales
18	Magdalena R.--Food sales

loans.use: The purchase of: materials for making clothes, grocery store merchandise, ingredients for making food, recycling products, meats, fabrics, fruits, vegetables, general store items, plants, etc.

loans.name: Hernan

texts.en:
Hernan is a 36-year-old grocery store owner.  He is married to Lidia Estigarribia, his wife of four years.

Hernan has worked in the industry since he was young.  His parents owned a small grocery store, which is where he learned all about being a grocer.  After he finished high school he started taking care of the family business.  Afterwards, he married his wife.  Together, they started his own business as best as he knew how.  They ran their grocery from their home, as they live right outside of the marketplace in the city of Coronel Oviedo.

As time passed, they realized that the business was successful.  They originally sold hot bread, but Herman and Lidia applied for a loan in order to diversify their products.  Today, they sell stuffed animals, thermoses, toys, paintings, and more.  The business is growing and Hernan hanks Kiva for its help.

loans.use: The purchase of clocks, paintings, stuffed animals, thermoses, toys, etc.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.es:
La señora Faustina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, es casada y madre de 04 hijos, los dos mayores son estudiantes, tiene estudios de secundaria completa y vive en el Barrio Ciudad Nueva.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela R. desde hace 10 años aproximadamente, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, ella tiene su negocio de compra y venta de carne. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, para poder invertir en su negocio con el cual comprara carne de ovino y luego lo venderá en el mercado de Yunguyo y en las ferias de la zona. Nos indica que los ovinos los compra vivos, luego los mata y así genera más ganancias.

Su deseo es poner un emporio bien surtido, le gusta las reuniones y los encuentros que realiza Manuela R. ya que en ellos se distrae mucho.
texts.en:
Mrs. Faustina belongs to the Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga," located in the Yunguyo district, in the Province of Chucuito, Department of Puno. She is 37 years old, married and has four children, the oldest two are students. She has a complete high school education; she lives in the Ciudad Nueva neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela R. Movement for approximately 10 years, with an initial loan of S/. 300. She has a business of buying and selling meat. She currently needs a loan of S/. 2000 in order to invest in her business and buy sheep's meat which she will later sell in the Yunguyo market and at the local farmers' markets. She tells us that she buys the sheep alive, which she slaughters herself in order to save money. Her desire is to establish a well stocked store. She likes the meetings and the get-togethers organized by Manuela R., because they provide an opportunity for distraction.

Translated from Spanish by Monica Hayden, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara carne de ovino.

loans.name: Elonia

texts.en:
Elonia is a widow from the city of Santani.  She has a store in the city market where she sells fruits and vegetables to a steady clientele. 

She is a hardworking woman.  Thanks to her efforts, she has been able to build a house and educate her children. 

Her greatest wish is to have another store that she can run as a sound business and where she can offer quality service to her clients.

loans.use: The purchase of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Dumy Evangelina

texts.en:
Mrs. Dumy S. R. is from the San Agustin district of San Estanislao. She has two children. Additionally, she is the owner of a hair salon which she runs from her home. She has many of the tools she needs and has a well-established clientele, which generates a good income.

This client is applying for a loan in order to buy articles for her hair salon in order to meet the needs of her clients. She hopes to increase her clientele and, through this, her income.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise for her hair salon

loans.name: Julia Magaly

texts.es:
La señora Julia Magaly Briceño M. tiene 39 años, vive en la calle San Lucas Nº 702 del distrito de la Esperanza parte Baja, Provincia de Trujillo en el Departamento de La Libertad. Estudió secundaria completa, tiene 2 hijas que dependen económicamente de ella.

Julia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes hace 15 días, inició su negocio vendiendo ropa por un lapso de 2 años, la cual desarrolla en su casa. Con su primer crédito de S/.300.00, que recibió de su Banco comunal Nueva Esperanza  II, lo invirtió en la compra de polos, casacas, pantalones.

Con este préstamo de S/.1500.00, lo invertirá en la compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, fideos, golosinas y gaseosas para implementar su bodega.

Julia desea cumplir el sueño de tener su minimarket para crecer como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Julia Magaly Briceño M., 39, lives on San Lucas Street Nº 702, in the lower part of the Esperanza district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department. She has two daughters who are economically dependent upon her. Julia started selling groceries fifteen days ago. She started her business of selling clothes two years ago; the business is in her house. With her first loan of 300 PEN, which she received from her Community Bank, Nueva Esperanza II, she bought polos, jackets, and pants. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy products like rice, sugar, noodles, sweets, and soft drinks to set up her store. Julia wishes to make her dream of having a mini market come true in order to grow as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products like rice, sugar, noodles, candy, and soft drinks to set up her mini market

loans.name: Cesar Sergio

texts.es:
Don Cesar Sergio A. L., es oriundo de la ciudad de La Paz y tiene 37 años, el señor es soltero y actualmente no tiene hijos. Don Cesar  vive en la casa de su padre.
Son diez años los que trabaja ya como chofer propietario en una línea de radio taxi , al igual que su padre y su hermano. 
El vehículo con el que cuenta se encuentra en muy buen estado, pues don Cesar sabe que debe hacerle un mantenimiento preventivo, ya que de lo contrario el vehiculo se puede deteriorar más rapidamente. El credito nesecita para comprar una radio de comunicacion y llantas para su vehiculo.
texts.en:
Cesar Sergio A. L. is a native of the city of La Paz. He is 37 and single. He currently has no children. Cesar lives in his parents’ house. For ten years he has worked driving his own vehicle for a radio taxi (public taxi) line. His father and brother drive taxis also. His vehicle is in very good shape. Cesar knows that he needs to have preventative maintenance performed. If he does not, the vehicle could deteriorate more rapidly. He needs the loan to buy a radio for communication and tires for his vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a radio and tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Antanacio

texts.en:
Mr. Antanacio is 37 years old and single. He owns a business in the center of the city where he sells general merchandise  He also is an important livstock farmer who raises cattle. He owns his land, and has all the equipment needed to raise livestock. He also owns his a comfortable hone in downtown Pilar.  

Antanacio has been in these lines of business for the last eight years, and is applying for this loan to buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.use: the buy meat, vegetables and other items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Dominga De La Cruz

texts.es:
Actualmente, en el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora Dominga D. se dedica a la comercialización  de carne de res, cerdo y pollo en su propio establecimiento donde a diario atiende a sus clientes.

Ella es una dama muy esforzada y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la carne porque requiere adquirirla para comercializarla y por medio de esto, mejorar sus ingresos y la situación de vida de ella y de su amada familia.
texts.en:
Dominga D. sells beef, pork and chicken in the Wholesale Market in the city of Managua. She has her own establishment where she waits on her customers daily. She is a woman who tries very hard. She is asking Ceprodel for a loan to buy meat because she needs to get the meat to sell it. This way she will improve her earnings and the quality of life for her and her beloved family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat

loans.name: Lucila Sotera

texts.es:
Doña Lucila Sotera C., nació en la ciudad D. La Paz, tiene 42 años D. edad, se encuentra separada D. su esposo, pero vive en el domicilio D. su suegra. 
Doña Lucila se dedica a comerciar con aceituna, orégano, arroz peruano, ají en vaina, plásticos; su mercadería lo compra del desaguadero, acomodando en la ciudad D. La Paz a clientes ya conocidos, además D. a nuevos clientes. Su mercado es por la Landaeta, Buenos Aires, San Pedro; generalmente son broasterías y almacenes.
texts.en:
Doña Lucila Sotera C. was born in the city of La Paz. She is 42 years of age and separated from her husband, but she lives in the home of her mother-in-law. Doña Lucila works at selling olives, oregano, peruvian rice, chili pods and plasticware. She buys her merchandise from the Desaguadero region and distributes it in the city of La Paz to established customers as well as to new customers. Usually, they are restaurants and grocery stores. Her market is by Landaeta Street and Buenos Aires Avenue, in the San Pedro neighborhood of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: María Victoria

texts.es:
La venta de frutas es el negocio al que se dedica la señora María Victoria P. en el mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua donde ofrece todo tipo de frutas a sus clientes que visitan a diario el mercado.

A pesar que no posee un terreno en buenas condiciones para el negocio, ella ha logrado salir adelante por medio de la venta de las frutas. Por esto es que espera muy confiadamente en que Ceprodel le brinde un crédito para dar lugar a la compra de las frutas y seguirlas comercializando en su localidad.
texts.en:
María Victoria P. dedicates herself to the sale of fruits in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua where she offers all types of fruit to her clients that visit her daily. Even though her plot of land is not in good conditions for her business, she has been able to get ahead through the sale of fruits. Because of this she confidently hopes that Ceprodel will provide her a loan to purchase fruit and continue selling in her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fruit.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.en:
The Banco Comunal Virgen of Fatima is part of the Wari I project. Its members are of the community of La Merced, in the La Merced District, of the Churcampa Province. Most of the population raises livestock, is into agriculture such as growing potatoes, corn, barley, wheat, or is into commercial goods.

For example, Delia is married and has four children. She started her business by selling fruit and vegetables in the city of Huanta, and gradually she grew her capital. Now she sells small animals, which she buys in fairs. With the loan that she will receive, she will buy more small animals. Delia’s dreams are to educate her children so they will become professionals and also to save for her retirement.

Elsa is a single mother who has three children, 12, 9, and 2 years old. Elsa sells fruit and vegetables in the different fairs of the region. With the loan, she wants to buy more fruit and vegetables. Elsa’s dreams are to buy land for her home and to have her own store for her business. Elsa is saving to buy vaccinated livestock to fatten.

loans.use: To purchase small animals, fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Aquilina

texts.en:
Aquilina is a member of Banco Comunal Sumaqcha which means Beautiful in Quechua. She is married, is 53 years old, and has three children.

Aquilina has Internet cubicles in her home, a business that is run by her and her children in their free time. She also sells candy. She also sells topical ointments in her home where she works every day. She is a trained nurse technician.

Aquilina needs a loan of 1,000 soles which she will use to buy more candy and to repair some of her equipment. Her dreams are to have her own jewelry store and that her children will finish their studies.

loans.use: To buy more candy and to repair some of her equipment

loans.name: Susam Veronica

texts.es:
Doña Susam Verónica López, está casado con don Jesús Escalante Jesús, con quien tiene dos niños. Don Jesús trabaja como chofer propietario en la línea de radio taxi El Rey ya dos años. Los dos viven en la casa de la mamá de doña Susam.
Doña Susam tiene dos actividades, una de ellas es como niñera en la guardería de la alcaldía ubicada en el mercado Yungas y su otra actividad es la venta de embutidos, los mismos que los compra en la ciudad de La Paz y los vende por intermediación de su mamá en la ciudad de Caranavi. El credito invertira en la compra de cerveza, para despues vender en la fiesta patronal de Jesus del Gran Poder, esta es una de las fiestas mas grandes de la ciudad de La Paz.
texts.en:
Susam Verónica López is married to Jesús Escalante Jesús, with whom she has two children. Jesús has been working as a taxi driver for the radio taxi company El Rey for two years. The two of them live in Susam's mother's house.

Susam has two jobs. One is working as a children's caretaker in the daycare in the mayor's office, located in the Yungas market. The other job is selling sausages/cold cuts, which she buys in La Paz and sells through her mother in the city of Caranavi.

She will invest her loan in buying beer to sell during the celebration of the patron saint's day, Jesus del Gran Poder, which is one of the largest celebrations of the city of La Paz.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying beer to sell during the Jesus del Gran Poder holiday

loans.name: Lysbel Lida

texts.en:
Lysbel is a member of Banco Comunal Sumaqcha, which means Beautiful in Quechua.

Lysbel is single, 23 years old, and lives with her parents. She studies accounting and she sells cosmetics from catalogs, products that she offers her friends and acquaintances, and which she sells primarily on credit. She is planning to start a new business in selling clothing by request.

Lysbel needs a loan of 1,000 soles which she will use to buy clothing and makeup. Her dreams are to finish her current career and have her own stable business and office.

loans.use: To buy clothing and makeup

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of Banco Comunal Sumaqcha, which means Beautiful in Quechua. She is single, 42 years old, and has four children.

Felicitas travels to the different fairs in the region where she sells fruit and buys grain. She also buys cheese, small animals, and products which she sells in the markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Felicitas needs a loan of 1,000 soles which she will use to buy grain and cheese. Her dreams are to build her own home using good materials and to buy land in the Ayacuchan forest to plant cacao.

loans.use: To buy grain and cheese

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Managua, específicamente en el mercado Mayoreo, la señora Lidia P. se dedica a su negocio de ferretería donde vende todo tipo de productos ferreteros los cuales son comercializados por ella misma en su localidad.

Actualmente ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos ferreteros porque requiere invertir en estos para ofrecerlos en su negocio y así percibir mayores utilidades para su desarrollo.
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, specifically in the Market Mayoreo, Lidia P. dedicates herself to her hardware business where she sells all types of hardware products; she sells these products herself in her neighborhood. Presently she has sought support at Ceprodel to solicit a loan to purchase hardware products because she needs to invest in these products to offer them in her business to receive higher earnings that will help in her development.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase hardware products.

loans.name: Orfita

texts.es:
ORFITA D. JESUS V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS”  en el Distrito D. Calleria, tiene 42 años, 2 hijos, y su esposo es chofer.

Ella vendía juanes en su barrio, el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos fue D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, que invirtió en compra D. algunos huevos por docenas, arroz, pollos, etc. para preparar los juanes y luego venderlos a sus vecinos. Ahora tiene un pequeño puesto en la vereda D. su casa en donD. venD. huevos, pollo, menestras, etc.
 
Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00 ampliara el negocio comprando una mesa mas y con lo que queda comprara mas víveres para surtir su negocio.

Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con el servicio que da al contribuir con las mujeres D. esta región.
texts.en:
Orfita D. J. V. belongs to the Mujeres Solidarias Community Bank. She lives in the Calleria district. She is 42, has 2 children, and her husband is a driver. She sells “juanes” (a traditional dish in the Peruvian rainforest). She used her first loan of 300 PEN to buy dozens of eggs, rice, chicken, etc. to prepare the juanes to then sell to her neighbors. She now has a small stand on the pavement outsiD. of her house where she sells eggs, chicken, vegetable stew, etc. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will expand her business and buy one more table. With what is left, she will buy supplies to stock her business. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community by contributing to the women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various food and a table to expand her business

loans.name: Gloria Amanda

texts.en:
Gloria is a member of Banco Comunal Juanito. She is single, 32 years old, and has two children.

Gloria travels to different fairs in the region where she buys grain, cheese, and products that she takes to the Ayacuchan forest. Also, Gloria has a grocery store that is rented and, in the evenings, she sells chicken sausage at the entrance of her store.

Gloria needs a loan of 2,600 soles which she will use to buy grain, rice, and sugar. Her dreams are to buy land to construct her home and buy a car to transport her products.

loans.use: To buy grain, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Mary Cruz

texts.es:
Doña Mary Cruz nació en la ciudad de La Paz, donde actualmente vive, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada con el señor Cristhian Alvarez Escalera, el mismo que trabaja como chofer asalariado en el sindicato Eduardo Abaroa, Tienen 2 hijos, los mismos que aún se encuentran estudiando en la escuela.
Doña Mary Cruz tiene un Snack, el mismo que atiende por las tardes, sirviendo una variedad de platos como ser silpancho, chuleta, asado, pollo, etc. El kiosko que atiende esta en contrato de  alquiler en la populosa zona Kilometro 7.
texts.en:
Mary Cruz was born in the city of La Paz where she currently lives; she is 33 years old and is married to Cristhian Alvarez Escalera who works as a salaried chauffer in the Eduardo Abaroa labor union. They have 2 children who are still studying in school. Mary Cruz has a food stand, which she attends to in the evenings; there she serves a variety of dishes such as silpancho (a traditional Bolivian dish consisting of meat, rice, and potatoes), chops, roast, chicken, etc. She rents the kiosk that she attends to in the populous zone 7th kilometer.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an over with 6 removable shelves.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi travels to the Ayacuchan forest where she sells processed grains which she acquires from the mills. Noemi also has a store which sells spare parts. She rents the shop and her husband works there. Noemi is married, 28 years old, and has two children. She is a member of Banco Comunal Juanito.
Noemi needs a loan of 600 soles which she will use to buy more spare parts. Noemi’s dream is to have her own store and build a home in the center of the city.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Deisy De

texts.es: Deisy tiene 58 años de edad, su esposo es jubilado de la policia y recibe renta y tambien se dedica  a realizar tramites en general. Tienen su casa propia y solo una hija depende de ellos. Si bien hay mucha competencia en el rubro pero ella tiene ya sus cliente fijos a los que entrega. El credito sera destinado a la construccion de su taller de reposteria ya que actualmente funciona en su cocina y no tienen espacio para desarrollar su actividad. Es una buena cliente de agrocapital quien cancela sus cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Deisy is 58 years old. Even though her husband is retired from the police force and receiving a pension, he continues to perform general paperwork. They own a home and have one daughter who is a dependent.

While there is stiff competition in her line of business, she is not ready to hand over any of her customers. This loan is earmarked for the construction of her pastry shop. Deisy currently works out of her kitchen and does not have the space to develop her business. She is a good customer of Agrocapital and is responsible with her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of her pastry shop

loans.name: Lourdes Fany

texts.en:
Lourdes is a member of Banco Comunal Juanito. She is married, 39 years old and has two children.

Lourdes sells general groceries in different fairs in the region, and from the fairs she buys small animals, which she sells in the city of Ayacucho. Also, Lourdes has a shop in her home where she sells groceries, vegetables, and meat.

Lourdes needs a loan of 600 soles which she will use to buy rice, sugar, and milk. Her dreams are to finish constructing her home and to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, and milk

loans.name: Eloina

texts.es: Eloina tiene 50 años de edad, vive modestamente en su casa propia donde tiene su taller instalado. Su familia tambien vive con ella y tambien sus nietos. Eloina tiene su taller de confeccion ubicado en su casa por lo que ya no tiene espacio para su trabajo por lo que esta construyendo un cuarto para su taller. Tiene muchos años de experiencia en esta actividad y clientes fijos. El credito sera invertido en la construccion de su taller de confeccion.Es una buena cliente de agrocapital que cancela sus cuotas con puntualidad.
texts.en:
Eloina is 50 years old, and lives modestly in her own house where she has her workshop installed. Her family also lives with her, as do her grandchildren. Eloina has a dressmaking workshop located in her house, because of which she now doesn't have room to work, so she is constructing a room for her workshop. She has many years of experience in dressmaking and secure clients. The loan will be invested in the construction of her workshop. She is a good client of Agrocapital who pays off her loans with punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of dressmaking workshop

loans.name: Candelario

texts.en: Candelario is a 62-year-old married man and has eight children, three of whom still live with him. He has a shop called Moto B., which is located in his home. From this shop, he sells spare parts and cars, as well as offering repair services. To run his business he counts on the help of an employee. Candelario is requesting a loan of 1600 PEN which he will use to buy more spare parts. His dreams are to improve his home by constructing a second floor, and expand his business by selling more products. Candelario is a member of Banco Comunal Juanito.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is a 62-year-old single man who has two children. He owns a radio station called Frequency A Record, which he runs out of his home with the help of two employees. Isaac is also a journalist, and he has a program that makes use of his journalistic style. Isaac is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN, which he will use to buy a new computer. His dreams are to continue progressing, improving his business, and building his home. Isaac is a member of Banco Comunal Juanito.

loans.use: To buy a new computer

loans.name: Charito

texts.es:
Charito, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en el Jr. Ucayali S/N°, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martin, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 28 años y 01 hijo que aun depende de ella.

Desde hace muchos años, Charito se dedica a la venta de leña, en sus inicios nos cuenta que le fue un poco bajo en sus ventas, pero con el tiempo ya que sus amigos, vecinos y familiares conocían su negocio, sus ventas aumentaron. Se inicio con S/. 300.00 y poco a poco fue ahorrando, en la actualidad complementó su negocio con la venta de chupetes y chichas, ubicada en su misma casa, con una área bien acondicionada.

Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr, es implementar una bodega grande con sus productos de abarrotes, para generar más sus ingresos y aportar económicamente dentro de su hogar.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, comprara 200 tercios de leña. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá en insumos para preparar sus chupetes y chichas como: azúcar, esencias y frutas. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio a ella y a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Charito belongs to the "El Triunfo" communal bank and lives on Ucayali Street in the District of San Hilarión, San Martín Province, in the state of San Martín. She is married, 28 years old and has one son that is dependent on her. For many years Charito has been selling firewood. She says that in the beginning her sales were low, but with time her friends and family helped her to increase her sales. She started with 300 Nuevos Soles loan and little by little saved; currently, she supplements her business by selling ice pops and chicha (alcoholic beverage) from her house, in an well air-conditioned area. One of her dreams is to set up a large store selling groceries in order to generate more income and to provide more economic support to her household. With this loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles she will by 200 tercios(unit of measure) of firewood. Part of the money will also be invested in ingredients to prepare her ice pops and chicha, such as sugar, syrups and fruit. Nowadays she feels like a very accomplished woman, with desire to reach and make real her dreams. She is thankful to the Manuela Ramos organization for helping her start her business as well as many other women that want to grow entrepreneurially.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood and ingredients for her ice pops and chicha

loans.name: Christian

texts.es:
El socio  CHRISTIAN, vive en la provincia D. Calca en el distrito D. huandor, ubicado a 1 hora 30 minutos desD. la ciudad del Cusco. 

Nuestro socio tiene 23 años y es soltero;  alterna sus diferentes actividades con el comercio minorista, el arregla todo tipo D. celulares, compra y venD. los mismos y con ellos los accesorios D. diferentes celulares. El socio desea el préstamo en razón a que el dinero adquirido le permitirá comprar un mayor número D. accesorios y repuestos para así tener más clientes.

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. su deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Associate Christian lives in the province of Calca in Huandor Disctrict, located 1 hour and 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. He is 23 years old and is single; he alternates his different activities in retail traD., repairing cell phones, buying and selling cell phones and accessories. Christian desires a loan and with the acquired money will buy a larger number of accessories and parts so he can have more clients. He thanks and values the loan granted by these means and promises to fulfil his payments to service his debt in the established time.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy accessories and parts for cell phones

loans.name: Zelena Del Socorro

texts.es: Zelena del Socorro C. tiene 53 años de edad. Es una mujer casada. Su actividad económica es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, Zelena no tenía dinero suficiente para sufragar los gastos de su vivienda, ya que su familia le mostraban el apoyo necesario sacar adelante su negocio hoy en día se siente muy satisfecha por su valentía y ánimos de luchar por la vida. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo y así invertirlo en la compra de lápiz labial, cremas, perfumes entre otros. Los deseos  son de establecer una tienda en su vivienda para seguir viviendo por medio de este negocio.
texts.en:
Zelena del Socorro C. is 53 and married. She has been selling cosmetics for over 5 years. Zelena did not have enough money to cover the household expenses. Her family gave her the necessary support to get ahead in her business. She is pleased that she found the strength and courage to fight. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy lipstick, cream, and perfume, among others. Her wish is to establish a store in her house so that she can keep earning a living from this business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Carlota Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Carlota, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Triunfo”, vive en el Jr. San Martín S/Nº, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia de San Martín Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 50 años, 03 hijos y 02 que aun dependen de ella.

Se inicio con la venta de  golosinas, vendiendo en una maleta en ocasiones donde había fiestas o actividades deportivas, generó buenos ingresos y hoy en día implemento un ambiente de su propia casa en un salón donde vende sus golosinas, nos cuenta que se inició con S/.150.00 y esta muy contenta con el trabajo que hace.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, lo invertirá comprando golosinas como: chocolates sublime y cañonazo, chupetines, chicles y galletas, caramelos en diferentes sabores y marcas; para así satisfacer a sus clientes, parte del dinero también lo invertira cancelando la penúltima cuota de su refrigeradora de segunda mano que compró.

Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, cree que su trabajo y el empeño que le pone le permitirá cumplir sus sueños y metas que tiene trazado en su vida. Así mismo agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por brindarle apoyo a ella y mujeres que quieren salir adelante.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carlota belongs to the “El Triunfo (The Triumph)” Communal Bank. She lives in San Martin, District of San Hilarion, Province of San Martin, Region of San Martin. She has a partner, is 50 years old, and has three children of which two depend on her.

She began selling candies, selling from a case on occasions where there were parties or sporting events and she produced good profits. Today she has installed an area in a room in her home where she sells candies. She tells us that she did it with 150 PEN and is very happy with the job she did.

This loan of 1000 PEN she will invest in the purchase of candies such as: Sublime and Cañonazo brand chocolate bars, lollipops, chewing gum and cookies, and caramels of different flavors and brands in order to satisfy her customers. Part of the loan will also be invested in paying off the secondhand refrigerator that she bought.

She feels very satisfied with the work she has accomplished, and believes that the work and the determination she has put in will allow her to achieve her dreams and goals that she has set for her life. For the same reasons she is grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for providing support to her and women who want to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase candies such as chocolates, lollipops and cookies of various brands

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Work capital (to purchase disinfectants, soaps, cleaning gel, and detergents).

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El Señor Carlos Alberto E. tiene la edad de 48 años. Su estado civil es casado. Tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y todos estudian. La actividad económica de Carlos es brindar el servicio de taxi. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio, Carlos comenzó este negocio por su necesidad de proporcionarles a sus hijos el alimento diario, Carlos tuvo dificultades al inicio ya que no estaba muy bien de salud por lo que todo el día recorría las calles y tenia problemas en la columna, y muchas veces tenia que soportar el dolor para cubrir con la responsabilidad de ofrecer el alimento diario a su familia. El  motivo del financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos, mantenimiento del vehiculo y además comprar llantas y reparar los asientos. El sueño de Carlos es comprar otro vehiculo y enseñarle a sus hijos a ganarse la vida de una manera decente.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto E. is 48 years old and married. He has 2 children under his care who both study. Carlos offers taxi services. He has dedicated himself to this business for over 5 years. Carlos started this business due to his necessity to provide food daily to his children; at first Carlos faced difficulties due his poor health that was caused by his daily street travels that gave him spine problems. Many times he has to endure the pain to fulfill his responsibilities of providing his family food daily. The purpose of the loan is to serve as work capital to purchase parts, carry out vehicle maintenance, purchase tires, and repair the seats. Carlos’ dreams of purchasing another vehicle and teaching his children to earn an honest living.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital (to purchase parts, carry out vehicle maintenance, purchase tires, and repair the seats).

loans.name: Libertad Solina

texts.es:
LIBERTAD SOLINAS V. D. V., pertenece al Banco Comunal “MUJERES SOLIDARIAS” en el Distrito D. Calleria, tiene 64 años, 7 hijos y su esposo tiene un fundo.

Ella vendía comida por las noches en la vereda D. su casa, y el primer préstamo que recibió D. Manuela Ramos fue D. S/.300.00, con el que invirtió en compra D. alimentos como: pollos, pescado, verduras, etc. Con el pasar del tiempo cambio D. negocio y ahora tiene una bodega que está creciendo.

Con este préstamo D. S/.2,000.00, invertirá en la compra D. más productos para surtir su bodega y así satisfacer a sus clientes.

Esta Agradecida con Manuela Ramos por ser una institución que sirve a la comunidad con los préstamos que da a las mujeres D. esta región.
texts.en:
Libertad Solinas V. D. V. belongs to the Mujeres Solidarias in the Calleria district. She is 64 and has 7 children. Her husband has a farm. She sold food in the evenings on the pavement outsiD. of her house. With the first loan of 300 PEN that she received from Manuela Ramos, she bought food like chicken, fish, vegetables, etc. In time she changed businesses, and she now has a store that is growing. With this loan for 2,000 PEN she will buy more products to stock her store and satisfy her customers. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for being an institution that serves the community with the loans they give to women of this region.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various products to stock her store

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana Antonia R. D. M. D. 58 años D. edad, redice en Cojutepeque, departamento D. Cuscatlán.  Vive únicamente junto a su esposo José M. D. 60 años D. edad. La señora Juana posee desD. hace 20 años una pupusería; negocio a través del cual ha logrado solventar todos sus gastos durante muchos años. Juana solícita un préstamo a través D. cual pueda mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, comprar más materia prima por mayor, tales como maíz, frijoles, arroz,  entre otros más, así D. esta manera ella espera mejorar su negocio y poder obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Juana Antonia R. D. M. is 58 years old and resides in the Cojutepeque, department of Cuscatlán. She lives with her husband José M. who is 60 years old. Juana has owned a pupuseria (a food stand that serves pupusas, a stuffed thick tortilla like El Salvadorian dish) for 20 years; through this business she had been able to settle her expenses for many years. Juana is requesting a loan through which she will be able to improve her business’ condition, and purchase basic materials wholesale, such as corn, beans, rice, and other. In this way she hopes to improve her business, and obtain higher earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic materials.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Claudia Marlene

texts.es: Claudia Marlene H. D. C. D. 31 años, resiD. en Cojutepeque junto a su esposo, el cual se dedica a trabajar como panadero y sus tres hijos menores D. edad, los cuales estudian. Claudia se dedica a vender ropa para niños y adultos, Claudia comercializa su producto D. manera ambulante en diferentes pueblos del departamento D. Cuscatlán. Ella desea obtener un préstamo D. manera que pueda comprar ropa al mayoreo y D. esta forma poder aumentar su inventario y brindar más variedad D. productos a sus clientes. Ella desea poder mejorar su negocio con el fin D. aumentar sus ventas y poder brindarles todo lo necesario a sus tres hijos, los cuales son mayor incentivo para trabajar día con día.
texts.en:
Claudia Marlene H. D. C. is 31 years old and lives in Cojutepeque with her husband, who is a baker, and with their three young children who are in school. Claudia works selling clothing for children and adults. She markets her products on foot in various towns in the Department of Cuscatlán. She wants to obtain a loan so that she can buy clothing at wholesale and in this way she would be able to increase her inventory and proviD. a greater variety of products for her customers. She wants to be able to improve her business with the goal of increasing her sales and being able to proviD. her three children with all that they need. They are what motivates her to work day after day.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing at wholesale.

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta Lilian S. de 44 años de edad reside en Lourdes Colón, junto a sus dos hijos mayores de edad los cuales se dedican a trabajar y contribuyen junto a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Marta posee un taller de costura, en el cual se dedica a confeccionar ropa para niños y adultos de todas las edades, ella posee ya 16 años de tener su negocio, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, a través del cual pueda mejorarlo y poder seguir trabajando en el, ya que necesita comprar más tela, hilos, maquina nueva de coser entre otras cosas muy importantes para realizar su trabajo. Marta posee muy buenas referencias ya que todas las personas de su colonia la reconocen como una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual se ha esforzado por darle lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta Lilian S. is 44 years of age and lives in the Lourdes district with her two adult children. They both work and contribute with their mother towards the household expenses. Marta has a seamstress shop where she works at making clothing for children and adults of all ages. She's been in this business for 16 years now. She is seeking a loan for this business so that she can improve it and be able to continue working there. She needs to buy more fabric, thread, and a new sewing machine among other things which are very important to her work. Marta has very good references since all of the people in her district know her as a very hardworking woman who strives to provide the best for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Sandra Margarita

texts.es: Sandra Margarita M. C. D. P. D. 43 años D. edad, resiD. en Lourdes Colón junto a sus cuatro hijos menores D. edad los cuales se dedican a estudiar y su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante. Ella posee un comedor y también una venta D. ropa en su casa. Sandra solícita un préstamo con el fin D. poder pagar todos los gastos relacionados a sus negocios, así como también comprar ropa al mayoreo, D. manera que tenga mucho más productos que ofrecer y así obtener más clientela lo cual la beneficie a ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra Margarita M. C. D. P. is 43. She lives in Lourdes Colón with her four minor children who go to school and her husband who is a businessman. She has a dining room, and she also sells clothes in her home. Sandra is asking for a loan to be able to pay the business expenses. She will also buy clothes wholesale. That way she will have a lot more products to sell. Then she will have more customers, which will benefit her and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes

location.town: Lourdes Colón, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es: Elizabeth del Carmen P. G. de 46 años, reside en Sonsonate junto a su esposo y dos hijos. Ella posee una tienda en la cual vende productos perecederos y de primera necesidad. Elizabeth solicita un préstamo con el cual pretende comprar más productos para su negocio, tales como embutidos, lácteos, jugos y más golosinas, esto con el fin de poder surtir más su tienda y poder mejorar su negocio, ya que gracias a el es como logran solventar gran parte de sus gastos familiares.
texts.en:
Elizabeth del Carmen P. G., 46, lives in Sonsonete with her husband and two children. She has a store where she sells perishables and basic needs items. Elizabeth is asking for a loan to buy more products for her store such as cold meats, milk products, juices, and more sweets. She wants to be able to stock her store better and improve her business. Thanks to her business they are able to pay a large part of the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new products for her store

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia A. is a 55-year-old farmer with seven children. For the last 25 years, Alicia has grown rice. She helps her husband, Joel A., by tilling the rice field so that they have a family income. Their harvest is the only thing that sustains them as a family. The family earns 71,000 PHP every time they harvest their farm.

Alicia is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and herbicides. The loan will help increase the family income so that they can pay their daily household expenses.

About CEVI
CEVI helps its clients to grow their businesses even more. CEVI provides not just loans, but training and insurance cover as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Rocila

texts.en:
“I started farming 20 years ago. With my one-hectare farm, our family is able to earn 20,000 PHP a month. We use the income from our harvest to pay our children's tuition fees as well as meet their other needs,” says Rocila P., a farmer and mother of four children. Aside from growing rice, Rocila also sells nipa, a kind of plant used in roofing. She had previous work experience in canning but quit her job to manage a farm instead.

Rocila is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP from Kiva partner, CEVI. She will use the loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides. The loan will help her grow her harvest and her income. One day, she hopes to buy another hectare of farmland. In that way, she will be able to further support her children's needs.

About CEVI
CEVI helps small business to grow. CEVI provides all its clients not just with loans, but with training and insurance cover as well.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs such as fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia N. is a widow. She is 37 years old and has four children. She has a farm. She has been engaged in tilling the rice field for 15 years already. Recently, she earned a total of Php 18,000 from her harvest. She uses her income to support the needs of her family. Her farm has sustained her family for many years already.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase farm materials like fertilizers and chemicals. The loan will help her business to grow.

CEVI aims to help small business grow. CEVI provides its clients with not just loans, but trainings and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides for her farm

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Lay K. is 39 years old. A married woman, she lives with her other family members in the city of Phnom Penh, about 5 kilometers from the river, where she makes a living selling a snack food from her home to her neighbors in the village. Her husband earns income by driving a motor taxi. This couple has two children, who are secondary students.

Lay K. will be using this loan to repair her husband’s motor, which has broken, and to buy more tables and chairs to use in her business so her customers can sit.

loans.use: To repair a motor taxi and buy chairs and tables for food business

loans.name: Sothy

texts.en: C. Sothy, 45, has worked for military services since 2000 in the city of Phnom Penh. He is able to earn $3 income per day and his wife, a grocery and food seller, is able to earn $10 per day. Although the earning looks to be enough for them, they have three children who are of school age and who require much money for their study. Hence, Sothy has decided to take a loan from Kiva of $300 to expand the inventory of the grocery business. (Sothy's wife is presented in the picture.)

loans.use: To expand the grocery business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: K. Mary, 60, is a widow. She has a house for rent, and she has involved in a beverage selling business since 2005. She has only one child, a son, whose job is buying and selling used motorbikes. She plans to take the loan from Kiva of $1000 to facilitate her son’s business of buying more motorbikes since his business can be more profitable than hers. She plans to buy a house with a convenient location for him to do the business. (Her son fixing his used motorbike is presented in the picture because Mary is not available.)

loans.use: To buy a house from which to do business

loans.name: Namjilpagma

texts.en:
Namjilpagma D. is just 23 years old and lives by herself in Arhangai province, one of the central provinces of Mongolia. She has a small retail business in clothing. Since 2008, she has been selling clothes for women and men at Terh shopping mall, one of the large shopping malls in the town. She rents a small stall at the shopping mall and sells various women's and men's clothes that she brings from Ereen China.

Ereen is a Chinese border town, from which many cheap Chinese products are imported. She frequently travels to Ereen and purchases cheap yet trendy clothes especially for young people in the town. Since its start, she has done quite well and her business capital has increased from 800,000 Mongolian tugriks to 1,200,000 tugriks (about US $560 to $850). Her future plan for her business includes adding a greater variety of clothes for young people. She requests a loan to purchase more clothes from Ereen, China.

loans.use: To buy clothes for resale

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en: S. Chanthy, 43, has made coffee and instant noodles to sell since 1998 with a daily income of $12. Her husband, 46, is a motor-taxi driver who earns $5 per day. Together, they have 3 children who are all of school-age, so they need to earn more to balance their income and expenses. Due to the reason mentioned earlier, she wants to take a loan from Kiva of $700 to expand her current business. If her business succeeds, she will be able to build a new house and also support her children to study at a good school.

loans.use: Buying more food to sell

loans.name: Sonomdendev

texts.en: Sonomdendev D. lives with his wife and two teenage daughters in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. His two daughters are in high school. Sonomdendev runs a small retail business selling food products, largely soft drinks, biscuits, and other items. He started his business in 2004 with the help of his wife. He rents a small stall in the local food market and sells the products his wife buys in wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Since launching his business, Sonomdendev has done well, more than quadrupuling his capital. In the future, he hopes to own a stall in the market, rather than rent. He has applied for this loan to buy more items to buy in Ulaanbaatar to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy food products from Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia

loans.name: Marusya

texts.en: Marusya T. is a widow who lives with her youngest son, who is 13 years old, in Arhangai province in central Mongolia. She runs a small retail business selling dairy products, largely unprocessed milk, cheese, curds and other items. She has run her business since 1995, buying unprocessed milk and milk products from local herders and selling them for a profit in the local market. Since starting in 1995, her business capital has increased from 50,000 MNT to 3,000,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT). With this profit, she was able to finance her sons' weddings. In the future, she would like to repair her apartment. She is applying for this loan to buy more milk and milk products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: To buy dairy products to sell to her customers

loans.name: San Men

texts.en: Y. San Men, 68, is a widow and earns a living by selling different kinds of meatballs near her house. She doesn’t have many responsibilities toward her family members since most of her 7 children are employed and get paid, though inadequately for their living. However, she wants to take a US$ 200 loan to expand her current business, selling more different kinds of meatballs for more income.

loans.use: buying more meatballs to sell

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
The smiling-faced person shown in the picture is Mrs. Yet A., 34 years old, who lives in the capital, Phnom Penh. She owns a small store in front of the garment factory which is full of garment workers, and she uses this store to sell breakfast and lunch foods. She generates a profit approximately of US$ 3 a day to help support her family’s daily expenses with more stability.

Her husband is the chief provider for the family, and he works as a motor taxi driver. This couple has four teenage children. Yet A. will be using part of this requested money to purchase more necessary ingredients for cooking food to sell; the rest of the loan will be used to repair her husband's motor-taxi that is not attractive.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary ingredients

loans.name: El Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
L. señora Antonia M. Gutiérrez es originaria D. un pequeño poblado “Ometepec” ubicado en el Estado D. Guerrero. Durante años se ha dedicado a trabajar como empleada domestica a  cuidar a una pequeña niña. L. señora Antonia también tiene 2 hijos pequeños los cuales ha descuidado por llevar un salario mínimo a su casa y así apoyar a su esposo en los gastos familiares.  Debido a sus necesidades inició hace tres años y D. forma ambulante L. venta D. pollo los cuales compraba y vendía, pero hoy pretenD. tener un negocio propio, en el cual no descuiD. a sus 2 hijos  y podrá darles L. mayor herencia: su educación, para que ellos puedan desempeñarse en L. sociedad como personas D. valores, útiles y capaces. Por eso solicitó un crédito  para su gran sueño una granja propia,  y eso lo hará con  L. compra D. pollos,  alimentos, comederos para L. crianza.
Es por esta razón que L. señora Antonia M. G. se ha unido con un grupo D. 13 personas, al cual pusieron como nombre del grupo “El Divino Niño J.”  para solicitar el crédito grupal a Fundación Realidad A.C.
Las otras personas del grupo son las siguientes:
Epifania L. M. - Compra y venta D. productos agrícolas
Monica D. Jesus H.  - Venta D. pescado
Margarita M. L.  - Venta D. blusas artesanales
Julio D. L. C. D. J.  - Compra y venta D. maíz
Maria H. Barragán  - Venta D. abarrotes
Victorina G. F.  - Venta D. comida en cocina económica
Silvia F. P.  - Venta D. ropa
Silvia M. M. -  Elaboración y venta D. pan
Petrona Soledad M. G. - Elaboración y venta D. pan
Erasmo F. L.  -  Elaboración y venta D. pan
Maxima H. A. – Venta D. blusas artesanales
Maria D. L. Luz E. P.  -  Venta D. ropa
texts.en:
Antonia M. Gutiérrez is from a small town called Ometepec, which is located in the state of Guerrero. She worked for several years as a domestic servant taking care of a little girl. Antonia also has two small children whom she doesn’t get to spend much time with since she has to make a minimum wage so she can help her husband with the family’s expenses. Out of necessity, three years ago she started working as a street vendor selling chicken that she bought and then sold. Now she intends to have her own business so that she can take care of her 2 children and give them a better future via education, so that they can contribute to society as good citizens who are useful and capable. This is why she has requested a loan for her big dream—her own small chicken farm. She will start it by buying chickens, feed, and feeders for the chicks. For this reason, Antonia M. G. has created a group of 13 people, who decided to use the group name “El Divino Niño J.” (The Divine Baby Jesus), to request a group loan from Fundación Realidad A.C. The other people in the group are the following: Epifania L. M. – Buying and selling of agricultural products Monica D. Jesus H. – Fish sales Margarita M. L. – Embroidered blouse sales Julio D. L. C. D. J. – Buying and selling of corn Maria H. Barragán – Grocery sales Victorina G. F. – Food sales in a home café Silvia F. P. – Clothing sales Silvia M. M. – Bread production and sales Petrona Soledad M. G. - Bread production and sales Erasmo F. L. - Bread production and sales Maxima H. A. – Embroidered blouse sales Maria D. L. Luz E. P. – Clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy materials to construct a small farm for raising chickens

loans.name: Nourn

texts.en:
B. Nourn, 54, has been a motor-taxi driver providing transportation services in Phnom Penh City since 2000. His wife, 57, sells fried bananas (a very common snack for Cambodian people). He and his wife have 6 children: two of them are students and the rest are employed at a garment factory.

To make a better income, B. Nourn wants to take US$ 300 loan from KIVA to expand his wife's current business. Then, if she has more income and savings from the family’s expenses, she will be able to run a grocery business in her house. (His wife is presented in the picture)

loans.use: buying more bananas to sell, fried

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia M. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old. Emelia is married and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Emelia owns and operates a business venture, buying and selling bananas. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from this business. Emelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Emelia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Emelia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and for the tuition of their children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Virginita

texts.en:
Virginita E. is from the village of Acad, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 44 years old. Virginita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Virginita owns and operates a business venture, buying and selling bananas. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from this activity. Virginita has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 600 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Virginita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginita is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Virginita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family and pay the tuition of their children.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas to sell

loans.name: Eupemia

texts.en:
Eupemia P. is from the village of Corales, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Eupemia is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Eupemia owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, operating a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. Eupemia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Eupemia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eupemia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business. Eupemia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Eupemia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Kim's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is made up of only two borrowers, who are shown in the picture. The group leader, Mrs. Kim T., is 44 years old. She currently sells flowers to people who come to eat in restaurants, and she is earning an average of US$ 5 profit per day. She usually buys various kinds of flowers from farmers, making them into bouquets and selling them retail, while walking around the village.

Kim T. is married with three kids who are attending school, while her husband works driving a motorcycle taxi. Because their current income is not enough for their family’s daily expenses, Kim T. would like a loan of US$ 300 in order to buy piglets to raise. This will provide her with additional income to meet her family’s needs and provide more financial stability. The other borrower is Mr. Sem S., who is asking for a US$ 300 loan as well. He wants it to add to his savings to replace his existing motor that has broken.

loans.use: To buy piglets to raise

loans.name: Rosa Vilma

texts.es: Rosa Vilma R. Vda. D. M. vive en el departamento La Libertad junto a su única hija Vilma D. 14 años D. edad que estudia 9º grado. La Sra. Rosa trabaja en su negocio que es un ciber café donD. las personas llegan a alquilar por horas el servicio D. Internet, Rosa tiene una clientela muy estable ya que muchos jóvenes llegan a buscar información D. sus tareas D. la escuela al ciber café. Muestra D. que Rosa es una mujer y madre muy trabajadora cabe mencionar que los días sábado y domingo Rosa hace comida para vender a sus vecinos, aparte D. ello Rosa también mantiene un inventario en Leña para cocinar que también la venD., todos estos sacrificios e ingenios D. Rosa, en la superación económica son para brindarle estabilidad a su hija y una educación digna. Rosa solicita un crédito para la compra D. materia prima en la elaboración D. comida para los findesemanas
texts.en:
Rosa Vilma R. Vda. D. M. lives in the La Libertad area with her only daughter Vilma, who is 14 and in the 9th graD.. Rosa owns a cyber cafe, where customers rent computer and Internet access per hour. Rosa has a stable client base, as many students come to the cyber cafe to do school-related research. Rosa is a hard-working woman and mother, and during the weekend, she makes food to sell to her neighbors. She also stocks cooking firewood to sell. Rosa does all these things to give her daughter stability and a good education. Rosa is asking for a loan to purchase raw materials to use in preparing food to sell during the weekend.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es: Maria del Pilar G. S. vive en el departamento de La Libertad en la zona occidente del país. Maria vive junto a Pedro su esposo y un nieto.  Pedro aporta económicamente 150$, ya que él es empleado y la Maria por su lado se dedica a la venta de granos básicos y por las tardes a la elaboración de tortillas, Maria solicita este crédito por que quiere aumentar sus inventario en granos básicos ya que tiene una clientela muy grande y siempre carece de suficiente variedad de  productos para la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria del Pilar G. S. lives in the La Libertad area in the western part of her country. She lives with her husband Pedro, and a grandson. Pedro contributes $150, as he is employed. Maria works selling basic grains, and during the afternoons she makes tortillas. Maria is asking for a loan because she wants to increase her basic grain inventory, as she has a large client base, and she always suffers from a lack of product variety to satisfy her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business.

loans.name: Olga Flor De Maria

texts.es: Olga Flor D. Maria M. D. F. vive en Cojutepeque departamento D. Cuscatlán. Olga tiene una gran familia ya que vive con su suegra y dos hermanos D. su esposo José, la pareja también tiene una pequeña niña D. 5 años D. edad llamada Génesis. El esposo D. Olga aporta económicamente para los gastos familiares ya que él es empleado en una librería;  mientras Olga se dedica a su negocio que es una tienda D. productos D. consumo diario y por las tardes hace tortillas para vender. Olga solicita un crédito por que quiere surtir su tienda ya que carece D. variedad D. productos y marcas que sus clientes le solicitan.
texts.en:
Olga Flor D. Maria M. D. F. lives in the Cojutepeque department of Cuscatlán. Olga has a big family, as she lives with her sister-in-law and her husband's two brothers. Olga and her husband Jose have 5 year old daughter named Genesis. Jose works at a bookstore, and contributes to the household expenses. Olga has a store where she sells daily-use products, and during her afternoons, she makes tortillas to sell. Olga is asking for a loan in order to stock her store, as she lacks a variety of products and the brands that her clients request.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business.

loans.name: Chona

texts.en:
Chona O. is from the village of Danao. She is 46 years old. Chona is married. To make a living, Chona owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Chona has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Chona joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Chona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Chona is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a fishing boat. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Chona from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat

loans.name: Kim

texts.en:
Kim S. is a 33-year-old, married woman and is blessed with three children who are teenagers. She currently stays at home to sell a few produce items in her small store in front of her home. Her husband is a domestic construction foreman, who has employees to provide his service.

Recently, Kim S.'s husband has been very busy at his business due to there being many clients who need him to build their house, but he is still lacking material for construction. That is why Kim S. requested a loan as capital to buy extra construction materials.

loans.use: To buy extra construction materials

loans.name: David Francisco

texts.es: David Francisco R. S. vive en San Salvador la capital del país. A pesar de su corta edad David lleva la responsabilidad  económica familiar David tiene tan solo 21 años de edad, pero es el único apoyo de su madre la Sra. Maria Aura. David tiene un pequeño local ubicado en una zona muy céntrica de la capital donde cuenta con venta de celulares y activaciones de los mismos, también ha surtido su negocio con otros productos de consumo como dulces, jabón de baño, shampoo, etc. David solicita este crédito para surtir su negocio en la compra de accesorios para teléfonos celulares.
texts.en:
David Francisco R. S. lives in San Salvador. Despite being young, David is responsible for his family's economic well-being. David is only 21 years old, but is the only support for his mother, Ms. Maria Aura. He has a small stand in a central zone of the capital, where he sells cell phones and cell phone activation. He also stocks his stand with other products, such as sweets, bath soap, shampoo, etc. David is asking for a loan to stock his business with cell phone accessories.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his business.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol B. is from the village of Danao. She is 33 years old. Mirasol is married. To make a living, Mirasol owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Mirasol joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Mirasol from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina S. is from the village of Colupan Bajo, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Gina owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily from cooking and selling meals in the local community. Gina has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding her business. Gina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase ingredients for cooking food to sell. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to support her family's basic needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for cooking food to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en: Liza J. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 26 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. Liza owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Liza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Liza is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Herebella

texts.en: Herebella A. is from the village of Danao. She is 35 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Herebella owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Herebella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment including hooks and nets

loans.name: Alex
