texts.en: Alex L. is from the village of Danao. He is 40 years old, married, and has seven adult children. Alex owns and operates a business making and selling food, primarily selling specialty food products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Alex joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Alex is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be his 2nd from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa R. vive en un pequeño cantón ubicado en el departamento de Ahuachapán. Rosa tiene 46 años de edad,  se dedica a su negocio que es la crianza de pollos para después comercializarlos, aparte de ello Rosa cultiva maíz y maicillo también para vender,  estas son las principales fuentes de ingresos para Rosa y su familia, Ahora ella solicita este crédito para capital de trabajo en la compra de granos para su siembra de maíz y maicillo que le ayudara a aumentar su inventario al igual que sus ventas.
texts.en:
Rosa R. lives in a small home located in the Ahuachapán department. She is 46 years old, and works raising chickens which she sells. Rosa also grows corn to sell. These activities generate the principal income sources for Rosa and her family. She now asks for a loan to provide her with working capital to purchase grains and seeds, which will help her expand her inventory and her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grains and seeds.

loans.name: Brenda

texts.en: Brenda D. is from the village of Danao. She is 45 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Brenda owns and operates a fishing business, primarily harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Brenda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Brenda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: It's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three men, all of whom live in Prek Pnov Commune in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia.

The group leader, Mr. S., is age 42. Since the beginning of 2000, he has been earning income by driving a motorbike taxi. In addition, he goes to buy some vegetables for his wife to sell at the market. This couple has two young children who are enrolled in school.

At present, S.'s wife hires a selling place at an expensive rent. They hope to own a store by using a loan from Kiva's partner HKL to add to their savings to purchase a store in the market. This will allow them to cut down the shop rent costs.

The other two borrowers who have jointly taking this loan are:

C., who will be using the loan to support his wife's business selling grocery items.

C., who requests a loan as capital for his wife to begin selling vegetable in the market.

loans.use: To purchase a store in the market

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma B. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 48 years old. Thelma is married and has 1 adult child. To make a living, Thelma raises pigs for sale. Thelma has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 25,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2001, Thelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Thelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 130,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Thelma is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Thelma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: Arminda

texts.es: Arminda I. vive en el departamento de Ahuachapán junto a su hijo Miguel de 24 años edad y su hermano de 55 años de edad ambos trabajan como albañiles. Arminda se dedica a la venta de ropa y zapatos que los consigue viajando hasta la frontera que colinda con Guatemala ya que allí logra conseguir precios más bajos permitiéndole obtener mejores ganancias, Arminda solicita este crédito por que quiere aumentar su inventario ya que posee poca variedad de estilos y tallas de sus productos, Arminda ya ha manejado créditos anteriormente donde ha sido puntual en todas sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Arminda I. lives in the department of Ahuachapan together with her 24 year-old son, Miguel and her 55 year-old brother who both work as masons. Arminda sells clothes and shoes which she buys travelling to the border of Guatemala as prices are lower there and allow her to increase her earnings. Arminda requests this loan in order to increase her inventory as she has little variety of styles and sizes. Arminda has been punctual in repaying prior loans.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply inventory.

loans.name: Mayra Jeannette

texts.es: Mayra Jeannette N. R. vive en Lourdes Colon ubicado en el departamento La Libertad. Mayra tiene 36 años de edad está acompañada con Ricardo y tienen dos hijos Mayra de 12 años de edad y Ricardo de 14 años de edad ambos niños estudian en la escuela. Ricardo el esposo de Mayra es empleado y aporta económicamente a su familia 200$ mensuales y Mayra se dedica a su propio negocio, que es la venta de perfumes y carteras por catalogo con estos ingresos de sus ventas Mayra  apoya económicamente a su esposo con los gastos mensules, Mayra solicita este crédito por que quiere comprar perfumes que sus clientes le solicitan con frecuencia; de esta manera aumentara sus ganancias, que son un gran pilar en la economía de la familia.
texts.en:
Mayra Jeannette N. R. lives in Lourdes Colon located in the department La Libertad. Mayra is 36 years old, she lives with Ricardo and they have two children, Mayra, who is 12 years old and Ricardo who is 14 years old, both are students. Mayra's husband, Ricardo, is an employee and contributes economically to the family expenses with $200 monthly. Mayra has her own business, selling perfumes and wallets from catalog. With the earnings from her sales Mayra helps her husband economically with the monthly expenses. Mayra requests the loan in order to buy the perfumes frequently requested by her customers and increase her earnings which represent a huge economic help to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply perfumes to inventory.

loans.name: Nafesa Group

texts.en:
Nafesa is   the group leader of Nafesa group. There are four members in this group. Each wants to take a loan for his/her own business. They have requested a loan of 30,000 Afghani. 

Nafesa and Bibi Mareyam want to take a loan for their husbands' businesses; they have a general store and they want to make their shop larger. Also, Hama wants to take a loan for her tailoring business. She wants to buy a  new machine for her shop and complete her stock. Safyalah wants to take a loan for his mechanic business; he wants to buy necessary materials for his shop.

With this loan they can make their businesses larger and support their families and make a better future for their families. They are really happy with this process in this poor country.

loans.use: expanding and furthering their businesses

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana del Carmen S. de 54 años de edad vive en el departamento de La Libertad en la zona de Occidental de El Salvador. Ana cuenta con el apoyo y ayuda de su esposo en su negocio que es una pequeña tienda con diversidad de productos de consumo, Ana también se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo  donde se encuentra diferentes tipos de mercadería en belleza. Ana solicita este crédito para surtir su tienda y también para comprar productos de los que vende en los catálogos para tenerlos a la vista de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ana del Carmen S. is 54 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad in the occidental zone of El Salvador. Ana has the support and help from her husband in her business which is a small store with a diversity of consumer products. Ana also sells different kinds of beauty products from catalog. Ana requests this loan to supply her store and also to buy the products sold from catalogs so she can show them to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for business.

loans.name: Marta Elena

texts.es: Marta Elena R. D. O. D. 49 años D. edad vive en Mejicanos ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Marta vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo. Jorge el esposo D. Marta trabaja como albañil y Marta se dedica a su negocio donD. venD. adornos, artesanías, peluches entre otros, Marta cuenta con 17 años D. experiencia en su negocio  donD. todas sus ventas y compras en mercadería siempre las hace al contado, ella solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir su inventario variedad D. productos que sus clientes le demandan.
texts.en:
Marta Elena R. D. O. is 49 years old and lives in Mejicanos located in the department of San Salvador. Marta lives with her three children and her husband. Marta's husband, Jorge, works as a mason and Marta sells ornaments, craftworks, cuddle toys, among others. Marta has 17 years of experience in her business where the buying and selling transactions are always in cash. She requests this loan as she wishes to supply her stock with the variety of products required by her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supply for business.

loans.name: Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani

texts.en:
Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani - (DNR.M-0691) is a 45 year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To making a living, Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani raises pigs for sale.  Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 350,000 IDR (~34.30 USD) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani is requesting a loan for the first time from DINARI. Her request for a loan of 5,000,000 will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani - (DNR.M-0691) merupakan 45 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 10 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani menghasilkan sekitar 350,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2009, Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 1st pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Ni Luh Ari Jaya Wardani berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Ángela De Jesús

texts.es: Ángela D. Jesús G. D. Z. D. 33 años D. edad vive en el departamento D. La Libertad junto a sus hijos y su esposo Edén quien aporta  100$ mensuales para los gastos familiares. Ángela se dedica a la venta D. ropa y productos D. belleza como perfumes, cremas para el cuerpo, cosméticos entre otros y también los días sábado y domingo hace pupusas para vender, Ángela solicita un crédito para surtir su inventario en mercadería D. ropa y cosméticos al igual desea comprar más materia prima para la elaboración D. pupusas, así lograra producir mayor cantidad D. pupusas y aumentara sus ganancias semanales.
texts.en:
Ángela D. Jesús G. D. Z. is 33 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad together with her children and her husband, Edén, who contributes with $100 monthly for the family expenses. Ángela sells clothes and beauty products such as perfumes, body lotion, cosmetics, among others, and on Saturdays and Sundays she makes and sells stuffed tortillas, "pupusas". Ángela requests a loan to supply her inventory of clothes and cosmetics as well as to buy ingredients for the preparation of the stuffed tortillas in order to make more "pupusas" and thus increase her weekly earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply inventory and purchase ingredients for stuffed tortillas

loans.name: Josefin Manafe

texts.en:
Josefin Manafe - (DNR.M-0692) is a 41 year-old female living in the town of Kaliakah. She is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Josefin Manafe raises pigs for sale. Josefin Manafe has been engaged in this business for over 9 years and earns approximately 450,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2008, Josefin Manafe joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities.  Josefin Manafe is requesting a loan from DINARI of 5,000,000 IDR to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Josefin from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Josefin Manafe - (DNR.M-0692) merupakan 41 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Kaliakah.  Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 4 anak usia sekolah.  Untuk membiayai hidup, Josefin Manafe memiliki & menjalankan usaha.  Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian.  Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah memelihara ternak.  Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Josefin Manafe sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 9 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Josefin Manafe menghasilkan sekitar 450,000 IDR sebulan.


Dalam 2008, Josefin Manafe bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Josefin Manafe telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya dari DINARI.    Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 5,000,000 IDR.  Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli bibit ternak untuk dibesarkan & dijual di masa mendatang.  Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 2nd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.  Josefin Manafe berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis  untuk meningkatkan/memperluas bisnis peminjam.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . In 2009, Ni Luh Asrini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. loans.name: Obida

texts.ru: Вохидова Обида 1965 года рождения , замужем имеет 3 детей.  Обида торгует на рынке  более 14 лет она торгует детской одеждой. Раньше торговала продуктами питанием. Кредит  получила на расширение летней одежды. Решив что может справиться с торговлей она также открыла точку  продажи одежды.  О временем полностью перешла на торговлю детской одежды.
texts.en:
Born in 1965, Obida V. is married and has 3 children. She has been selling at a market over 14 years. She currently sells children’s clothing, but used to sell food products. Having decided that she could handle the sales well, Obida also opened a clothing store. With time, she completely transitioned to selling children’s clothing. Obida requested a loan in order to expand her assortment of children’s clothing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To use as additional capital to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Tuti

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Тути Хаитова около 7 лет занимается торговлей. Ее товар - это детская и подрастковая одежда. Товар Тути покупает у поставщиков, затем продает его на вещевом рынке города Истаравша, в этом городе она и проживает вместе со своей семьей. 
Муж Тути Азим работает строителем. Его средний ежемесячный зароботок сотовляет 200 сомони. У Тути и Азима растет сын. Он хорошо учится, его родители мечтают отправить сына на учебу за границу. И поэтому работают не покладая рук.
Для того, чтобы заработать больше денег, Тути требуется увеличить свой товарооборот. Для этого она обратилась в нашу организацию. Она считает что условия кредитования нашей организации ей идеально подходят. Она запрашивает сумму в размере 1000 сомони.
texts.en:
Tuti H. has been involved in sales close to 7 years. Her merchandise includes children’s and teenage clothing. She buys the merchandise from suppliers and then sells it at the clothing market in Istaravshan, the city where she lives with her family. Tuti’s husband, Azim, is a construction worker. He makes 200 somini every month. Tuti and Azim are raising their young son. He is a good student, and his parents dream of sending him to study abroad. This is why both Tuti and Azim work very hard. Tuti needs to increase her goods turnover in order to earn more money. She thinks that our organization’s lending conditions are ideal and reached to us for a loan. Tuti is requesting a sum of 1000 somoni.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en:
Ni Komang Darmini is a 30-year-old female living in the town of Pangkung Buluh. She is the group leader of a 13-member group loan offered by DINARI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Buluh Sari (DNR.M-0694).

Ni Komang Darmini is married and has three school-aged children. She owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily raising pigs for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 IDR a month.

In 2007, Ni Komang Darmini joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her pigs.

Ni Komang Darmini is now requesting a new loan of 1,200,000 IDR which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. The loan will be her 3rd from DINARI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About DINARI:
The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


 *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar. Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Buluh Sari (DNR.M-0694).

Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual. Ni Komang Darmini sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Komang Darmini menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR. Dalam 2007, Ni Komang Darmini bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Komang Darmini telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,000,000 IDR dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,200,000 IDR.

Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and other supplies

loans.name: Abdukodir

texts.ru:
Абдукодир Раупов  1977 года рождения , женат имеет 2 детей.  Он работает мастером  штукатурки. Его работа приносит не плохой доход .  Но работа сезонная , мастера  штукатурки нужны только в теплое время года. 
Для поддержания своего дохода он  также содержит скот.  Каждый месяц он занимается купля продажей скота.  Ему нравиться этот вид бизнеса. Он отправляет скот с сыном на пастбище, там же оставляет скот на  весну и лето, там есть коровник для скота, где они и находятся там до конца осени.  Также он высеял несколько гектаров земли кукурузы и другой сельхоз культуры. До зимы он высушит и будет кормить этим свой скот.
texts.en:
Born in 1977, Abdukodir R. is married and has 2 children. He works as a plaster master and earns a decent income. However, his work is seasonal and is only in demand during the warm months of the year. Thus, in order to supplement his income, Abdukodir keeps livestock. Every month, he buys and sells livestock and likes this type of business. His son takes the livestock to pasture. Abdukodir leaves the livestock there during spring and summer. They have a cowshed there, where the livestock is kept until end of autumn. Abdukodir also planted corn and other agricultural cultures on several hectares of land. Before winter, he will dry these plants and use them as feed for his livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 4 cows

texts.en:
Rosita A. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 59 years old. Rosita is married and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over 1 year and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (about $43 US) a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 pesos from PMPC. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 5000 pesos which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Rosita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.name: Muzafar

texts.ru:
Музафар Мусоева очень добрая и отзывчивая женщина. Торгует на рынке. Она замужем, имеет 3 детей: сына и 2 дочерей. Ее муж Одил Мусоев тоже микропредприниматель, он продает сухофрукты на рынке. 
 Музафар имеет небольшой ассртимент товара, это носки и мужское нижнее белье. Музафар хочет разнообразить свой ассортимент, и закупить дополнительно к своему товару женское нижнее белье. Для этого она подала заявку, чтобы получить кредит.
 Стаж ее работы в сфере микропредпринимательской деятельности 15 лет. В этом бизнесе, ей помогает дочь Дилноза. На снимке сама Музафар и ее дочь Дилноза, возможно уже будующая предпринимательница. Похожа на свою маму, не так ли?
texts.en:
Muzafar M. is a very kind and caring woman. She is involved in sales at a market. She is married and has 3 children: a son and 2 daughters. Muzafar’s husband, Odil, is also an entrepreneur. He sells dried fruits at the market. Muzafar has a small assortment of merchandise that includes socks and men’s undergarments. She wants to vary her merchandise by adding women’s underwear to her assortment. This is why Muzafar requested a loan. Muzafar has been an entrepreneur for 15 years. Her daughter, Dilnoza, helps her with the business. The photograph shows Muzafar and her daughter, Dilnoza (possibly the future entrepreneur). Doesn’t she resemble her mother?

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

texts.en: This small loan has been requested by two borrowers. The group leader, Mrs. V., is a married woman and the mother of six children. All six children are students who have also taken jobs when they are not studying. V. currently cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband is responsible and helps the family by driving a motor taxi. V. is applying for a loan for capital to buy a boat to use as equipment to fish in and around Tunle Sap River with her husband. This will provide them with additional income to attain a higher standard of living. The other borrower is Mrs. S., 38, a fish seller. She will use the loan money to buy more nets and trap tools for her husband to go fishing.

loans.name: Ceneza

texts.en:
Ceneza A. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 49 years old. Ceneza is married and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Ceneza owns & operates a a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ceneza is just starting this business.

In 2002, Ceneza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Ceneza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Ceneza is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP to be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This will not be the first loan taken out by Ceneza from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family. 


About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: o purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Torpekay Group

texts.en:
Torpekay is the group leader of Torpekay group. They live in the 17th district of Kabul, Afghanistan. The group members want to take a group loan of 40,000 Afghani. Each of the group members wants to take a loan for his/her business progress.

Torpekay wants to take a loan for her brother’s business: general store. Nazefa wants to take a loan for her sewing business. A. Mahmod wants to take a loan for his retail shop. And Nafas Jan wants to take a loan for her business of carpet weaving.

They all would like to expand their businesses through the loan they want to take, and support their families as well.

loans.use: expanding their small businesses

loans.name: Karomat

texts.ru: Каромат Турсунова 1967 года рождения, замужем имеет 4 детей. Торгует медом и овощами. Летом мало кто приобретает мед , для этого она и торгует , помидорами и сухо-фруктами. Раньше она с мужем торговали мед , муж ездил и привозил товар. Сейчас муж уехал в Россию на заработки. Теперь ей самой приходиться ездить за медом и привозить товар. Пчеловоды старые знакомые ее мужа , поэтому мед обходиться намного дешевле, чем у других пчеловодов. Вот уже год как она торгует и  научилась торговать на рынке.
texts.en:
Born in 1967, Karomat T. is married and has 4 children. She sells honey and vegetables. During the summer, when hardly anyone buys honey, Karomat sells tomatoes and dried fruits. Previously, her husband was involved in the sales as well. He used to deliver the products for sale. Now, he left to work in Russia. Karomat has to now travel and deliver the honey on her own. The beekeepers are old friends of her husband; thus, Karomat is able to buy honey from them at a much better price than from other beekeepers. It has already been a year since Karomat learned the business and sells at the market.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of honey for sale

loans.name: Itore

texts.en:
Itore M. is currently in the business of baking bread and is requesting a loan to purchase baking materials. Itore is 25 years old and is married. Her husband is a driver. She has one child and her child goes to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house and rent it out.
BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 21 years old and married. To make a living, Maricel runs a food stall. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Maricel has been engaged in her business for more than a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Maricel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. Maricel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the second loan taken out by Maricel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

texts.en: Jennifer P. is from the village of Bay-bay, Balatacan, Tangub City. She is 28 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Jennifer owns and operates a business selling fish. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Jennifer joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more fish to sell. This loan will be her first from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. loans.name: Sayora

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Сайёра  Рузиева трудолюбивая женщина. Замужем, заботливая мать 2 детей. Саёйра умеет шить национальные платья. Первый раз получив у нас кредит, она закупила различные виды тканей и сшила платья на продажу. Полученный кредит помог ей получить хорошую прибыль от реализации сшитых платьев. 
 Вот уже три года она шьет национальные платья, и продает их в рыночные дни. Обычно у нас рыночными днями считаются пятница и воскресенье. Остальные дни она посвящает шитью платьев.
Сейчас Сайёра хочет получить кредит, для того чтобы закупить ткани летнего сезона, сшить платья и продовать их на рынке. Платья на снимке, дело рук самой Сайёры.
 Муж Сайеры работает водителем маршрутного такси.
texts.en:
Sayora R. is a hardworking woman. She is married and is caring mother of 2 children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Sayora knows how to make traditional dresses. After obtaining a loan from us for the first time, she purchased various fabrics and made dresses for sale. That loan helped her to make a good profit from selling the dresses. Sayora has been making traditional dresses for three years. She sells them during market days, which are normally Friday and Sunday. She devotes the rest of the week to sewing dresses. Currently, Sayora wants to obtain a loan in order to purchase summer season fabrics, make dresses and sell them at the market. The dresses shown on the photograph were made by Sayora.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics for dress-making

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.ru: Назокат Вахобова 1952 года рождения . Замужем имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Опыт работы в откорме скота около 30 лет. Работает Назокат медсестрой, она дежурит  через день , а в ее отсутствии за скотом ухаживает муж и дети. Первый кредит получила в 2006 году на покупку корма и одного теленка. Сейчас у нее в коровнике  имеется корова  а молодые бычки на пастбище. (Во время мониторинга Назокат отсутствовала на фото ее муж .)
texts.en:
Born in 1952, Nazokat V. is married and has 3 children. She has a secondary education. She has close to 30 years of experience in the livestock feeding business. Nazokat also works as a nurse every other day. When she is gone, her husband and children take care of the livestock. Nazokat obtained her first loan that she used to purchase feed and one calf in 2006. She now has a cow kept in a cowshed and young bulls at the pasture. During the monitoring, Nazokat was absent, and so the photograph shows her husband.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Asiezo

texts.en: Asiezo J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and bread and is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike to carry charcoal to the market. She is 36 years old and is married to a husband who is a peasant. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. loans.use: To buy a motorbike to carry charcoal to the market

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly M. is from the village of Bay-bay, Balatacan, Tangub city. She is 58 years old. Nelly is married and has 12 school-aged children. To make a living, Nelly operates a family member's business venture in the food sector selling fish. Nelly has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelly joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Nelly is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase more fish to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nelly from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand the business and for children's tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Azizullah

texts.en:
Azizullah, son of G. Niamat, is fifty years old and married with six children. He lives in Kama, of Nangarhar province. He has a snuff-making shop that he started six years ago, and it is still going very well. Now he wants to buy another machine for his shop in order to produce more snuff to meet his customers' needs.  For that machine and other necessary things for his shop, he needs a loan of 50,000 AFN.  The improvements will make his business bigger and enable him to stand on his feet in the future.

Azizullah is happy with the processing of these loans in Afghanistan. He hopes to help better his family's situation and make a better future for them.  His goal is to grow his business in Jalalabad and open several shops in the next few years. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) in Jalalabad, Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy another machine for making snuff

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet R. is from the village of Bay-bay, Balatacan, Tangub City. She is 36 years old. Juliet is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet operates a family member's business selling shrimp and seafood products in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Juliet is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Juliet from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.ru: Хабиба Турсунова 1951 года рождения, замужем имеет 2 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Кредит получает для покупки скота -дойных коров. Содержит скот 30 лет. Во дворе за скотом ухаживают также и невестки. Сын и муж  помогают выводить скот на рынок. Для покупки скота потребовалась необходимая сумма.Узнала об условии кредитовании и сразу обратилась в Микроинвест. Планирует купить несколько голов скота, расширил свой коровник.
texts.en:
Born in 1951, Habiba T. is married and has 2 children. She has a secondary education. She requested this loan in order to purchase dairy cows. Habiba has been in this business for 30 years. Her daughters-in-law help her to take care of the livestock. Her son and husband help with taking the livestock to a market to sell. Habiba needed to borrow this sum of money for purchase of livestock. She learned about the lending terms and reached out to MicroInvest right away. Habiba plans to purchase several heads of livestock and expand her cowshed.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Adruko

texts.en:
Adruko S. is currently in the business of selling books at the bookshop and is requesting a loan to stock more books to sell. Adruko is 26 years old and is married. Her husband is a store-keeper. She has 4 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for settlement.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en: Vilma R. is from the town of Gimaylan, Libertad, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. Vilma owns and operates a specialized retail store, primarily selling tobacco and salted fish in their town. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Vilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Vilma is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of her family. texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”

Назокат Почоева  занимается продажей товаров, необходимых в производстве одежды. Это пуговицы, нитки, шерстянные нитки для вязания,резинки иглы и другие предметы галатереи. Назокат замужем, имеет 4 детей. Дочки Назокат уже замужем и живут в домах своих мужей. Сын Назокат Джума занимается изготовлением национальных лепешек, выпекает их в тандыре. Муж Назокат работает повором в столовой.
Назокат хочет получить кредит для расширения ассортимента своего товара. Она запрашивает сумму в размере 3500 сомони.
texts.en:
Nazokat P. sells products necessary for manufacturing clothing. These include buttons, thread, wool yarn for knitting, elastic, needles and other sewing products. Nazokat is married and has 4 children. Nazokat’s daughters are already married and live in their husbands’ homes. Nazokat’s son, Djuma bakes traditional flat bread; he bakes it in a tandoor oven. Nazokat’s husband works as a cook in a canteen. Nazokat would like to take out a loan to expand her product assortment. She is asking for a sum of 3500 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa S. is a 47-year-old woman from the coastal town of Cardona, Rizal Province, in the Philippines. She is a mother to two children. The eldest, Francis, is 24 years old and a college graduate. Her daughter, Riocyrell, is 23 years old and also a college graduate. Both of her children are unemployed. She is married to a fisherman, Francisco, who is 45 years old.

For her loan, she is requesting 15,000 pesos as additional capital for her fish pond and fish-vending business. From the fish pond, she delivers different types of fish to nearby towns, where it is consumed by customers.

In 2008, she joined ASHI (Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc.), an MFI aand Kiva partner in the Philippines. She was full of determination to uplift her family from poverty. Now that she has the chance to fulfill her dreams, she hopes to have more fish ponds to produce more fish to sell in the nearby towns.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish pond and fish-selling business

loans.name: Segara Mandala Group

texts.en:
Ni ketut Suci Ariani is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Ni ketut Suci Ariani owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale.  Ni ketut Suci Ariani has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 300,000 - 400,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni ketut Suci Ariani joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to engage in business activities. Ni ketut Suci Ariani has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to build shelter for her livestock. She is requesting a new loan of 2,000,000 IDR to be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni ketut Suci Ariani plans to use the additional revenue generated to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Ni ketut Suci Ariani - (DNR.M-0695) merupakan 29 tahun wanita.  Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Tukadaya.  Ni ketut Suci Ariani adalah pemimpin kelompok sebuah kelompok peminjam yang terdiri atas 10 anggota.  Meskipun setiap anggota kelompok menerima pinjaman perorangan, mereka semua bertanggung jawab untuk mengembalikan pinjaman rekan anggota kelompok mereka jika ada yang menunggak atau gagal membayar.  Nama resmi kelompok peminjam ini adalah Segara Mandala (DNR.M-0695).


Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari beternak babi untuk dijual.  Ni ketut Suci Ariani sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun.  Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni ketut Suci Ariani menghasilkan sekitar 300,000 - 400,000 IDR.  Dalam 2007, Ni ketut Suci Ariani bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan  -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis.  Ni ketut Suci Ariani telah berhasil melunasi pinjaman sebelumnya sebesar 1,000,000 IDR dari DINARI.  Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membangun tempat berteduh/kandang bagi ternak peminjam.  Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 1,300,000 IDR.


Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI.


Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.


*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. .  Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam  Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

texts.en:

While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Segara Mandala (DNR.M-0695).
