loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chum S., 42, has been chosen to be a group leader of this loan by the other members. Chum S. is a widowed mother blessed with four children; all four children are teenagers and live in the family home. Two of her children are employed in different occupations: a daughter is a staff member for hotel and a son works in building place. At the moment, Chum S. sells flowers and decorating equipment by mobile transportation. She will be using this loan to order extra flowers to sell and the rest to repair her old house that needs repairs. The other borrowers who have joined this loan are:
K., will use the loan to buy zinc to cover the roof of her house.
M., is a rice seller, asking for a loan to order rice in bulk and re-sell to gain income. 
S. is a massage therapist for a hotel and requests a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To order extra flowers to sell.

loans.name: Hakim

texts.ru: Хакиму 53 года. Женат и отец 3-х детей. Хаким занимается продажей овощей на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Его жена помогает ему в бизнесе, иногда заменяет мужа, когда у Хакима есть другие дела. Хаким закупает овощи у дехканин, которые каждый день ранним утром приносят на рынок свежие фрукты и овощи. Хаким является постоянным клиентом нескольких дехканин. Сейчас время овощей нового сезона и Хаким просит очередной займ для закупки свежих овощей.
texts.en:
Hakim is 53 years old, married and has 3 children. He is involved in the sales of vegetables at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. Hakim’s wife helps him with the business by filling in for her husband sometimes when Hakim has other business to attend to. Hakim buys the vegetables from dekhan farmers, who bring fresh vegetables and fruits to the market early every morning. Hakim has several consistent suppliers among the farmers. Now is the time for a new vegetable season, and Hakim is requesting his next loan in order to purchase fresh vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Mrs. Touch Y. was born in 1959 and she now lives in Dei Eth Koh Pohs village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Sin Chhuon, are farmers who own a small piece of land on which they cultivate vegetables. In this, they face an obstacle because their field is infertile, which it is a bad enough to affect their plants. Thus, Mrs. Touch Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and she would use the rest of money to purchase pesticide.

Mrs. Touch Y. has eight children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is a vegetable seller; another three are fishers and help their parents’ work and the remaining two are attending the local school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chantha S. is the group leader of four who all live in Dei Eth Koh Pohs village in Kandal province.  She is 47 years old, a housewife, and the mother of three children, one of whom is a nurse, another is a laborer and the other is employed in a garment factory.

Her husband, Mr. Khun Sarin, is a construction worker. In his work, he does not have enough money to buy any construction supplies. Thus, Mrs. Chantha S. decided to ask for a loan to purchase construction supplies to support her husband’s work.

loans.use: To purchase construction supplies to support her husband’s work

loans.name: Both's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for four women who live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. Mrs. Both S., 45, has been selected to be the group leader by the other members. She is a local crop farmer who has been growing different kinds of vegetables in the village for more four years. She was married, but divorced her husband when her kids were very young. Six of her children are currently students in the primary public school. In order to alleviate her hard physical labor in the farming work, Both S. requests a loan to buy a cow to plow the farmland and to buy fertilizer to help grow the vegetable crops. 

The other three borrowers who are jointly taking a loan are the following: S. will use this loan to purchase a bicycle to make her family's transportation easier; T. is crop grower applying for a loan to build a housing step; and P. will use the loan money to buy fertilizer to fatten her crop yields.

loans.use: To buy a cow to plow the farmland

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
 Шаходат Чалолова имеет 12 летний стаж работы в сфере предпринимательской деятельности. Она очень приветливая женщина, в общении со своими клиентами вежлива. Шаходат замужем, и имеет 3 детей. старший сын женат, он работает таксистом, дочь вышла замуж и воспитывает детей. А младший сын Фариддун студент 3 курса университета. Фариддун и его отец помогают Шаходат в бизнесе. Она торгует хозяйственными товарами, необходимыми для дома и семьи.
 Сначала Шаходат привозила свой товар из Кыргызстана и продавала его оптом. Затем она покупала свой товар у поставщиков, которые привозили его из Китая. Сейчас, Шаходат планирует получить кредит и самой ездить в Китай за товаром. Привезенный товар она будет продовать оптом и в розницу. 
 Товар Шаходат подлежит продаже семь дней в неделю.
texts.en:
Shahodat C. has been an entrepreneur for 12 years. She is a very friendly woman and courteous with her clients. Shahodat is married and has 3 children. Her oldest son is married and works as a taxi driver. Shahodat’s daughter is married and raises children. Shahodat’s youngest son, Fariddun, is a third-year university student. Fariddun and his father help Shahodat with the business. She sells household products. Shahodat first brought her merchandise from Kyrgyzstan and sold it wholesale. Then, she bought the merchandise from suppliers, who brought the goods from China. Now, Shahodat plans to obtain a loan and bring merchandise from China on her own. She would sell the goods both wholesale and retail. Shahodat sells her products seven days a week.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase household products from China

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort, who is a 63-year-old mother of eight children, rears poultry. She also has a fish pond.  She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more poultry. Comfort says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen, a 45-year-old married mother of six children, sells provisions such as beverages, bathing soap, noodles, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. Queen says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell.

loans.name: Nazneen Muhammad Asif Khan Group

texts.en:
Musarat baji wants a loan to repair her auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Kosar parveen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring center.

Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy taps (faucets) and pipes for her sanitary supplies business.

Nazneen baji runs an embroidered clothes business to pay off the utilities. She is the wife of M. A. K. who is an auto-rickshaw driver. Presently, he does not have his own rickshaw. She is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Liv Sum Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank is located in Krapeu Troum Village in Kandal Province, and its 24 members plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Liv Summ, the village bank president selected by the members, is a hard-working farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which she cultivates rice. Because her field is currently infertile, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive. Mrs. Liv S. is a 63-year-old widow with a child who is employed in a garment factory.

Twenty members in this group loans have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor, allowing them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support the field to make her crop more productive.

loans.name: Shamsa Kanwal Muhammad Latif Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz baji and Anwar rani baji each want a loan to buy biscuits (cookies) and chips for their canteen.

Khushboo baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Shamsa kanwal baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan, for the past eighteen years. She operates a clothes-sewing business. In Pakistan most ladies prefer to do this business because their families don’t allow them to go outside for work.

Her husband’s name is M. L. and he runs a business making and selling plastic bags. He has been in this business for the past six years. She is applying for a loan to buy plastic beans for making her husband’s plastic bags.

loans.use: To buy plastic beans for her husband's business making plastic bags

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth, a 57-year-old married mother of five, sells kitchen utensils such as plates, cooking pots, blenders, etc. She hopes for the loan amount of N150,000 to purchase more kitchen utensils to sell. Elizabeth says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kitchen utensils to sell.

loans.name: Hamidan Muhammad Sharif Group

texts.en:
Fozia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Azra parveen baji wants a loan to buy biscuits (cookies) and chips for her canteen.

Hamidan baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past eighteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband works in a factory on monthly wage.

Hamidan baji, herself, operate a clothes-sewing business to pay off the utilities because her husband’s income is insufficient to meet the expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her clothes-sewing business.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for sewing clothes

loans.name: Esmina

texts.en:
Esmina Mešanović, born in 1964, lives with her husband, son and daughter in Stupari, near Kladanj where they all operate a family business for the production of charcoal for the grill. Additionally, Esmina`s husband owns a truck and provides transport services, while Esimna has a cow and sells the milk and milk products. They have been in this business a long time and used earnings from it to build their house.

Esmina has requested her first loan from WWI ( Žene za Žene International ) in the amount of 3000 KM to purchase wood for the production of charcoal. They hope to keep this business operating as it provides jobs for the family.

loans.use: Acquisition of wood for the production of charcoal for the grill.

loans.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Narantuya A. is 42, married, and has three children. Her family lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her eldest daughter Dariymaa, 21, is a university student, the two younger ones, 13 and 18 years of age, are attending an elementary and high school.  In 2000, together with her husband Shirmen, she started running a clothing business in a rental stall at Narantuul, the biggest four-season outdoor market in the capital city. She hires two tailors to make men's and women's coats and sport suits during the autumn, winter, and spring seasons. In summer, her eldest daughter helps her mother's business while having a vacation at home. 

Narantuya pays each tailor 200,000 tugrugs ($1 USD = 1450 MNT) a month. Coat and sport suit designs are mostly created by Narantuya or her eldest daughter. With the profit, Narantuya bought three types of sewing machine last year. She also pays her eldest daughter's tuition every year. Their customers are mostly students and herders. During the summer, she makes a lot of winter clothes and reserves them to sell in fall and winter since winter is an active shopping season in Mongolia. With the loan, she is planning to buy fabrics to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Bashiran Sajjad Hussain Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. 
Shazia baji wants a loan to buy material (leather and nails) for her shoe-making business. 
Naseem baji wants a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil. and spices) for her food-selling business. 

Bashiran baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. They all live in Lahore, Pakistan. Bashiran baji is married to S. H. who sells paint. Bashiran baji sews clothes to sell so she can pay the utility bills. She is applying for a loan to buy more paint to sell. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy paint

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty, 52, sells provisions like beverages, toothpaste, bathing soap, and so forth. She is married and has seven children. She is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase provisions to sell

loans.name: Mashkhura

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

  Машхура Пулотова любящая жена и мать 4 детей. Проживает в городе Истаравшане. Работает преподователем в средней школе № 39. Имеет 17 летний стаж работы в школе. Кроме этого, она продает куринные яйца. Муж Машхуры Фарход работает электриком. Впервые, Машхура узнав о нашей организации от соседей, которые являются нашими клиентами, обратилась к нам за помощью. Ей срочно нужны были деньги для ремонта крыши собственного дома. Ознакомившись со всеми нашими условиями кредитования, она смогла получить кредит и отремонтировать крышу своего дома.
  Сейчас Машхура подготавливается к зимнему сезону, и хочет за лето отремонтировать внутренее помещение своего дома. Для этого она запрашивает сумму 2000 сомони.
texts.en:
Mashkhura P. is a loving wife and mother of 4 children. She lives in the city of Istaravshan and works as a teacher at a secondary school number 39. She has 17 years of experience working at a school. Besides this work, she sells chicken eggs. Mashkhura’s husband, Farhod, works as an electrician. Once Mashkhura learned about our organization from her neighbors, who are also our clients, she asked for our help. She urgently needed money to repair the roof of her own house. Mashkhura familiarized herself with our lending terms, was able to obtain the loan and repair the roof. Now, Mashkhura is getting ready for the summer season and wants to do interior repairs to her house over the summer. She is requesting 2000 somoni for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home interior repairs

loans.name: Mrs. Phary Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group has 24 members, all of whom live in Krapeu Troum village in Kandal province. They will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Phary S., 37, is the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer to support the field and make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Oau Neat, is a construction worker. They have two children who attend the local school. 

Fourteen members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthL. payment loans. Those who have end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial for Cambodia’s poor. End-of-term loans allow clients to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of onL. 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Azra Parveen Abdul Majeed Mughal Group

texts.en:
Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy a lath machine. 
Hamidan baji wants a loan to buy wood for making wooden boxes to sell. 
Shakeela baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business. 
Naseem baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business. 

Azra parveen baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. They all live in Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband, A. M. M., runs a scrap business in the community. Azra baji has received no formal education because the community where she lives is very conservative and people don’t like to send girls to school. She was deprived of the education blessing. But she learnt the art of sewing clothes from her mother and now she is taking advantage of this skill to make money. She saves her income and plans to renovate her house with the money. She is applying for a loan to buy scrap for her husband’s scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: In the photo, Azra baji is displaying a dress that she is sewing.

loans.use: To buy scrap for scrap business

loans.name: Treal's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five people. Its leader, Mrs. Treal T., is age 29. Presently, She turns palm leaves into furniture and then sells door-to-door in the village for a profit. Another source of the family's income comes from her husband who works driving a motor taxi. This modest couple are good parents who are very responsible to their one young child who is still not enrolled in school.

Recently, the family's living conditions are not comfortable due to their house being surrounded by bad water during the coming rainy season, which is harmful to their health. Therefore, Treal T. requested a loan to buy the plot of land surrounding her house.

There are four borrowers who are jointly taking this loan: 

Mr. C. will use this loan to buy a bicycle to ride to his work in construction.

Mrs. C. is a local mat weaver who is asking for a loan to purchase more raw materials.

Mrs. E. will be using the loan to buy material to make mats.

Mrs. C. is looking for a loan to buy a bicycle for her family's riding needs.

loans.use: To buy the plot of land surrounding her house

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero makes a living selling groceries and various other provisions. She is 32 years old, married and has three children. She is applying for this loan to buy more provisions to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their support and assistance.

loans.use: To buy more provisions to sell to her customers

loans.name: Zayat

texts.en:
Zayat B. is 52, married and the father of one son and two daughters. He lives with his daughters and wife on a plot of land he owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Zayat's spouse, Munhtsetseg, has worked as an assistant teacher at a kindergarten for her entire life. His eldest son, Tumenjargal, is 25 years old and has his own family, which lives on a nearby plot of land. 

Zayat worked as a driver for his entire life. After retiring, he started a retail business selling small electronic items. Besides this business, Zayat repairs TVs in a small room at the local market. Zayat is a hard-working person, and is applying for this loan to buy TV accessories and small electronic items in Ereen, a city near the Chinese border.

loans.use: To buy TV accessories and small electronic items

loans.name: Samina Muhammad Arshad Group

texts.en:
Majeedan begum baji wants a loan to buy goats for her butcher shop. Khalida parveen baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell. Nargis baji wants a loan to buy another sewing machine for her tailoring center. Haleema baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business.

Samina baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband's name is M. A.. He has a business selling spare auto parts. Samina baji knows that it’s very hectic work and has spent long hours been on this work. She takes care of him and spends her time in service of him. She is applying for a loan to buy more spare auto parts to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy spare auto parts to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria sells foodstuffs, like bags of garri, in retail to her customers. She is 61 years old and married with nine children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N80,000 to purchase more bags of garri to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of garri to sell.

loans.name: Rehana Abdul Sattar Group

texts.en:
Jamila baji wants a loan to buy cigarettes to sell. Khalida baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics, dryer machines, and brushes for her beauty salon. Rukhsana kosar baji wants a loan to buy milk to sell. Maryam baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making and selling business.

Rehana baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. She is a very active lady and performs her duties very efficiently. Her husband's name is A. S. and he runs a Punjabi food selling business. He sells samosas and pakodas to the community. Rehana baji also helps him by making the food. She is applying for a loan to buy cooking oil, spices, potatoes, and flour for her husband’s Punjabi food selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Note: Khalida baji is shown her parlor in this picture.

loans.use: To buy materials for her husband's food business.

loans.name: Rehana Ibrar Hussain Group

texts.en:
Razia kosar baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her dairy business.

Shaheen baji wants a loan to buy decorative embroidery materials for preparing decorative-embroidered dresses.

Safia baji wants a loan to buy plastic beans for her plastic-bag-making business.

Sajida parveen baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell.

Rehana baji, wife of I. H., has lived in Lahore, Pakistan, for the past fourteen years. Her husband runs a paint-selling business and has been doing this work for the past six years. Rehana baji helps him by preparing embroidered dresses. She saves her money in a committee and plans to invest in her husband’s business so that he is able to expand his business. She is applying for a loan to buy paint boxes to complete the orders of his customers.

loans.use: To buy paint boxes for her husband to sell

loans.name: Mrs Pao Sokh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of thirteen members, is located in Preah Theat village in Kandal province. Its members plan to use the loan that they obtain for a variety of purposes.

Mrs Pao S. is the village bank president selected by the members. She is 45 years old and the mother of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other two are enrolled in the local school. She and her husband, Mr Yuon Sarin, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate rice. They do not have enough money to meet all the expenses of cultivation, so Mrs Pao S. decided to ask for a loan both to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field and to buy fertilizer.

Mrs Sambo does not come to take a loan but her husband does, so he is shown in the picture instead.

Four members in this group loan have end-of-term (EoT) loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. An EoT loan is AMK’s main product because it is most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. The rest of the group members have monthly payment loans. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with oxen and buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mahmudchon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Махмудчон Хакимов торгует на рынке города Истаравшана. Он продает носки. Товар он приобретает у поставщиков. Поставщики же в свою очередь привозят товар из Кыргызстана. Займ хочет получить для расширения своего бизнеса. Дополнительно Махмудчон подрабатывает охраником в центральной библиотеке, в ночной смене.
 Махмудчон женат и имеет сына и дочь.
texts.en:
Mahmudchon H. is married and has a son and a daughter. He sells socks at a market in the city of Istaravshan. He buys his merchandise from suppliers, who bring the goods from Kyrgyzstan. Mahmudchon also works as a night security guard at the central library. Mahmudchon wants to obtain a loan in order to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Parveen Akhtar Ghulam Sarwar Group

texts.en:
Nasreen begum baji wants a loan to buy music players to sell.

Sajida baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

M. baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell.

Shamshad baji wants a loan to buy medicines to sell.

Parveen akhtar baji is the wife of G. S. who is a driver by profession and drives a rented auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). After the whole day’s struggle he only keeps half of his income. Parveen baji operates a clothes-sewing business to share the financial burden of her husband. Now she is applying for a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband so that he gets the whole income of his struggle.

loans.use: To buy an auto-rickshaw for her husband's business

loans.name: Saidboi

texts.ru: Саидбой мужчина 53 лет. Женат и отец 5-х детей. Саидбой занимается продажей овощей и фруктов на рынке "Панчшанбе" города Худжанда. Его жена домохозяйка. Саидбой закупает овощи у дехканин, которые каждый день ранним утром приносят на рынок свежие фрукты и овощи. Саидбой и его сосед по торговле Хаким являются постоянными клиентами нескольких дехканин. Сейчас время овощей нового сезона и Саидбой просит очередной займ для закупки свежих овощей.
texts.en:
Saidboi is 53 years old, married and has 5 children. He is involved in the sales of vegetables and fruits at the Panchshanbe market in the city of Khujand. His wife is a homemaker. Saidboi buys the vegetables from dekhan farmers, who deliver fresh fruits and vegetables early every morning. Saidboi and his retail neighbor, Hakim, are repeat clients of several farmers. Now is the time for a new vegetable season, and Saidboi is requesting his next loan to purchase fresh vegetables.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
There are four borrowers who are jointly taking this small loan. Mrs. S. has been selected to be group leader by the other members. She is 28 and the mother of five children who are of school-age. She currently earns a living raising a few pigs from home. Additionally, she is a requirement worker for a construction company. She is married to Chantha, age 48, a military policeman.

Recently, S. sold her pigs to a slaughterer but she can't acquire another pig to raise due to the family's financial problems. Therefore, she has decided to seek a loan for capital to purchase pig-feed and a piglet to raise.

The other three borrowers are:

R., who has two businesses: distilling wine and raising pigs. She is looking for a loan to buy a motorcycle to ride and support her business action.

T., who will be using the loan to order mats, nets, and cradles to sell.

S., who will use the loan to repair an existing motorbike that has broken down.

loans.use: To purchase pig-feed and a piglet to raise

loans.name: Hashmat Begum Muhammad Iqbal Group

texts.en:
Hashmat begum baji and Parveen akhtar baji both reside in a city named Lahore, Pakistan. Lahore city is famous for its historic places and for its punjabi foods. They both are very hardworking ladies. They handle their own businesses to share the financial burden with their husbands. Parveen baji is the member of Hashmat baji. They both are very happy with the good behavior of each other.

Hashmat baji is applying for a loan to buy clothes for her husband's clothes selling busines and Parveen baji wants a loan to buy material (creams and cosmetics) for her beauty salon.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Mr. Chenda Tim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty seven people living in Preah Theat village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Chenda T. is the 28-year-old village bank president.

Mr. Chenda T. is a farmer who owns 0.5-hectar (1.25-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice. In his plantation, he faces a problem because his field is infertile. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer; he would use the rest of loan to hire laborers to work on the field. His wife, Mrs. Num Dara, is a construction worker. This couple has two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the youngest one is just two years old.

Mr. Liheng P. did not come to take a loan but his wife did, so she is shown in the picture instead. 

Seventeen members in this group are taking end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Those taking end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.

End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to hire laborers to work on the field

loans.name: Sharf-Un-Nisa Muhammad Naseem Group

texts.en:
Sharf-un-nisa baji is the leader of this group of women. She is married to M. N. who runs a bookshop. M. N. has a variety of books in his shop, although he specializes in “religious and syllabus books”. Sharf baji operates a business sewing clothes. She works to save money to buy an electric sewing machine. She is applying for a loan to buy books for her husband’s bookshop.

Yasmeen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Rukhsana shaheen baji wants a loan to buy ingredients (cooking oil, spices and lentils) for her food-selling business.

Kosar K. baji and Khalida parveen baji want a loan to buy sewing machines for their tailoring center.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy books for bookshop

loans.name: Shakira Rukhsana Tanveer Hussain Group

texts.en:
Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (biscuits & chips) to sell. 
Sanjeeda baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for her tailoring center. 
Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).
Zareena kosar baji wants a loan to buy a lath machine. 

Shakira rukhsana baji is the wife of T. H. and has lived in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last fifteen years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for its Punjabi foods. Her husband runs a tailoring center where he sews both ladies' and gentlemen's clothing. Shakra baji also operates a business sewing clothes. She saves her money with a committee and uses it as needed. She is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her husband’s tailoring center.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine for a tailoring center

loans.name: Aziz

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Азиз Рахимов мужчина 46 лет, женат имеет 4 детей. Две дочери Азиза замужем, а двое его сыновей уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию.Занимается Азиз животноводством. Дома у него 7 голов крупнорогатого скота, которых он откармливает и продает. В выходные дни подрабатывает таксистом, и имеет 2 га. земли, где он выращивает кукурузу. 
 Азиз хочет купить еще одного бычка, с этой целью он подал заявку на получение кредита. Запрашиваемая сумма для покупки бычка 1600 сомони.
texts.en:
Aziz R. is 46 years old, married and has 4 children. Two of his daughters are married, and both of his sons left to work in the Russian Federation. Aziz is involved in animal husbandry. He owns 7 cattle that he feeds and sells. He also works as a taxi driver on weekends and owns 2 hectares of land where he grows corn. Aziz wants to buy an additional bull and requested a loan for this purpose. He needs a loan in the sum of 1600 somoni.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Dariimaa

texts.en:
Dariimaa T. is fifty-three years old and has reared ten children. She currently lives with her husband in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All of her children have grown up and live with their own families now. Dariimaa has a small retail business, selling various small food items such as chewing gum, soft-drinks, cigars, and so on.

In 2000, her family moved from Khovd, one of the most isolated western provinces in Mongolia, to the capital city in search of a better life. In 2001, she started her small retail business in the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. Now she is expanding her business by diversifying the products she sells at the market.

Seeing an opportunity in the underwear market, and utilizing her experience in retail, she has decided to enter this new market. Dariimaa seems to be a very responsible person in business and finance. She is requesting a loan to buy underwear to sell. With the profits from her business, she hopes to enlarge her house.

loans.use: To buy underwear to sell

loans.name: Jeannine

texts.en: Jeannine B. has a dinnerware business, selling plates and other dishes and glassware. She is twenty-eight years old and married with one five-year-old child. Jeannine and her husband both work to earn a living for their family. Working from 7am to 8pm every day, she currently makes an income of 327,000 FRW (~ USD $654). Jeannine has requested a 500,000 FRW (USD $1000) loan to help expand her business. She also has plans to begin saving money from the profits of the loan. Jeannine has had two previous loans with Vision Finance Company since she started up her business in 2006. She has since hired two employees.

loans.use: To buy dinnerware to sell

loans.name: Nary

texts.en: O. Nary is twenty-seven years old and a tailor who earns about $2.30 a day. She is married and blessed with a three-month-old child. Her husband is a construction worker who normally earns $4 a day. To improve the family's living  situation before her child is old enough for school, she plans to take out a $600 loan from Kiva to buy cows to resell. By doing this, she hopes she will be able to fix her house and save some more money for her family's use in the future.

loans.use: To buy cows to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace L. sells cosmetics, beverages, baby diapers, and various other items. She is married with five children, and she is fifty-three years old. She hopes to borrow N170,000 to purchase more cosmetics and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics and provisions to sell

loans.name: Gunjidmaa

texts.en:
Gunjidmaa J. is fifty-one years old and the mother of two. Her husband passed away a few years ago and she currently lives with her daughter in a "ger", which is a traditional tent, on land that her sibling owns. Her eldest son is married and lives with his wife next to her mother's home. Her daughter is a university student.

Gunjidmaa has a small retail business in women's and men's stockings. She rents a small stall at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar, and sells a variety of socks. She purchases most of the socks that she sells from the wholesale markets in Ulaanbaatar.

She says that her daughter will be starting at the university in the fall of 2009. She intends to increase her inventory and expand her business in order to earn her daughter's tuition (about $485) from this summer's profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more socks for her business.

loans.use: To buy more socks to increase her business inventory

loans.name: Mer

texts.en: Mer is forty-nine years old and works for a non-government organization in Takeo Province with a daily income of about $2.30. She is married and has three children. Her husband drives a taxi from the Province to the Capital City, and he can make as much as $151 a month. Due to the fact that her husband’s car, which he uses as a taxi, is old and often under repair, she wants to take out a loan of $1000 from Kiva to buy a new car. The car will be more useful to her husband and will generate more income for the family.

loans.use: To buy a new car

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace E. sells hair extensions and creams. She is married with four children and she is forty-four years old. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more hair extensions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions to sell

loans.name: Tasleem Riaz Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell. 
Another Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery store. 
Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. 
Rubina baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her bike rental business. 
Salma baji wants a loan to buy bangles to sell.

Tasleem baji is the wife of Mr. R. and has lived in a city named Lahore, in Pakistan, for the last fifteen years. Her husband has been an auto-rickshaw driver (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) for the last five years. Tasleem baji is a very active lady who performs all her duties very efficiently and takes care of her family. She is applying for a loan to fix her husband’s auto-rickshaw, because its engine has a problem of seizing up and needs repair right away.
 
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair her husband's auto-rickshaw

loans.name: Bayarmagnai

texts.en:
Bayarmagnai N. lives with her husband and two teenage children in the Bayanzurh district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her children are both high school students. Her husband, Dorjderem, has a small retail business butchering animals to prepare their meat for selling.

Bayarmagnai runs a small retail business in second-hand clothing. Since 2003, she has been selling second-hand clothes at the Narantuul market, the largest outdoor market in Ulaanbaatar. She purchases the clothes in large boxes from the wholesale market in Ulaanbaatar and sells individually-priced clothes at the stall that she rents at the Narantuul market. From the beginning, she has gained significant experience in retail.

In the future, she intends to expand her business by adding new clothes imported from Beijing, China. She requests a loan to purchase more second-hand clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy used clothes to sell

loans.name: Adeline

texts.en: Adeline is 46 years old and is married with four children. She sells sarongs of various colors. She is requesting the loan amount of 100,000 NGN to purchase more sarongs to sell. She is grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Sambath

texts.en: C. Sambath, 43, pictured with her husband, is married and has five children – four of them are students, and the other is employed with a fair salary. Sambath has produced rice wine since 2000 and earns a daily income of $3.3 USD. In order to reduce the difficulty of supporting her children, she wants to take a loan of $600 USD from Kiva partner, CREDIT. She will use the loan to purchase more rice to make wine so that she can expand her business. Her perspective is that she wants to have a good standard of living by succeeding with her current business plan.

loans.use: To buy rice to make rice wine

loans.name: Rahbar

texts.ru: Рахбар 39 лет. Вдова и мать 3-х детей. Её муж умер несколько лет назад по болезни. Теперь Рахбар должна растить своих детей одна своими силами. Она старается чтобы ее дети не чувствовали отсутствие отца и ни в чем не нуждались. Рахбар занимается продажей парфюмерии на втором этаже рынка "Панчшанбе" магазин № 234. Она работает не жалея сил чтобы заработать на жизнь, учебу детей и на сбережения. Рахбар закупает товар у фирм-поставщиков. Рахбар просит новый займ для закупки дезодорантов Рексона и Олд спайс в летний сезон.
texts.en:
Rahbar is 39 years old. She is a widow and a mother of 3 children. Her husband passed away several years ago due to an illness. Since then, Rahbar had to raise their children all by herself. She tries to compensate for her husband’s absence and to meet her children’s needs. Rahbar is involved in the sales of perfumes at the store #234 on the second floor of the Panchshanbe market. She works extraordinarily hard in order to earn enough for life, school for her children and savings. Rahbar buys her merchandise from supplier firms. Rahbar is requesting a new loan in order to purchase Reckson and Old Spice deodorants for the summer season.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Reckson and Old Spice deodorants

loans.name: Chan Mali

texts.en: L. Chan MaL. is a 28-year-old widow. She has a fruit stand at the market, which is well-located and therefore good for business. L. Chan MaL. lives with her young child and hopes that her only child will be able to finish high school and study at a good university. To generate more income and save for the family’s future, she has decided to take a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, CREDIT, in order to expand her inventory in the fruit business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit to sell

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en:
A. Inobat is married and has two grown children. She owns a little place at the central market in the town of Isfara where she sells various types of clothing. Some of the advantages of her business are variety, consistency, and affordable prices. Inobat has been working in this business for ten years. She is always seeking to grow and develop her business, and improve her entrepreneurial skills. Currently, Inobat is requesting a loan of 3500 TJS to purchase more goods for the summer season. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family’s financial situation.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase clothes to sell for the summer season

loans.name: Nhen

texts.en: M. Nhen, 48, has produced and sold palm fruit and palm cakes for a living since 1985. She sells her produce in the local market of Takeo Province. Nhen lives with her husband whose job is selling palm juice, and she has three children – one of them is a student, and the other two are garment factory workers. To improve her business, Nhen wants a loan of $1000 USD from Kiva partner, CREDIT, to purchase palm sugar and sell it to customers at a local market. She hopes that when her business is bigger, she will be able to generate more income for family use and expenses.

loans.use: To buy palm sugar to sell

loans.name: Kaniz Fatima Muhammad Shafiq Group

texts.en:
This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own business. The members mutually guarantee each other's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Kaniz Fatima Baji is the wife of M. S.. She has lived in Lahore, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband runs a tailoring center in the community. He earns income by sewing both women’s and men’s clothes. Kaniz Baji is applying for a loan to buy an electric sewing machine for her husband so that he can sew more clothes and complete the orders on time. Parveen Akhtar Baji wants a loan to buy items for her barber shop, such as chairs, scissors, and mirrors. Huma Baji wants a loan to buy utensils to sell.

loans.use: To buy an electric sewing machine

loans.name: Chamreoun

texts.en: Chamreoun E. is 45 years old and married. She has four children of which three are students and one is a garment worker. She makes a living by selling groceries at her home for a daily income of $8. Her husband is employed in a garment factory in Phnom Penh City where he earns a daily income of $3. She plans to take a KIVA loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for the transportation of her groceries. She hopes that, with the success of her business plan, she will be able to decorate her house and push all her three children to a good school of higher education.

loans.use: buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina sells eggs and sarongs. She is 41 years old, married, and has four children. She hopes for a loan of NGN 80,000 to purchase more eggs and sarongs to sell. She is thankful for Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more eggs and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Abdulaziz

texts.en:
H. Abdulaziz is a farmer. Previously he was a security guard. He grows potato, melon, and watermelon to earn the money necessary to feed his family and to provide all his children with an education. Abdulaziz has already been tilling the farm for seven years. His business has helped him pay school fees and buy the things they need like electricity, food, and water. Abdulaziz is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS. He will use the loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides. The loan will really help him increase his yield.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Ulugbek

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Улугбек Нарзиев занимается животноводством около 17 лет. Дома откармливает крупнорогатый скот и перерабатывает молоко. В переработке молока ему помогает жена Назира. Она производит вкусный кефир  из молока и продает его соседям. У Улугбека с Назирой 4 детей.
 Кроме животноводства Улугбек занимается сельским хозяйством. Выращенный урожай продает на овощном рынке. Улугбеку помогает в выращивании сельхозкультур его брат.
 Улугбек хочет получить займ, и планирует потратить его на покупку бычка.
texts.en:
Ulugbek N. has been involved in animal husbandry almost 17 years. He feeds cattle and processes milk at home. His wife, Nazira, helps him with the milk processing. She makes delicious kefir from the milk and sells it to their neighbors. Ulugbek and Nazira have 4 children. Besides animal husbandry, Ulugbek is involved in agriculture. He sells his harvest at the vegetable market. Ulugbek’s brother helps him with the agricultural business. Ulugbek wants to obtain a loan in order to buy a bull.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a bull

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is 20 years old and lives with his father and mother. He has been a farmer since he was young. Because he comes from a family of farmers, they taught him everything about the business. He mostly plants potatoes and onions. Throughout all these years of work, Abdurahmon has been able to succeed in his business. In the future Abdurahmon is planning to have a bigger stable. He will extend the fields he cultivates. Now he has asked for a loan of 2,000 TJS that he will spend on seeds and fertilizer. He promises to work responsibly and he sincerely thanks all lenders who have decided to support him. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Lorn

texts.en: S. Lorn, 42, has been in the business of selling cows since 2000 in the Takeo Province. He is married and has four children. His wife is a grocery and food seller, and she also uses her free time to do tailoring for some more income; consequently, she is able to make a gross income of $50 per day. Lorn wants to take a Kiva loan of $500 to buy more goods for his wife's grocery business, besides working in the field with their farmland and tailoring. He and his wife have set a clear goal for their lives. He wants to have a new house, and he hopes all of his children will be able to study at a good university and have special working skills to earn their own living and to save the country. (Lorn and his wife are photographed with the tailoring business )

loans.use: Buying more groceries and food for grocery business

loans.name: Muhamadayub

texts.en:
Muhamadayub K. is 36. He is married with 3 children. Muhamadayub says he comes from a humble family and, from a very young age, he helped his father in the fields, which is why he never finished his studies. Despite that, he feels fortunate to be with his wife, who helps him sell with their farming business. Muhamadayub cultivates tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and watermelons. He comments that he is very thankful for what he has and, thanks to the dedication and support from his family, he can have a dignified life and give a better life to his children. At this time, he is applying for a loan in order to buy more seeds and fertilizer which will help him cultivate more vegetables. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists, and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New Western culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History:

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Furkat

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its inception, MLF “MicroInvest” became a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October, 2008, MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC ‘Frontiers”, founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.

“Arvand”, being an assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out the mission to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Furkat U. was born in 1982 in the Istaravshan region of Tajikistan. Furkat has a specialized education, but because of the low salary he has to be involved in another business. He is married. Furkat is engaged in commercial service and trade, so he trades sweets in the local bazaar in Istaravshan. Furkat has traded chocolates, cakes, and other sweets for 15 years. His mother helps him during the weekend. Furkat is applying to KIVA with the request of business development loan of 1600 STJ to purchase new goods of a greater assortment. Furkat buys sweets in Khukand 2 times per week. There is additional family income from the sale of traditional dresses. Furkat thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To purchase new goods of a greater assortment.

loans.name: Fata

texts.en: Fata Avdibašić is 36 and comes from a suburb of the town Živinice. She lives there with her husband and three school aged children. Fata has already been a recipient of a Kiva loan, which she repaid successfully. Fata and her husband work in agriculture keeping the livestock. This is their family business and the only source of the income for their home budget. They are improving their business every season and this year they bought a tractor, not a new one but one in good condition. They had some savings, but it was not enough to pay the full price for the tractor. So, Fata decided to request a loan from WWI (Žene za žene International) in the amount of 1200 KM. The tractor will help them a lot in their business as working the land will be much faster and easier.

loans.use: To pay for a tractor.

loans.name: Marufakhon

texts.en:
Marufakhon O. is 51 years old. She is married with 4 children. She started her own business 6 years ago because her husband’s salary wasn’t enough for their family expenses. Marufakhon, together with the help of her son (pictured), sells confectionery like candies, cookies, and pastries in the local market. The generated income allows Marufakhon to support her family. She dreams of educating all of her children with a higher education. Today, she is requesting 6000 Somoni that she will use to purchase confectionery for expanding the range of goods. The income she will receive will be spent on the well being of her family, as well as for her children's education.

loans.use: stockpiling and selling cereals

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат – молодая женщина 37 лет, замужем и мать 2-х детей. Её муж занимается купле -продажей скота на скотном рынке. А она откармливает крупнорогатый скот дома. Она помогает мужу в развитии его бизнеса, потому что хочет иметь больше прибыли, чтобы расширять семью, так как в сельских местностях принято рожать больше 3-х детей.  За счет займа они хотят увеличить количество скота и  получить больше прибыли. Карамат просит новый займ для закупки 2-х бычков.
texts.en:
Karamat is a young 37-year-old woman, who is married mother of 2 children. Her husband is involved in animal sales at the livestock market. Karamat feeds cattle at home. She helps her husband with the development of their business in order to have bigger profits and to expand their family. It is customary in the rural areas to have more than 3 children. Karamat and her husband want to use this loan to increase their livestock quantity and make greater profits. Karamat is requesting a new loan for the purchase of 2 bulls.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Khairullo

texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following its inception, MLF “MicroInvest” became a Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. In October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest”, together with LLC ‘Frontiers”, founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”.

“Arvand”, being an assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out the mission of improving the standard of living of the population and creating new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Khairullo A. lives in the Istaravshan region of Tajikistan and he is married and has 4 children. His wife does not work so she brings up their children and she makes traditional dresses that she sells through trading agents. Khairullo makes windows and wood doors, and he also works on a building repair team. Khairullo is a good builder and has repeat customers. Khairullo has applied to KIVA with the request of 3000 STJ to purchase building materials that will permit him to increase the work volume and income. He thanks KIVA for its support of small business development.

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: growing yams

loans.name: Main De L'eternel Plus Group

texts.fr: Marie N. est membre d’un des groupes de Hope dénommé « Main de l’Eternel Plus » depuis janvier 2008. Le but d’intégrer ce groupe était d’avoir un soutient financier permanent en vue de réaliser son rêve d’ouvrir un jour une boutique générale pour accroitre le revenu de son affaire. Elle a commencé son activité en 1991 avec un capital initial de $70. De 1991 - 2007, Marie a acquit une expérience solide en vendant du sucre. Malgré la perturbation de son affaire par des guerres et instabilités politiques des années quatre vingt-dix à Kinshasa, Marie a lutté pour la maintenir  en réinvestissant les bénéfices réalisés, en travaillant inlassablement et par une bonne gestion. Elle a diversifié son affaire grâce aux plusieurs prêts reçus de Hope RDC, qu’elle a remboursé totalement  à temps. Son activité consiste aujourd’hui à acheter et livrer du thé, du café ainsi que du soja à ses clients. Le crédit qu’elle a obtenu le mois de juin courant lui a servi d’acheter 1 sac du sucre, 1sac du riz et du lait à revendre dans le but d’accroitre le bénéfice. Actuellement, son capital propre est de $180. Son affaire réalise un bénéfice de $40 par semaine. Marie est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et mère de 7 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 3 et 29 ans. Quatre d’entre eux étudient. Elle vend dans un quartier périphérique le plus peuplé de Kinshasa, situé au nord de celle-ci.
texts.en:
Marie N. has been a member of one of the Hope groups called « Main de l’Eternel Plus » (The Hand of the Eternal Plus) since January 2008. The goal of joining this group was to have permanent financial support so that she could make her dream of having a general store one day come true. In this way she believed she could increase the income from her business.

Marie began her business in 1991 with an initial capital of US$ 70. From 1991 - 2007, Marie acquired solid experience in selling sugar. Despite the pertubation of her business by the wars and political instability of the 90s in Kinshasa, Marie struggled to maintain her position by reinvesting her profits, working without cease, and by good management. She diversified her business thanks to various loans she received from Hope DRC, which she reimbursed in a timely fashion.

Today her business consists in buying and delivering tea, coffee, and soy to her customers. The loan that she received in this month of June was used to buy 1 sack of sugar, 1 sack of rice, and some milk to resell with the intention of increasing her profit. Presently, her personal capital stands at US$ 180. Her business is bringing in US$ 40 per month.

Marie is 46, married and the mother of 7 children whose ages vary between 3 and 29. Four of them are enrolled in school. She does her business in an outlying and very populous neighborhood north of Kinshasa.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 1 sack of rice and 1 sack of sugar to re-sell

loans.use: growing yams

loans.name: Zahro

texts.en:
Zahro R. is 31 years old, a devoted mother living with her 3 children and her husband. She makes the most of an opportunity, such as when she started selling confectioneries in the food market of Isfara town. In this way, with the constant attention she gives almost all day long every day, she gets shoppers, which enables her to contribute to the home finances. This is an activity Zahro enjoys because she can rest from the hard labor in the countryside. She is motivated to do this work by the need to help support the family's finances, and she is able to take care of the education of her children who study in school. Zahro is requesting a loan with which she will invest in merchandise for her shop. She wishes to stock it with more products and offer the best every day.

loans.name: Mukarrama

texts.ru: Мукаррама - молодая женщина 1990 года рождения. Она недавно вышла замуж. Мукаррама занимается откормом крупно рогатого и мелко рогатого скота. Она этим занимается вместе со своей свекровью. Они домохозяйки, нигде не работают и дома занимается этой деятельностью. Когда Мукаррама была девушкой, она помогала своему отцу. Теперь у нее отдельная молодая семья и она помогает своему мужу. Её муж занимается скотоводством. Мукаррама и её свекровь помогают мужчинам в увеличении их семейного бюджета. Мукаррама хочет взять новый для закупки мелко рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Mukarrama is a young woman, born in 1990. She recently got married. Mukarrama is involved in feeding large and small livestock. She participates in this business with her mother-in-law. They are both homemakers, not employed and run the business from home. When Mukarrama was a girl, she used to help her father. Now she has her own young family and helps her husband, who is involved in animal husbandry. Mukarrama and her mother-in-law help the men to increase their family budget. Mukarrama wants to obtain a new loan in order to buy small livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Abdumutalib

texts.en:
Abdumutalib G. is 38 years old. He lives with his wife and their 4 children. His children are currently in school and help out with the farm work, too. He plans to improve the living conditions of his family. Abdumutalib has been a farmer for 6 years and his hardest time is during the winter when the crops don’t grow well. He began farming with his parents, and now needs a loan to improve production. This is the first time that he will use a loan to improve his crop yield and sales. Abdumutalib will use this loan to buy fertilizers and materials so that he will have a successful crop and he will then sell his production for the best price at the market.

texts.en: Snežana Jovanović was born in 1977 and comes from Srebrenica. She lives there with her child and husband. Her husband works outside of Bosnia-Herzegovina. Snežana owns a boutique and works there every day. She repaid one loan by WWI and requested a new one in the amount of 700 KM. She will invest this loan in her clothes business. This business keeps Snežana busy and helps her to increase her household income.

loans.use: To purchase clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.en:
Mavluda M. is 26 years old. She is a widow and has a little son. For almost 5 years now, Mavluda has had a beauty salon business. Every day she services many brides. In general, she offers bridal gowns, manicures, pedicures, make-up, and hair styles. Her salon is always full of clients, because she does her job professionally. She wants to take out a loan to expand her business. She wants to buy additional equipment and goods for her beauty shop. Mavluda likes her job very much, because she likes to see the smiles of happy brides every day .

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en:
Shavkat is 38 years old, married, and lives with his wife and daughter and 4 children. He grew up with agriculture, and his parents did the same work, and he still works planting seeds. He grows seasonal crops on his land, working with the crops until it is time to harvest them. In addition, as an extra income, he raises cattle. This is his first loan from Kiva partner IMON International. Shavkat will buy seeds and fertilizers for his land with this loan.

loans.name: Lawa

texts.en:
Lawa J. is currently in the business of selling bread and paste and is requesting a loan to open up a bakery.  Lawa is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a clerk in the Ministry of education, science and technology, government of southern Sudan. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a big shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.
