loans.use: To grow corn

loans.name: Komi Ernest

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un résident du quartier de kégué,  il a appris la cuisine, et très tôt en 2000, étant  célibataire et devant subvenir à ses propres besoins, il a ouvert un restaurant dans le quartier de Novissi qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Ses plats sont très appréciés par ses clients, il jouit d’une très bonne réputation. Actuellement sont stock de matières nécessaires à son activité de restauration sont épuisés, il veut rehausser son stock, ayant déjà obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu’il a remboursé, il sollicite un second crédit pour acheter  les matières nécessaires aux activités de la restauration et des casiers de boissons.
texts.en:
This gentleman is a resident of the Kégué district. He learned how to cook, and being unmarried supporting himself, he soon opened a restaurant in 2000 in Novissi, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. His dishes are highly appreciated by his customers. He enjoys a very good reputation. His stock of supplies that are needed for the restaurant business is now exhausted. He wants to replenish his stock. Having already had a WAGES loan which he repaid, he’s requesting a second loan to buy what’s necessary for his business and some cases of drinks.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the goods necessary for his restaurant business and some cases of beverages

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en:
S. Khurshed was born in 1984 in Istaravshan. He is married and his young wife takes care of the family and does not work. Khurshed is engaged in commercial service and trade (he trades in salads, cabbage, peppers). He applies to KIVA with the request of the business support loan of 1000 STJ. He brings the goods from Khujand (2nd largest city in Tajikistan). This is his first loan from “Arvand”. He intends to use the funds to expand his trade so that it permits him to increase the assortment of goods and, accordingly, the business turnover. Khurshed wishes all the best and thanks for the business support. 

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services, to the population of Tajikistan. Following each step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” seeks a transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October 2008, MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”. “Arvand”, being assignee of “MicroInvest”, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

loans.use: To expand his inventory.

loans.name: Revina

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 31-year-old Revina D. from Mwanza. She is single. Revina has been running a beauty salon since 2006. This is the place where you can buy long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair, blue hair, and then have it attached to your head, woven, cut, or braided, and made to look like your own. She works at the business for 12 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by one employee. Revina currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase long hair, short hair, curly hair, straight hair, red hair and blue hair. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Revina thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase hair pieces for beauty salon.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Agricultrice très dynamique et dévouée, Mme Eya K. est née en 1977 à Nyigbé. Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle exerce comme activité la culture du maïs, activité qui lui procure les revenus pour se prendre en charge et sa famille. Aujourd’hui ses rendements diminuent à cause de l’appauvrissement de ses sols. Elle demande donc un crédit pour acheter les engrais et autres intrants agricoles en vue d’accroître ses rendements et ses revenus.
texts.en:
A very dynamic and dedicated farmer, Ms. Eya K. … in 1977 in Nyigbé. She is married and the mother of three. Her business involves growing corn and brings in the revenue to support herself and her family. Today, her yields are diminishing due to soil depletion. She’s therefore asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and other agricultural supplies with the aim of increasing her yields and her revenues.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: culture du maïs

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette femme  est mariée, elle n’a pas d’enfants, elle aide beaucoup son  mari dans les charges du foyer. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’elle exerce est le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale. Elle a ouvert à cet effet une boutique qu’elle a appelé « ETS ASSACK ». sa clientèle grandit de jour en jour, elle veut agrandir son stock pour mieux les servir c’est pour cela qu’elle demande un crédit à WAGES pour acheter 5 sacs de maïs , 5 bidons d’huile de 25 litres, 2 cartons de tomates en boîtes de conserve et divers produits d’alimentation générale.
texts.en:
This woman is married but has no children. She helps her husband a lot in paying household expenses. She sells foodstuffs to earn money. To do this, she has opened a little store that she calls « ETS ASSACK ». Her clientele is growing by the day, so she wants to expand her inventory to better serve them. That is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 5 sacks of maize, 5 jerry cans of 25 liters of oil, two cases of tinned tomatoes, and various other grocery items.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of grocery inventory for resale

loans.name: Murodchon

texts.ru: Муродчон – мужчина средних лет (34 лет), женат и отец 3-х детей. У Муродчона есть стадо мелко-рогатого скота, состояшее примерно из 35 овец и 15 коз. Его жена домохозяйка, но в свободное время занимается переработкой шерсти. Муродчон каждое утро гонит своё стадо в горы, пасет их, и вечером отгоняет их обратно. У Муродчона пока мало крупно-рогатого скота. Но Муродчон за этот новый займ хочет купить двух средних быков. Откормив их 3-4 месяца, он может продать за очень хорошую цену. Муродчон очень рад сотрудничеству с нами, потому, что кредит ему очень помогает.
texts.en:
Murodchon is 34 years old, married and has 3 children. He owns a herd of small livestock, consisting of about 35 sheep and 15 goats. His wife is a homemaker, but also processes wool during her free time. Every morning, Murodchon takes his herd to the mountains to graze and takes the herd back in the evenings. Murodchon only has a small quantity of large livestock and wants to use this new loan to purchase two average-size bulls. After feeding them for 3-4 months, he could sell them at a very good price. Murodchon is glad to be working with us because the financing helps him very much.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock purchase

loans.name: Ljubica

texts.en: Ljubica Đokanović was born in 1964 and she comes from Srebrenica. Ljubica is not married. She is a dressmaker, by profession. Ljubica repaid one loan from WWI with which she had invested in materials for sewing. Ljubica has been in this business for a long time and has repeat clients. Now she wants to improve her business by buying a new sewing machine. She requested for the loan from WWI in amount of 700 KM to by a new sewing machine.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Alia

texts.en:
Alia J. is currently in the business of selling dresses at the shop and is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine. Alia is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a pastor. She has 1 child and her child goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a bus to carry passengers from town to town. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Monarisa

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 24-year-old Monarisa K. from Mwanza. She is married with one three-year-old child. Monarisa has been running a tailoring business since 2006. Client’s business is to make women clothes and resell them to her customers. She works at the business for 8 hours per day, 6 days per week and is assisted by two employees. Monarisa currently earns about 130 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD in order to purchase another sewing machine. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Monarisa thanks you for her support!

ABOUT SELFINA
SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro leasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase another sewing machine.

loans.use: To increasing production.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Cette jeune femme est célibataire, elle travaille dure pour subvenir à ses propres charges pour cela elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales. Les céréales qu’elle vend sont le maïs et l’haricot, le maïs est très utilisé dans la cuisine togolaise surtout pour préparer la  pâte. Elle fait face à une rupture de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son deuxième crédit pour acheter 10sacs de maïs, 7 sacs d’haricot et divers céréales.
texts.en:
This young woman is single and she works hard to support herself. In order to do that, she sells cereals. The cereals she sells are maize and dried beans. Maize is much used in Togolese cuisine, especially to make porridge. She is presently dealing with a shortage of inventory, so she wishes to replenish her stock and is asking WAGES for her second loan to buy 10 sacks of maize, 7 sacks of dried beans, and various other cereals.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Rachabmoh

texts.ru: Тагоева Рачабмох проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст 58 лет. Разведена, имеет 9 детей. Рачабмох более 10 лет занимается животноводством. Она покупает мелкий и крупно рогатый скот, откармливает и продает. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы закупить скот.

Rachabmoh T. lives in the Varzob district. She is 58 years old, divorced and has 9 children. Rachabmoh has been involved in animal husbandry for over 10 years. She buys small and large livestock, feeds and sells it. Our client is requesting this loan in order to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Sanza Plus Group

texts.fr: Claude K. est photographe de carrière. Il est mieux connu et reconnu dans son quartier situé au nord de Kinshasa par ses belles photos. Il a commencé sa carrière en 1988 avec un appareil qu’il avait acheté à $10. De 1988 – 1997, les bénéfices réalisés dans la photographie l’ont aidé à prospérer et à supporter ses études secondaires qu’il a terminées avec succès. En 1997, le premier appareil devenu vieux, Claude a acheté un nouvel appareil de valeur de $80 grâce aux bénéfices accumulés et aux épargnes. De 1997 – 2006, son affaire a prospéré jusqu’à totaliser un chiffre d’affaire de plus de $500. La dépréciation monétaire ainsi que la hausse des prix sur le marché, causées par la guerre de l’est de la RDC la déstabilise pendant cette période. En 2008, Claude décide d’intégrer un des groupes de Hope RDC dénommé « Sanza Plus » qui signifie « Lune » en français, dans le but d’ouvrir un jour un laboratoire photographique pour les photographes de son quartier et des alentours. Il est client fidèle qui a obtenu plusieurs prêts de Hope RDC et les a tous remboursés totalement et à temps. Vu le nombre croissant de ses clients, le dernier crédit qu’il a reçu ce mois de juin, lui a permis d’acheter des films pour renforcer le stock et des piles à revendre afin d’accroitre le bénéfice. Son capital actuel est de $150 et son activité lui génère un bénéfice de $25 par semaine. Claude s’est marié en 2007,  Il est père de 2 enfants âgés de 4 mois à 2 ans.
texts.en:
Claude K. is a career photographer. He is best known and acknowledged in his district, located in northern Kinshasa, for his beautiful photos. He started his career in 1988 with a camera he had bought for $10. From 1988-1997, the profits realized from photography helped him to prosper and to support him in secondary school, which he completed successfully. In 1997, with his first camera now old, Claude bought a new one worth $80, thanks to accumulated profits and some savings. From 1997-2006, his business prospered until his sales figures reached a total of $500. Monetary depreciation, as well as the rise in market prices, caused by the war in the east of the Republic of the Congo, destabilized his business during this period of time. In 2008, Claude decided to join a HOPE RDC group named “Sanza Plus” which means “Moon”, with the goal of opening a photographic lab one day for the photographers in his area. He is a loyal client who has had several loans with HOPE RDC and who has repaid all of them completely and on time. Given his growing number of customers, the last loan he received this June enabled him to buy some film for bolstering his inventory and some batteries to sell in order to grow his profits. He currently has $150 in capital, and his business generates for him a profit of $25 a week. Claude was married in 2007. He is the father of two children, ages 4 months and 2 years old.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy film for taking a lot of photos in order to increase his profits

Komila and her husband buy the raw materials on the Panchabe market. She is asking for a new loan to buy flour. Komila is thankful to the loan organization for the financial support.

texts.ru: Назар Бакиров проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 44 года. Женат, имеет 8 детей. Назар более 30 лет занимается земледелием. Он выращивает рис, пшеницу и бахчевые растения. Назару приходится трудно, т.к. у него большая семья и он имеет сына с ограниченными возможностями. Поэтому клиент просит кредит, чтобы закупить минеральные удобрения и горючее для посева, а полученный урожай продать.

At times, it is difficult for Nazar because he has a big family and a disabled son. This is why our client is requesting this loan in order to buy mineral fertilizer and fuel for sowing. He will them sell the resulting harvest.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

She also plans to start some personal savings.

texts.fr: Mr. Atsou D. est né en 1986 à Nyigbé dans le Zio. Il est marié et père de cinq (5) enfants. Son activité principale est l’agriculture, grâce à laquelle il arrive à contribuer aux besoins du foyer et de sa famille. Il sollicite un crédit pour s’acheter des fertilisants et autres intrants afin d’augmenter sa production. Ceci lui permettra d’améliorer ses revenus pour un meilleur devenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Atsou D. was born in 1986 in Nyigbe, a village in the Zio region of Togo. He is married and the father of five children. This will allow him to increase his income and thereby offer a better life to his family.

Right now the client is asking for a loan to increase commodity circulation and will use the received income to satisfie the needs of the family.

texts.ru: Ашурмад Холов проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 2 детей. По специальности Ашурмад является "артистом". В данный момент ашурмад играет на свадебных мероприятиях. Она у себя во дворе имеет торговую точку, где торгует продуктами питания. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот.
texts.en:
Zibira M. lives in Kurgan-Tube city. She is 42 years old, married and has six children. Her husband works in Russia to support his family back home. Zibira has over six years of experience trading. In her courtyard, she has a small shop where she sells food. She is requesting a loan in order to increase her trade turnover.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase trade turnover

loans.name: Ihbol

texts.ru: Бегматова Ихбол проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 51 год. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Муж вместе с сыном находятся на заработках в России. Ихбол более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Она покупает, откармливает и продает крупно рогатыый скот. Клиентка просит кредит, чтобы купить скота.
texts.en:
Ihbol B. lives in Kurgan-Tube region. She is 51 years old, married, and has five children. Her husband and son work in Russia to support the family back home. Ihbol has over five years of experience in animal husbandry. She buys, sells, and raises large cattle. She is requesting a loan to buy more livestock.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of large cattle

loans.name: Saidumar

texts.ru: Саидумар Чабборов проживает в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 21 год. Холост, детей не имеет. Саидумар более 2 лет занимается бизнесом. Он имеет продуктовый магазин. Клиент просит кредит, чтобы увеличить свой товараоборот. На полученный доход собирается жениться.
texts.en:
Saidumar Chabborov lives in Kurgan-Tube region. He is 21 years old, single, and has no children. He has been in business for over two years, running a small grocery store. He is requesting a loan in order to increase his trade turnover. Once his business generates a profit, he plans to marry.

Translated from Russian by Josh Machleder, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase trade turnover

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.es:
La señora Cayetana, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Dios”, ubicado en el distrito D. Lampa, Provincia D. San Román, Departamento D. Puno. Tiene 49 años D. edad, es casada, es madre D. 5 hijos y 4 D. ellos a su cargo, tiene estudios D. primaria completa. Vive en el Barrio Nueva Esperanza en el Jr. Municipalidad s/n en Lampa.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, inicio su trabajo con un prestamos D. S/. 300.00, con el cual compró carne, víveres en general para distribuirlo a las ferias.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 700.00, el cual le permitirá incrementar su negocio comprando productos D. la zona como: papa, quinua y frutas como: plátanos, naranjas y otros. 

Su mayor sueño es darle una profesión a cada uno D. sus hijos.

A ella le gustan las reuniones que hace su Banco Comunal ya que le enseñan a ahorrar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Cayetana belongs to the San Juan of God Community Bank located in the Lampa District, in San Roman Province, Department of Puno. She is 49 years old, married, and mother of five children, four of whom have completed their primary school studies. She lives in Barrio Nueva Esperanza (Community of New Hope). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for two years. She began her work with a loan of S/. 300, with which she bought meat and general provisions to sell at the local markets. She now requests a loan of S/. 700 which will permit her to increase her business, buying products from the area such as potatoes, quinoa, and fruits such as bananas, oranges, and others. Her greatest dream is to proviD. an occupation for each of her children. She likes the meetings that her Community Bank holds since they teach her to save.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy potatoes, quinua, bananas, oranges, and other fruits.

loans.name: Ayni Group

texts.en:
The group AYNI is made of up 12 women who are collectively asking for a loan to invest in their businesses in the Cusco area. They work in general stores, communication, jewelry making, and clothing sales. The majority of the group members plan to purchase supplies and merchandise.

One member has been making jewelry and selling it in the Velasco Astete neighborhood for 20 years. She will purchase turquoise stones that cost between 3 and 10 soles and turn them into earrings and necklaces that can be sold at a high price to make a profit. Another client is investing in her cell phone business.  She stands on busy street corners in the city and charges people to use her cell phones to make both local and long distance calls. She currently has four phones and will use the loan to increase the prepaid credit on them. 

Group leader Georgina is 49 years old and has two children.  She sells underwear at a market, also in the Velasco Astete neighborhood, and will buy more merchandise to increase her business.  As group leader, she personally knows each of the member’s businesses. The entire group is grateful for the loan. They hope to get ahead in their businesses and are committed to repaying according to their scheduled agreement.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary B. is thirty years old and married with two children, a boy and a girl. Both are currently in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is an herbalist. Mary trades in vegetables, selling onions, peppers, tomatoes, etc. on a table top at the market square. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She travels to other markets to sell as well. Mary has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy vegetables in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha A. is fifty-two years old and divorced with four children, two daughters and two sons. Some are currently in the junior high while others are in the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Agatha is a food vendor and has been in business for eight years. She cooks and sells ‘banku’, a local dish made from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She sells by the roadside in the mornings. Agatha wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace B. is forty years old and a married mother of five children, two daughters and three sons. She lives with them and her husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. Grace is a hard-working woman. She runs a grocery store with her husband, selling provisions such as coffee, Milo, flour, sugar, rice, candy and bread in a store on the street. Grace has been in business for eighteen years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. is thirty-five years old and the married mother of five children – two daughters and three sons. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town in the Western region called Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso. She is a hardworking woman. She works to support her husband, who works with a timber firm.

Yaa runs a provision store. She sells groceries such as Milo (a milk beverage), sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc., in a store by the street. She has been in business for sixteen years now and wants a loan to buy more provisions to expand her business. She is hopeful to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions to expand her business

loans.name: Sattor

texts.ru: Алимходжаев  Саттор  1965 год рождения ,  женат,  имеет 3 детей.  Вместе  с  женой  Азимовой  Насибой  открыл  возле  дома  маленький  продуктовый  магазинчик.  Два  раза  в  неделю  он  ездит  за  товаром  в  г. Худжанд.  Сначала  у  него  был  небольшой  капитал.  Недавно  он  узнал  про  «Микроинвест»  и  решил  у  нас  кредитоваться.  Таким  образом  он  расширил  свой  товарооборот  и  увеличил  ассортимент  продуктов.
texts.en:
Sattor A. was born in 1956, married and has three children. Together with his wife Nosiboy Azimova he has opened a small grocery store near his house. Two times a week he travels for merchandise to the town of Khujand. At first he had small capital. Just recently has has found out about MicroInvest and decided to take out a loan. This way he has increased his inventory assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes D. is thirty-two years old and married with four children, a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Her husband is a carpenter by profession.

Agnes is a professional hair-dresser. She has three apprentices who are currently under training. Her shop is located at the market square. Agnes buys her working materials such as artificial hair, shampoos and lotions from Kumasi. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy supplies in bulk so as to render quality services to her loyal clients. Agnes wants to expand her business and sponsor her children through school and on to higher education.

loans.use: To buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señora Delia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios”, del distrito de Lampa Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 36 años, es conviviente y madre de 4 hijos; tiene estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el Barrio Nueva Esperanza.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años, inició su trabajo con un préstamo de S/. 300.00, con el cual compró productos lácteos como queso y leche, etc.

Actualmente solicita un préstano de S/. 1000.00, para comprar leche, yogurt y quesos, luego los lleva a la mina La Rinconada y los vende, ya que solo trabaja por pedido y en algunas ocasiones también prepara comida para vender. 

A ella le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal ya que le enseñan a ahorrar. Su mayor sueño es poner su negocio en la misma mina, educar a sus hijos y comprarse una casita.
texts.en:
Delia belongs to the San Juan de Dios Community Bank in the Lampa district, San Román province, Puno department. She is 36, in a common law marriage, and has four children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Nueva Esperanza neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost two years. She started her work with a loan for 300 PEN, which she used to buy dairy products like cheese and milk, etc. She is currently asking for a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy milk, yogurt, and cheese. She will then take them to La Rinconada mine and sell them. She only works on orders, and sometimes she also prepares meals to sell. She likes the Community Bank meetings since they teach her how to save. Her biggest dreams are to set up her business in the same mine, educate her children, and buy a little house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy yogurt, cheese, milk and other things

loans.name: Agatha

texts.en:
Agatha K. is twenty-eight years old, married, and has given birth to two children, both daughters. Both are currently in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Agatha is a food vendor. She fries and sells plantain chips. She hawks (sells door-to-door) to sell and also sells on a table by the roadside. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for barely one year and wants a loan to buy plantain in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy plantain in bulk

loans.name: Sobyrjon

texts.ru: Касымов  Собыржон,  мужчина  40  лет,  женат,  имеет  троих  детей.  Вот  уже  более  6  лет  он  торгует  продуктами  питания  на  колхозном  рынке  Джаббор- Расуловского  района.  Он  обратился  в  нашу  организацию  за  финансовой  помощью  для  расширения  ассортимента  продуктов  питания.  На  полученный  займ  он  собирается  закупить  сахар-песок  по  оптовой  цене,  так  как  скоро  начнётся  сезон  закруток  (компот  и  варенье).  Он  очень  рад  сотрудничеству  с  нами,  так  как  это  выгодно  для  его  бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sobyrjon K. is 40 years old, married and has three children. He has been selling food products at an agricultural market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district for over 6 years. He reached out to our organization for financial assistance in order to expand his assortment of food products. Sobyrjon plans to use this loan to purchase sugar at wholesale cost because the fruit canning (compote and preserve) season starts soon. He is glad to be working with us as this partnership is beneficial to his business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paullina A. sells tubers of yams to her customers. She is 50 years old and is married with eight children. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more tubers of yams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia A. is forty-two years old, widowed, and has given birth to four children: a daughter and three sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region.

Olivia is a trader.  She buys kerosene from the distributers in tank cars and sells to her customers in gallons. Olivia has been in business for eleven years and wants a loan to buy kerosene in bulk to be able to retail to more customers. Olivia aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school to higher heights.

loans.use: To buy kerosene in bulk

loans.name: Azimjon

texts.ru: Бердиев  Азимжон,  молодой  человек  1971  года  рождения.  Жена  Хасанова  Дилором  помогает  ему  поднимать  на  ноги  троих  детей.  Вот  уже  более  года  занимаются  торговлей  продуктами  питания  и  хозяйственными  товарами.  Это  помогает  им  прокормить  семью  в  условиях  финансового  кризиса.  Для  расширения  ассортимента  продаваемого  товара  они  обратились  в  нашу  организацию  за  финансовой  помощью.  В  этом  году  они  собираются  накопить  денег  и  открыть  дополнительную  торговую  точку.
texts.en:
Azimjon B. is a young man, born in 1971. His wife, Dilorom Hasanova, helps him raise their three children. For over a year, Azimjon and Dilorom have been involved in the sales of food products and household goods. This business helps them support their family during this financial crisis. They reached out to our organization for financial assistance in order to expand their product assortment. Azimjon and Dilorom plan to save enough money this year to open an additional retail outlet.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a stock of cleaning agents

loans.name: Symplicia

texts.fr: K. Symplicia est née le 02/03/1970 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin dans le Département de l'Atlantique au sud du Bénin. Simplicia est mariée à HODONOU jean Gabin, un commerçant. Symplicia est mère de quatre enfants tous scolarisés. Depuis cinq ans Simplicia a comme activité la vente de Charbon de bois en sac et en détail. Symplicia a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit de ALIDé pour son activité et elle a bien remboursé ce crédit. Symplicia est satisfaite du premier crédit de ALIDé, elle espère toujours bénéficier des prestations de ALIDé pour consolider son activité. En effet, Symplicia sollicite son second crédit de ALIDé pour s'approvisionner davantage en sacs de charbon de bois surtout en cette période de saison de pluie où le charbon de bois est difficile à trouver et coûte plus cher.
texts.en:
Symplicia K. was born March 2nd, 1970 in Cotonou, Economic Capital of the Republic of Benin, in the Atlantic Region of Southern Benin. Symplicia is married to a merchant named Jean Gabin Hodonou. Symplicia is the mother of four children, whom are all enrolled in school. For the past five years, Symplicia's work has primarily been the sale of wood charcoal by the bag and by the piece. Her work has already benefited from a first a loan from Alidé , and Symplicia has paid back that initial loan in full. Symplicia is happy with her first loan from Alidé and hopes to keep benefiting from their services in order to continue expanding her business. Therefore, Symplicia is asking for a second loan from Alidé in order to increase her stock of wood charcoal, which has become difficult to find and more costly during this rainy season.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a supply of Charcoal

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary T. sells children’s wear – clothes and footwear. She hawks her goods and also treks to other markets to sell. She buys her goods from Kumasi. Mary has been in business for over 25 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. 
Mary is 65 years old, married and has three children: two sons and a daughter. All are currently out of school and working. Her husband is a mason by profession. She lives with her husband and children in a house in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. She aspires to expand her business and improve upon her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy children’s wear

loans.name: Botir

texts.ru: Курбонов  Ботир – мужчина  1977  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет   2  детей.  После  того,  как  он  остался  без  работы  и  вернулся  из  Российской  Федерации,  он  решил  заняться  мелким  бизнесом.  Взяв  в  аренду  маленький  магазинчик  на  территории  колхозного  рынка  Джаббор-Расуловского  района,  он  занялся  торговлей  мелкими товарами. Вот уже более 7 лет они вместе с женой расширяют  свой  товарооборот.  Накопив  немного  денег  они  собираются  собственный  магазин  в  центре  района.  Кроме  нашей  организации,  в  осуществлении  бизнес-планов  им  помогают  их родители.
texts.en:
Born in 1971, Botir K. is married and has 2 children. After he lost his job and returned from the Russian Federation, Botir decided to start a small business. He leased a small store at an agricultural market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district and started selling merchandise. Together with his wife, Botir has been increasing his goods turnover for over 7 years. They plan to save enough money to open their own store in the district center. Besides our organization, their parents help Botir and his wife with their business-plan realization.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of light bulbs

loans.name: Blandine

texts.fr: D. Blandine est née le 11 Juin 1968 dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Blandine est mariée à AKPLOGAN Emmanuel, un commerçant. Blandine est mère de cinq enfants dont quatre scolarisés. Blandine vend des  produits lubrifiants  et  des chaussures au bord de la voie sur la route de Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique de la République du BENIN. Blandine a déjà bénéficié de trois crédits de ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu amener ses activités à un stade supérieur. Ayant reçu une commande  de  produits lubrifiants et de chaussures que ses moyens financiers ne permettent pas de satisfaire,  Blandine  sollicite un quatrième prêt de ALIDé pour y arriver.
texts.en:
Blandine D. was born on the 11th June 1968 in the Ouémé Department in South Benin. Blandine is married to Emmanuel Akplogan who is a merchant. Blandine is mother to five children, four of whom are of school age. Blandine sells lubricating oil and shoes on the side of the road to Porto-Novo, the administrative and political capital of the Republic of Benin. Blandine has already received three loans from Alidé, loans which she has repaid and as a result of which she has been able to take her business up a level. Having received an order for lubricating oil and shoes that she is unable to afford, Blandine is requesting a fourth loan from Alidé so that she can.

Translated from French by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a barrel of lubricating oil and a bundle of shoes

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity N. is the mother of six children: three sons and three daughters who are all currently in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She is fifty-five years old, married, and lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Charity is a baker. She bakes bread in her community and supplies it to retailers and beverage sellers in her community and also hawks it (sells door-to-door). She buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Мирфузайлов  Жахонгир – молодой  мужчина  1981  года  рождения,  женат,  детей  пок  не  имеет.  Недавно  его  родители  решили  отделить  его  домохозяйство  и  предложили  ему  заняться  мелким  бизнесом.  С  этой  целью  он  арендовал  магазинчик,  где  торгует  запасными  частями  для  автомашин.  Свой  товар  он  привозит  из  города  Истаравшана,  где  расположен  оптовый  рынок.  Для  расширения  своего  товарооборота  он  решил  обратиться  в  нашу  организацию.  На  полученный  займ  он  закупил  товар  по  оптовой  цене  и  раздал  его  мелким  торговцам.
texts.en:
Born in 1981, Jahongir M. is married and does not yet have children. Recently, his parents decided to separate his household and suggested that he should start a small business. With this goal in mind, Jahongir leased a small store, where he sells spare parts for automobiles. He brings his merchandise from the city of Istaravshan, the location of the wholesale market. He reached out to our organization in order to increase his goods turnover. Jahongir plans to use the loan to buy auto parts at wholesale cost and resell them retail.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of auto parts

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella S. is the mother of four children: two sons and two daughters who are all still in school – senior high, junior high and the primary schools. She is forty years old, married, and lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband is a fitting mechanic.

Stella is a trader, trading in crates of eggs. She buys crates of eggs from nearby poultry farms and supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She also sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy eggs in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy eggs in bulk

loans.name: Carmela

texts.es:
La señora Carmela, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, D. la ciudad D. Juliaca, Provincia D. San Román, Departamento D. Puno. Tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos, posee estudios D. secundaria completa. Vive en la Urb. Habitad en la segunda etapa del Barrio La Capilla.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 2 periodos, con un préstamo inicial D. S/.  500.00, con el que compró miel, y además tenía otro negocio D. venta D. polladas cada 15 días.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 300.00, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, comprara miel y tambien pollos e insumos para la preparación D. las polladas, esta viendo si cambia su negocio a la venta D. abarrotes, pero aún no se deciD. ya que en su zona hay mucha competencia y esta en busca D. un lugar céntrico.

Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda D. abarrotes. A ella le gusta las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal y la puntualidad.
texts.en:
Carmela belongs to the Cristo Blanco Community Bank in the city of Juliaca, San Román province, Puno department. She is 55, married, and has five children. She has a high school education. She lives in the Urb. Habitad in the second stage of La Capilla neighborhood. She has worked the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two loan cycles. With her initial loan for 500 PEN, she bought honey. She also had another business selling grilled chicken every 15 days. She is currently asking for a loan for 300 PEN to invest in her current business. She will buy honey, chicken, and ingredients for her grilled chicken. She is thinking about changing her business to sell groceries, but she still has not decided. There is a lot of competition in her zone, and she is looking for a central location. Her biggest dream is to have a grocery store. She likes her Community Bank meetings and their punctuality.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy honey, chicken, and ingredients for the preparation of her grilled chicken

loans.name: Akmaljon

texts.ru: Валиджанов Акмалжон –молодой человек 1981 года рождения,  женат,  имеет  двоих  детей.  Недавно  он  обратился  в  нашу  организацию  за  финансовой  помощью  в  виде  потребительского  кредита.  Он  накопил  немного  денег  и  собирался  купить  автомашину  «Нексия».  Он  работает  в  дехканском  хозяйстве  и  имеет  доход,  позволяющий  погасить  кредит.  Всем  своим  друзьям  он  рекомендует  нашу  организацию,  потому  что  мы  помогли  ему  в  осуществлении  его  планов.
texts.en:
Born in 1981, Akmaljon V. is married and has two children. He recently reached out to our organization for a personal loan. He saved some money and planned to buy a Nexia car. Akmaljon works at a dekhan farm and has enough income to repay the loan. He recommends our organization to all of his friends because we helped him to achieve his goals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a car

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.fr: G. Rosalie est âgée de 42 ans. Rosalie est originaire de la Vallée dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Rosalie est Mariée à LOKO Antoine, un fonctionnaire d’Etat. Rosalie est mère de cinq enfants: quatre de ces enfants sont scolarisés, le cinquième est majeur et n'est plus à la charge des parents. Rosalie a comme activité la vente de Charbon de bois en sac et en détail ainsi que l'élevage de poules. Pour mieux développer son activité Rosalie sollicite un prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
G. Rosalie, 42, comes from the Vallée, Department of Ouémé, in the south of Bénin. Rosalie is married to Loko Antoine, a civil servant. She is the mother of 5 children; four of them are enrolled in school. The fifth is an adult and his parents are no longer responsible for him.

Rosalie sells charcoal, both by the sack and retail, as well as raising chickens. In order to better develop her businesses, Rosalie is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a truckload of charcoal

loans.name: Pulatoy

texts.ru: Асророва  Пулатой – молодая  женщина  1986  года,  замужем,  детей пока  не  имеет.  Она  вместе  с  мужем  Кобиловым  Баходуром  около  четырёх  лет занимается  откормом  скота.  Её  муж  покупает  скот  по  низкой  цене  у  пастухов  и  откормив  несколько  недель  продаёт  их  на  скотном  рынке  Джаббор-Расуловского  рынка.  Когда  Пулотой  узнала  про  нашу  организацию  она  решила  кредитоваться  у  нас.  На  полученный  займ  она  собирается  купить  дойную  корову  и  продавать  молоко,  тем  самым  пополняя  семейный  бюджет.  Баходур  доволен  выбором  жены  и  поддержал  её.
texts.en:
Born in 1986, Pulatoy A. is a young married woman, who does not yet have children. Pulatoy and her husband, Bahodur Kobilov, have been involved in livestock feeding for about 4 years. The husband buys the livestock at a low price from shepherds and, having fed it for several weeks, sells the livestock at the livestock market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district. Once Pulatoy learned about our organization, she decided to obtain a loan from us. She plans to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow and be able to sell milk, and, thus, increase their family budget. Bahodur is happy with his wife’s choice and fully supports her.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Thierno

texts.fr: Thierno  D.  gère une unité de transformation de céréale  dans son village de Sandiara situé à 80 km de la capitale sénégalaise Dakar. Son unité de transformation compte trois moulins à mil. Les revenus tirés de cette activité lui permettent de nourrir sa famille et d’aider ses parents. Avec le prêt qu’il sollicite il veut acheter une machine de transformation de patte d’arachide pour accroitre ses revenus.
texts.en:
Thierno D. processes cereals in his village of Sandiara, situated 80 km from the Senegalese capital, Dakar. He has three mills that process millet. The income from this activity permits him to support his family and help his parents. With the requested loan, he wants to buy a machine to process peanuts to make peanut butter to increase his income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a machine to make peanut butter

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude A. is thirty-two years old and divorced. She is the mother of one child, a girl, who is currently in the primary school. She lives with her daughter in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Gertrude is a trader, trading in crates of eggs. Gertrude buys crates of eggs from nearby poultry farms. She supplies to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She also sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years and wants a loan to buy crates of eggs in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her daughter the best education.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs in bulk

loans.name: Gladys

texts.fr: N. Gladys est née vers 1956 à Sazoué dans la Commune de Grand-Popo dans le Département du MONO au Sud du Bénin. Gladys est mariée à ASSIAME Florentin un fonctionnaire d’Etat actuellement à la retraite. Gladys est mère de trois enfants tous majeurs et mariés. Gladys est coiffeuse de profession. Gladys a son salon de coiffure à Finagnon un quartier de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. En plus de la coiffure, Gladys vend dans son salon de coiffure des produits et articles pour la coiffure. Gladys s’approvisionne en ses différents produits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Pour faire face à la demande de plus en plus croissante de sa clientèle, Gladys sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
N. Gladys was born around 1956 in Sazoué in the Grand-Popo township in the Department of Mono in the south of Bénin. Gladys is married to Assiame Florentin, a civil servant who is presently retired. Gladys is the mother of 3 childrren, all adults and married.

Gladys is a trained hairdreser. She has a hairdressing salon in Finagnon, a district of the town of Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin. Besides hairdressing, Gladys sells products having to do with hairdressing in her salon. She buys the various products in Dantokpa, the big international market of Bénin. In order to meet the ever-increasing demand of her clientele, Gladys is requesting a loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of hair extensions, shampoo, hair relaxer, pomades, etc. .

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A. runs a cold store by the roadside in her community. She sells fresh fish, beef, chicken, turkey, etc. She supplies local retailers and food vendors. Diana buys cartons of fresh fish and meat from big cold stores in Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Diana is the mother of two children, both boys, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She is 30 years old and married. Diana’s husband is a professional teacher. They live in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She wants to expand her business and give her sons the best of education.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Muzaffar

texts.ru: Бегматов  Музаффар – мужчина  1974  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет   2  детей.  Занимается  откормом  и  продажей  скота.  Каждое  утро  он  отправляет  скот  на  пастбище  вместе  с  пастухом,  которому  платит  по  договорной  цене.  Его  жена  вместе  с  его  сёстрами  работает  в  колхозе.  Кроме  того  Бегматов  Музаффар  покупает  у  пастухов  молодых  бычков  по  низкой  цене  и,  откормив,  через некоторое  время  перепродаёт  их  мясникам  по  хорошей  цене.  На  новый  кредит  он  рассчитывает  купить  партию  мелкорогатого  скота  и  отправить  их  на  пастбище  до  осени.
texts.en:
Born in 1974, Muzaffar B. is married and has 2 children. He is involved in livestock feeding and sales. Every morning, he sends his livestock to a pasture, accompanied by a shepherd, whom he pays an agreed upon price. Muzaffar’s wife, along with his sisters, works at a collective farm. Besides this, Muzaffar buys young bulls from shepherds at a low cost and, having fed them for some time, resells the animals to butchers at a good price. Muzaffar plans to use this new loan to buy small livestock and send it to a pasture until the autumn.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of small livestock

loans.name: Awaou

texts.fr: B. Awaou est née vers 1969 à DASSA dans le Département des Collines au Centre du Bénin. Awaou est mariée à HADA Mamoudou, un éleveur. Awaou est mère de six enfants dont la nommée Adidja est mariée et n'est plus à sa charge. Awaou est à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin depuis près de 10 ans. Awaou vend tous les matins de façon ambulante la bouillie de maïs. Awaou vend aussi les divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.) ainsi que le maïs qu’elle livre à crédit aux bonnes femmes qui sont dans la restauration populaire. Pour renforcer son activité et mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle, Awaou s’est adressée à ALIDé pour avoir de prêt.
texts.en:
B. Awaou was born around 1969 in DASSA, in the Collines Department in the center of Bénin. Awaou is married to Hada Mamoudou, who raises livestock. Awaou is the mother of 6 children, one of whom, Adidja, is married and no longer lives with her parents. Awaou has been in Cotonou, economic capital of the Republic of Bénin for almost 10 years.

Every morning, Awaou walks around selling maize porridge. She also sells various items (candy, cookies; tins of milk, sardines, and tomatoes; sugar, pasta, detergent and dish-washing and toilet soap, batteries, candles, etc.) as well as maize that she delivers on credit to women who do street-side catering. In order to bolster her business and better respond to the needs of her clientele, Awaou has come to ALIDé to request a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of 2 cases of toilet soap and detergent and 10 sacks of 100 kg of maize

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort T. is forty years old, divorced, and has given birth to four children: two daughters and two sons. Some are currently in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital.

Comfort is a food vendor. She cooks and sells kenkey, which is prepared from milled maize grains. It is served hot with ground pepper and fried fish. She sells by the road side in the mornings. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk

loans.name: La Unión Group

texts.en:
The communal group “L. Unión”  has 11 members, most of whom are mothers and live in the Cusco area. Most of the group members are investing their loans to buy more merchandise for their small businesses such as kiosks and general stores. One general store owner will buy rice, olive oil and pasta to increase her merchandise. Another will buy more medicine to sell at his drugstore.

Maritza, the group leader, makes crochet and macramé bags by hand and sells them at a local market for between 35 and 45 soles (approximately $10 - $15 USD).  The crochet bags take one day to make, while the macramé bags maD. by hand take two days.  Martiza will buy supplies to make more bags with her loan.

As the group leader, Martiza says that it is her responsibility to proviD. support for the mothers to help them make their payments, achieve their personal goals, and get ahead in life. She is 46 years old, and married with two children. The women appreciate the loan and are dedicated to repaying it as scheduled.

loans.use: Purchase supplies and merchandise

loans.name: Anvarchon

texts.ru: Мамадчонов  Анварчон – мужчина  1970  года  рождения,  женат,  имеет  3  детей.  Занимается  откормом  и  куплей-продажей  скота.  Недавно  его  жена  Мамадчонова  Дилфуза  посоветовала  ему  обратиться  в  нашу  организацию  за  кредитом.  На  полученный  кредит  они  решили  купить  дойную  корову  с  телёнком.  Анварчон  очень  любит  свою  работу,  так  как  занимается  этим  с  юных  лет.  В  будущем  он  хочет  продолжить  сотрудничество  с  «Микроинвест»  и  на  полученный  займ  он  планирует  расширить  коровник.
texts.en:
Born in 1970, Anvarchon M. is married and has 3 children. He is involved in livestock feeding and sales. Recently, his wife, Dilfuza Mamadchonova, advised him to request a loan from our organization. They decided to use this loan to purchase a dairy cow with a calf. Anvarchon loves his work very much as he has been doing this work since young age. He wants to continue working with MicroInvest in the future and plans to expand his cowshed with the help of this loan.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow and a calf

loans.name: Boimurod

texts.ru: Бойматов  Боймурод - мужчина 1958  года  рождения, женат,  имеет 2-х  детей. Чтобы  прокормить  свою  семью  он  решил  заняться  откормом  скота.  Он  имеет  большой  опыт  в  сфере  животноводства,  так  как    с  юных  лет  помогал  отцу  пасти  скот.  Боймуроду  помогают  его  сыновья.  Он  закупает  бычков  на  Джаббор-Расуловском  скотном  рынке  и,  откормив  в  течении  5-6  месяцев,  перепродаёт  их  за  хорошую  цену.  Кроме  того  он  работает  оператором  в  дочернем  предприятии  «Пилла-Райшёлк».
texts.en:
Born in 1958, Boimurod B. is married and has 2 children. He decided to start a business of livestock feeding in order to provide for his family. Boimurod has a lot of experience in the animal husbandry field because he used to help his father graze livestock since a young age. Boimurod’s sons help him with the business. He buys bulls at the Jabbor-Rasulov livestock market and, having fed them for 5-6 months, resells them at a good price. Besides his business, Boimurod works as an operator at a subsidiary of the Pilla-Raishyolk company.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose M. is twenty-eight years old. She is married and two children, a boy and a girl. Both are currently in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town called in the western region of Ghana. Her husband is a teacher.

Rose trades in vegetables and spices. She sells onions, pepper, tomatoes, and other spices on a table top at the market square. She buys her goods in Kumasi and treks to other markets to sell. Rose has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy vegetables

loans.name: Maguette

texts.fr: Maguette S.  est âgée de trente six ans, elle vend du petit déjeuner  depuis plus de trois ans à cote de sa maison sise au village da Sandiara situé à 20km de la ville de Mbour. Chaque matin elle prépare des sandwiches du thon des haricots et du café qu’elle vend aux habitants du quartier. Pour renforcer ses activité acheté plus de provisions (haricot et autre) elle sollicite un prêt.
texts.en:
Maguette S. is 36; she has been selling breakfast for 3 years beside her house in the village of Sandiara, situated 20 km from the town of Mbour. Each morning she makes tuna sandwiches, beans, and coffee and sells the food to her neighbors. To bolster her little business and buy more ingredients (dried beans etc.), she is requesting a loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of ingredients for catering

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena D. is a mother of four children, a son and three daughters. All are currently in the junior high and the primary schools. She is forty-five years old and divorced. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the western region of Ghana.

Abena is a trader. She buys bags of charcoal from surrounding communities and sells the charcoal on a table top in front of her house. She also supplies to other retailers and food vendors in her community. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy charcoal in bulk. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes M. is thirty-five years old. She is a married mother of three children – all sons. One is in the senior high while the others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawsoa in the western region of Ghana.

Agnes is a hard working woman. She works to support her husband. Her husband works for a local timber firm. Agnes runs a grocery store. She sells groceries such as Milo (a brand of malted milk sold by Nestle in West Africa), sugar, rice, candies, bread, etc. in a store near the street. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best of education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. is a mother of two children, a boy and a girl, who are currently in the primary school. She is thirty-four years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. Mercy’s husband works with a local timber firm.

Mercy is a trader. Mercy buys crates of eggs from nearby poultry farms and then resells the eggs. She supplies the eggs to retailers and beverage sellers in her community. She also sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy crates of eggs in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther Ainoo is forty years old. She is married and currently has no children. She lives with her husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Esther sells all kinds of utensils. She buys her goods from Kumasi at affordable prices and sells them in a store at the market square in her community. She also treks to other markets to sell. Esther has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy utensils

loans.name: Altine

texts.fr: Altine S. est une femme berger son activité principale est l’élevage des bovins. Elle fait ce métier depuis longtemps. Elle a passé toute sa vie à errer  en brousse avec ses boeufs et moutons. A chaque approche de l hivernage, elle achète des moutons qu’elle embouche pour les revendre à la tabaski c’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter des moutons. Les  revenus tirés de son activité d’embouche lui permettra d’acheter des vivres pour sa famille et de réparer sa case.
texts.en:
Altine S. is a livestock raiser; her principal business is raising cattle. She has been in this sector for a long time. She has spent all her life wandering around the countryside with her cows and sheep. Each time the rainy season approaches, she buys sheep that she fattens for resale at Tabaski (a Muslim religious holiday, the Festival of Sacrifice). That is why she is requesting a loan to buy sheep. The income from her business will allow her to buy food for her family and repair her house.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sheep to fatten and re-sell

loans.name: Lastenia

texts.es:
La señora Lastenia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana” en la Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es conviviente, tiene 53 años y 04 hijos ya independientes.

Lastenia, lleva años dedicándose a la confección de vestidos, poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero, queriendo así implementar su taller de confección de vestidos, ya que tenia la habilidad para la costura no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo de Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio negocio ubicado en su misma casa.
Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan y a quienes los atiende con la amabilidad y el carisma que la caracteriza. 

Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr es implementar su propio taller de confección, con nuevas maquinas, cambiando las antiguas por unas nuevas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 3,000.00, invertirá comprando telas de diferentes estilos y colores, también instrumentos que utiliza como: tijeras, hilos en carretes grandes y de variados colores, agujas de coser y de máquina, alfileres y botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Lastenia belongs to the La Mujer Riojana Community Bank in San Martin. She is 53, in a common law marriage, and has four children who are independent. For years, Lastenia has been making clothes. Little by little she was generating her own income and saving her money. She wanted to set up her own workshop for making clothes. Since she has sewing ability, she did not doubt that she could do it. With support from Manuela Ramos, she decided to set up her own business, which is located in her own house. Sewing is going very well for her. She works on orders that her customers ask for with anticipation. She waits on her customers with her characteristic kindness and charm. One of her dreams is to set up her own sewing shop with new machines, changing the old one for new ones. With this loan for 3,000 PEN she will buy different styles and colors of fabric and items she uses like scissors, large spools of various colors of thread, needles for sewing by hand and machine, pins and buttons. Today she feels much fulfilled with more desire to make the rest of her dreams come true. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for helping her start her business and for helping many women who want to grow as business women.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fabric, thread, buttons, scissors, needles to sew by hand and machine

loans.name: Asibi

texts.en:
Asibi S. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. Some are in the senior high and others are in the junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Her husband is a farmer.

Asibi sells second hand clothes, ladies’ wear and bed sheets. She buys her goods in Kumasi and sells them at the market square in her community. She also treks to other markets to sell. Asibi has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She wants to expand her business and give her children the best of education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana N. is thirty-one years old. She is married and has three children, a son and two daughters. Two are in the junior high school; the youngest is too young to attend school. Juliana lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Her husband works with at a local saw mill firm.

Juliana sells second hand clothes, children’s clothes, and bed sheets. She buys her goods in Kumasi and sells them at the market square in her community. She also treks to other markets to sell. Juliana has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to buy bales of textiles in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bales of textiles

loans.name: France

texts.es:
La señora France, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, ubicada en la ciudad de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 33 años, es madre soltera con 01 hijo, tiene estudios de educación superior completa (educación y auxiliar de contabilidad). 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 2 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, compró caramelos, galletas, chocolates, yogurts y otros.

Actualmente solocita un préstamo de S/. 500.00, para poder invertir en su negocio de venta de golosinas, utilizara el dinero para comprar golosinas como: chocolates, galletas, caramelos, yogurts y gaseosas.

A ella le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, la unión de sus compañeras y el buen trato de la Promotora. Su mayor sueño es poder comprarse una casa en la Rinconada.
texts.en:
Ms. France is a member of communal bank “Cristo Blanco” (White Christ) which is located in the city of Juliaca, in the San Roman province, district of Puno. She is 33 years old, is a single mother with one son, and finished college (in education and as an accounting assistant).

She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past two years with an initial loan of 300 Soles (Peruvian currency), with which she bought candy, cookies, chocolates, yogurt, and other items.

She is currently requesting a loan of 500 Soles to invest in her sweets business. She will use the money to purchase chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, and soda.

She likes the meetings of her communal bank, the unity between members, and the loan officer’s good treatment. Her greatest dream is to be able to buy herself a house in La Rinconada.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For purchase of sweets such as chocolates, cookies, candy, yogurt, and soda.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi N. is twenty-six years old. She is married and has two children, a boy and a girl, both of whom are in the primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the western region of Ghana. Her husband works at a local sawmill firm.

Naomi sells rubber and plastic products, such as buckets, bowls, and cups in the market square. She buys her goods in Kumasi. Naomi also treks to other markets to sell. She has been in business for three years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children a good education.

loans.use: To buy plastic ware

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene 32 años, es soltero y un hombre muy consecuente; tiene su casa propia, pero para las horas de almorzar frecuentemente visita la casa de su madre. Se dedica a las labores agrícolas, en especial a la siembra de piñas y como desde muy joven ha sembrado esta fruta, en su pueblo lo llaman “el piñero”. Todos estos años sus cultivos le han resultado muy rentables, la única dificultad que tiene es que en el momento de la cosecha algunas hojas hieren sus manos hasta sangrar, a pesar de esto, le gusta mucho su trabajo y para comercializar sus productos los envía a un mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Lima. Samuel presta toda su atención y cuidado a sus cultivos, puesto que sabe que gracias a ello adquirió un carro con el que ahora trabaja haciendo transporte de carga desde las chacras hasta el pueblo y eso le genera otro ingreso económico. Ahora, sus sueños están en conformar su propia familia, para después emprender un negocio de compra y venta de frutas. Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP, durante los cuatro periodos concluidos demostró responsabilidad en cada uno de sus pagos y del mismo modo se compromete a seguir cumpliendo. Cabe recalcar que Samuel es un hombre muy cumplidor, digno de confianza, tiene el cargo de fiscal en su banco comunal, puesto que en cada una de las reuniones demuestra formalidad, por lo que todos le guardan respeto. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de 28 sacos de fertilizantes químicos, calcula que le costará un aproximado de 2660 soles, el resto del dinero es para pagar el jornal de sus trabajadores.
texts.en:
Samuel is 32 years old, single, and is a very consistent man. He owns his own house but for lunch he often visits his mother’s house. He works in agriculture, especially planting pineapple, and because he has been planting this fruit ever since he was young, they call him “El piñero” (The pineapple man) in his town.

All of these years his harvest has been very profitable. The only difficulty that he has is that when he harvests the fruit some of the leaves cut his hands until they bleed, but in spite of this, he really likes his job. To sell his produce he sends it to a wholesale market in the city of Lima. Samuel puts all of his care and attention into his crops because he knows that thanks to them, he was able to buy a car which he now uses to transport cargo from farms to the town and this generates another source of income for him.

Now his dream is to satisfy his family’s needs, so that later he can start a business buying and selling fruit. This is his 5th loan with MFP. During the previous four terms he showed responsibility in each one of his payments and he intends to continue the same way. It should be emphasized that Samuel is a very reliable, honorable, trustworthy man. He holds the fiscal manager position in his communal bank and he takes each of the meetings seriously, for which all members respect him.

The loan he is requesting is for the purchase of 28 bags of chemical fertilizers, which he calculates will cost about 2660 Soles, the rest of the money is to pay his day laborers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pay day laborers.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
El socio es natural de Calca exactamente de Huarán, zona de clima cálido y tropical, lugar privilegiado de un verde y estupendo paisaje, ubicado a 1 hora y 20 minutos, se encuentra la casa de nuestro socio.

El socio NICOLAS, tiene 68 años de edad, es casado y tiene 5 hijos el menor tiene 22 años de edad, nuestro socio alterna desde hace años sus actividades diversas con la agricultura, el tiene tierras y siembra, maíz, alcachofa, habas, árboles frutales, peras, duraznos, frutillas, naranjas, manzanas, entre otros. Nuestro socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de semillas para la segunda siembra en sus tierras y así vender los granos y la producción que viene.

El socio está muy agradecido por el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago total de su deuda.
texts.en:
This associate, Nicolas, is native to Calca, exactly speaking from Huarán, a warm tropical zone, a place priveleged by its green and stupendous scenery. Located 1 hour and 20 minutes from the city you will find his house. Nicolas is 68 years old, is married and has 5 children. The youngest is 22 years of age. For years Nicolas has alternated between diverse agricultural activities. He has land and sows maize, artichoke, broadbeans, fruit trees, pears, peaches, strawberries, oranges, and apples, among others. He wishes to invest his loan in the purchase of seeds for the second crop sowing in his land, in this way selling the grains and production that comes. Nicolas is very thankful for the support offered to him in this moment and promises to fulfill all the payments of his debt.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds to for the planting season

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy M. is a mother of five children, two sons and three daughters, all of whom are in school – senior high, junior high and primary schools The first born is in the university. She is forty years old and married. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the western region of Ghana. Mercy’s husband works with the local transport union.

Mercy is a trader. She buys bags of salt from distributors and sells them to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also sells under a shed in the market square and treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for six years and wants a loan to buy bags of salt in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best of education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of salt

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es: Leonor tiene 47 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 6 hijos; de los cuales los mayores migraron a otras ciudades y los tres menores viven con ella, quienes en horas de la mañana estudian y a eso de las 3 de la tarde la ayudan en los trabajos agrícolas. Minutos antes o unos después de las 8.00am diariamente Leonor cruza su pueblo machete en mano camino a las chacras donde realizara su jornada de trabajo, en compañía de su esposo. Para que le alcance el tiempo se levanta a las 4.00am, prepara el almuerzo que lleva en un recipiente para evitar regresar a su casa y para sus hijos lo deja en la brasa de la estufa para que lo hallen caliente. Las labores que realiza la llenan de regocijo, puesto que a pesar de sembrar sus propios cultivos le gusta trabajar como jornalera, donde le pagan 12 soles diarios. Cuando llega la época de cosechar su chacra de café, su esposo e hijos realizan la faena y gracias a esta dinámica le sobra tiempo para trabajar como jornalera para sus vecinos, de ese modo apoya en los gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Este es el quinto préstamo que tiene con MFP; durante estos ciclos consecutivos demostró puntualidad en cada uno de sus pagos y para este ciclo hace compromisos de seguir trabajando con la misma lealtad a su banco comunal, al que estima mucho y en cada reunión nunca faltan sus chistes, robándoles una sonrisa a todos sus compañeros. El dinero que solicita los piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes químicos y de ese modo procederá a abonar sus chacras cafetaleras.
texts.en:
Leonor is 47 years old, is a very hardworking woman, and has 6 children, the oldest of which have moved to other cities and the youngest three live with her, studying in the morning, and helping her with agricultural work after 3pm. Every day, a few minutes before or after 8:00 am, Leonor crosses her town, machete in hand, on her way to the farms where she works all day with her husband.

In order to have enough time, Leonor gets up at 4:00am, prepares lunch to take with her so that she does not have to return home, and she leaves lunch for her children on the stove so that it will be warm for them. Her work fills her with joy and, even though she plants her own crops, she likes to work as a day laborer where she gets paid 12 Soles daily. When it becomes time to harvest her coffee field her husband and children do the work. This arrangement allots her extra time to work as a day laborer for her neighbors, and this way she can contribute to the cost of her children’s food and education.

This is her 5th loan with MFP. During these consecutive loan terms she proved to be punctual in every single one of her payments, and during this term she promises to continue working with the same loyalty to her communal bank, which she holds in high esteem. At meetings there is never a lack of her jokes which bring a smile to the faces of all her partners. The money that she is requesting she plans to use to buy chemical fertilizers to fertilize her coffee fields.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
