Nelly M. is 45 years old. She is a married mother of five children, one son and four daughters. One is in senior high while the others are in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a commercial town in the western region of Ghana.

Nelly is a hard working woman. She works to support her husband, who works for a cocoa marketing company. Nelly runs a grocery store. She sells groceries such as Milo (a brand of malted milk sold by Nestle in West Africa), sugar, rice, candies, and bread in a store near the street. She has been in business for two years and wants a loan to buy more groceries to expand her business. She hopes to give her children the best education that she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square. She supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. Esi buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk.

Esi is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters, who are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. She is 54 years old and married. Her husband works with a local sawmill firm. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She desires to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah Q., age 40, is the mother of five children: three sons and two daughters who are currently in senior high, junior high and primary schools. Her husband is the pastor of a church. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana.

Hannah is a fish monger who sells smoked fish. She sells the fish on a tabletop at the market square and also supplies retailers and food vendors in her community. She buys cartons of fresh fish from big cold stores in Kumasi and smokes the fish herself. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy fish in bulk. Hannah's desire is to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K. runs a boutique shop in her community. She sells all kinds of ready-made clothes, footwear and fashion accessories for both men and women. Her shop is located by the roadside. She buys her goods from Accra and Kumasi. She has been in business for some years and wants a loan to buy clothes in bulk.

Grace is the mother of three children, two sons and a daughter, who are currently in junior high and primary schools. She is 35 years old and married. Her husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. Grace wants to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy ready-made clothes

loans.name: Lola

texts.es: Lola tiene 48 años, es madre de 4 hijos, el mayor migró a la ciudad de Lima en busca de un porvenir diferente a la agricultura. Ahora, junto a su esposo, vive con los 3 menores que son el motivo de su trabajo. Desde muy joven sembró plátanos y piña, actividad que realiza por más de 28 años, con la ayuda de su esposo; pero en los últimos años ha preferido cultivar mayormente café, ya que durante los meses de mayo a septiembre (época de cosecha) le genera muy buenas ganancias. Lola se siente muy satisfecha con su trabajo, puesto que las veces que comercializa el café, siente su trabajo y esfuerzo es recompensado. Hace 15 días ha recogido los mejores frutos de la primera recolección de sus plantas cafetaleras y nota que se están cargando frutos nuevamente por lo que sabe que la segunda recolección será muy beneficiosa también. Esto la anima y alegra mucho porque de ese modo cubrirá la educación de sus hijos hasta que se conviertan en profesionales de éxito. Este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, durante los 4 periodos anteriores consecutivos demostró puntualidad en sus pagos; asimismo reitera su compromiso para ese nuevo ciclo. Lola es la tesorera de su banco comunal y es muy responsable en su cargo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos para su chacra cafetalera, de la que siente muy orgullosa.
texts.en:
Lola is 48 years old, and is the mother of 4 children, the oldest of which migrated to the city of Lima in search of a future different to agriculture. Now, with her husband, she lives with the 3 younger children, who are her motivation to work. Since she was very young she has planted bananas and pineapples, an activity that she has been doing for more than 28 years, with the help of her husband; but in the last few years she has preferred to cultivate coffee, now that during the months from May to September (the harvest period) she generates very good earnings. Lola feels very satisfied with her work, because the times that she sells the coffee, she feels that her work and effort is compensated for. 15 days ago she gathered the best fruit of the first collection of her coffee plants and noted that they are carrying new fruits, because of which she knows that the second collection will be very beneficial as well. This animates her and makes her happy because by this method she will cover the education of her children until they become successful professionals. This is her fifth loan with MFP, during the 4 previous consecutive periods she demonstrated punctuality with her payments; likewise she reiterates her obligation for this new period. Lola is the treasurer of her communal bank and is very responsible with her obligations. The money that she is seeking is to buy chemical fertilisers for her coffee farm, of which she feels very proud.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilisers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther O. is a young lady of 25. She is single and does not have children. She lives with her mother in a rented apartment in Dwenase, a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso in the Western Region of Ghana. She is a seamstress by profession. Esther designs and sews for clients and to sell on a retail basis. She has a workshop by the roadside in her community. She says she has four apprentices under training. 

Esther has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy textile materials and other sewing accessories. She desires to expand her business and save for her future before she enters into marriage.

loans.use: To buy textile materials

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 52 años, es una madre muy hacendosa y jovial, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo. Tiene 7 hijos; de los cuales 4 formaron sus propias familias, actualmente vive con los 3 menores que están estudiando en un colegio a 2 kilómetros de distancia de su casa. Durante los meses de cosecha es imposible hallarla en casa, a las 7.00am la cesta de Susana ya está llena de café, empieza su recolección antes que raye el sol para acumular una buena cantidad de fruto en menos de una semana. Una vez acumulado el café procede al lavado, secado y finalmente lo vende a una procesadora con la que tiene contrato desde el mes de mayo hasta septiembre. Estos meses son claves para Susana, por lo que no duda en poner todas sus fuerzas en este trabajo, ya que de eso depende el dinero para la educación de sus hijos y la continuidad de sus cultivos. A Susana le agrada realizar esta actividad, ya que le permite avizorar las ganancias que obtendrá una vez comercializado, por ello, para los meses de cosecha trata de renovar sus canastas de diversos tamaños porque toda la familia participa de la cosecha. Este es el quinto crédito que tiene con MFP, durante los 4 periodos anteriores consecutivos demostró responsabilidad en sus cuotas; asimismo se compromete a continuar con el mismo ritmo de trabajo. Cabe resaltar que es una persona con gran sentido del humor, con el cual acompaña cada una de sus conversaciones en banco comunal. El dinero que solicita es para comprar 8 sacos de fertilizantes, ya que está planeando renovar sus plantas de café.
texts.en:
Susana is 52. She is a very hard working and jovial mother. She lives with her husband in her own house. She has seven children; four of them have formed their own families. Currently she lives with the three minor children, who go to a school that is two kilometers from her house. During the months of the harvest it is impossible to find her at home. At 7:00 a.m. Susana’s basket is already full of coffee. She starts collecting before the sun rises in order to gather a good quantity of fruit in less than a week. Once accumulated, the coffee goes to be washed, dried, and finally she sells it to a processor with whom she has a contract. This occurs from May through September. These months are key for Susana; she does not hesitate to put all of her efforts into this work. Her children’s education and the continuation of her crops depend upon this money. It pleases Susana to do this work. It allows her visualize the earnings that she will receive once the coffee is sold. She tries to refurbish her various sized baskets for the months of harvest. The whole family participates in the harvest. This is her fifth loan with MFP. She demonstrated responsibility in her payments with her four previous, consecutive loans. She promises to continue with the same work rhythm. She has a great sense of humor, which is evident in all of her conversations in her community bank. She will use the loan to buy eight sacks of fertilizers. She is planning to renew her coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Abibata

texts.en:
Abibata S. is 40 years old. She is married and has six children—one daughter and five sons. Some are currently in the senior high school while others are in the junior high and primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Abibata is a food vendor. She prepares and sells porridge. She sells the porridge by the roadside in the mornings. Abibata wants a loan to buy bags of maize and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from nearby communities at affordable prices. She has been in business for 10 years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and sponsor her children in school.

loans.use: To buy maize in bulk

loans.name: Yraida

texts.es:
La señora Yraida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, vive en el Jr. Angaiza Nº 240, Distrito D. Rioja, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 39 años y es madre D. 2 hijos que aún dependen D. ella.

Nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 300.00 por iniciativa propia, comprando un par D. telas y confeccionando algunas ropas, las cuales mostro a sus amigos y vecinos, desD. entonces empezó a hacerse conocida, fue implementándose más y ahorrando para así aumentar sus producciones y poder vender más. 

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo servicio, por supuesto hoy más renovada y con bastante trabajo ya que realiza diferentes modelos D. costura como calzones, pijamas, carteras y prendas para niños; cuenta con una maquina que es su herramienta principal D. trabajo.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,200.00, invertirá comprando telas, hilos, elásticos, adornos en cantidad D. variados colores y algunas herramientas D. trabajo como tijeras, para remplazar a las antiguas.
Se siente mejor ahora que en sus inicios, más segura al ofrecer sus productos y al mismo tiempo más constante y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas.

Dice:“Hoy me siento una mujer muy fortalecida y contenta por lo logrado”. Yraida, también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y Empresaria y ayudar así como a ella a muchas mas mujeres que sueñan salir a adelante solas.
texts.en:
Yraida, who is a member of the Riojana Woman Communal Bank, lives at Jr. Angaiza Nº 240, Distrito D. Rioja, Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. She is married, 39 years old, and the mother of two children who still depend on her. She tells us that she started out with S/.300,000 of her own, purchasing fabrics and making clothes, which she showed to her friends and neighbors. Since then, she became known, and she has been growing (in her business) and saving up in order to increase her production and be able to sell more. Currently, she continues this business, which of course is now more sophisticated. She has plenty of work since she now creates different types of clothing and accessories such as long underwear, pajamas, purses, and children's apparel. She relies on her sewing machine, which is her main tool for her work. With this loan of S/. 1,200, she will purchase fabrics, threads, elastic, all sorts of notions, and some work tools such as scissors in order to replace the old ones. She is more confident now than when she started out, more sure of the products she offers, and at the same time, more consistent and responsible in making her loan payments. She says: "Now I feel like a very strong woman, content with what I've achieved." Yraida is also grateful to Kiva partner Movimiento Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and a businessperson and for helping her and many others who have dreams to succeed on their own.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabrics, threads, scissors, and tools

loans.name: Samuel

texts.es: Samuel tiene 35 años, es un hombre muy noble y amoroso; está felizmente casado con la madre de sus hijos, quienes son el motivo de sus desvelos. Cuando era soltero era muy buen hijo y hermano, ahora que formó su propia familia lucha cada día en sus tierras de cultivo por brindarles una vida feliz. Con las ganancias que ha obtenido de sus cosechas logró comprar un motocarro, con el cual también se dedica a sacar la carga de productos de las chacras más lejanas donde no hay acceso de movilidad. Desde entonces a cada solicitud de sus servicios acude inmediatamente, porque de ese modo acumula ingresos adicionales para sus cultivo, por lo que se propone en seguir trabajando así sin descuidar sus propias siembras, a las que les tiene mucho cariño. Durante los 4 créditos consecutivos demostró puntualidad en cada uno de sus pagos y del mismo modo se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su banco comunal, por lo que en cada una de las reuniones actúa con mucha sobriedad, guardando el orden de los demás integrantes. El dinero que ahora solicita planea invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para su moto y fertilizantes químicos para sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old. He is a very noble and lovely man. He's happily married to the mother of his children, who are the reason for his efforts. When he was single, he was a very good son and brother. Now that he had a family of his own, he works hard daily on his arable land to give them a happy life. With the earnings he made from his crops, he purchased a motorized rickshaw, which he also uses to transport products from the outlying farms where there is no access to vehicles. Ever since, he has attended immediately to every request for his service because by doing this he earns more income for his farm. And so, he continues working like this, without neglecting to care well for his own crops. Throughout the four consecutive loans that he has had, he has demonstrated punctuality in making each one of the payments, and in the same way, he's continued to fulfill his duties to his communal bank. At each of the bank's meetings, he's been very serious, maintaining order among all the members. He is now requesting money to purchase replacement (parts) for his rickshaw and chemical fertilizers for his coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Olivia Engkvist, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for his rickshaw and fertilizer for his crops

loans.name: Lamisi

texts.en:
Lamisi A. is 23 years old. She is single and has no children. She lives alone in a rented apartment in the commercial town of Dwenase in the Western Region. Dwenase is a suburb of Sefwi-Wiawso, the district capital. 

Lamisi is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She sells her products on a tabletop in a school compound in her community. She sells in the mornings. Lamisi wants a loan to buy bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She buys her goods from Kumasi. She has been in business for four years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. She aspires to expand her business and save for her future before she gets married.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: Simon vive en la colonia Yolaina , finca la Esperanza de Nueva Guinea, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Compra de zinc), trabaja como obrero de campo desde hace 4 años, tiene 4 hijos, la mayor de 18 años estudia su 5to año, otra de 16 años estudia su 4to año,  la niña de 11 años estudia su 5to grado y el niño menor de 8 añitos estudia su 3er grado, su esposa se encarga de los quehaceres del hogar; Don Simon es  responsable, honesto, trabajador, humilde, su sueño es  tener siempre buena salud y en el futuro tener una casa bonita con mejores condiciones para que sus hijos gozen de ella  y tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia ya que son muy humildes.
texts.en:
Simon lives in the settlement of Yolaina, on a farm called The Hope of New Guinea. He requests a second loan to be invested in home improvements (specifically for the purchase of zinc).

Simon has been a farm worker for four years. He has four children: an 18 year old daughter in her fifth year of secondary school, a 16 year old daughter in her fourth year of secondary school, an 11 year old daughter in fifth grade, and an 8 year old son in third grade. His wife takes care of the household chores. Don Simon is responsible, honest, hardworking, and humble. His dream is to always be in good health, have a nice home in the future with better living conditions for children to enjoy, and have a stable job so that he can support his humble family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Frida Leonor

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. FRIDA, nuestra socia es originaria de Huarán, en la provincia de Calca del departamento de Cusco, ubicado a1 hora y 20 minutos de la misma ciudad, siendo Huarán parte del corazón del valle sagrado de años Incas.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad, y es casada, ella tiene 4 hijos los último tienen (20,19), la socia alterna sus actividades de hogar con la agricultura, vende granos al por mayor y menor y el Turismo vivencial participativo,  nuestra socia desea invertir el préstamo solicitado en la implementación de sus habitaciones y baños para sus turistas que la visitan durante todo el año y se hospedan en su casita en pleno corazón del valle sagrado.

Nuestra socia se muestra muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado, lo cual le permitira arreglar su casita y seguir albergando a más turistas de manera adecuada y así mismo se compromete en el pago de su deuda según el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This communal bank member is Mrs. Frida. She is originally from Huarán, located in the Province of Calca, Department of Cusco. Located an hour and 20 minutes outside of Cusco, Huarán is in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas.

Frida is 49 years old, married, and has 4 children (with the last two being ages 20 and 19). She splits her time between her household responsibilities and farming, selling grains wholesale and retail and by providing homestays for tourists. Frida wishes to invest the requested loan in constructing rooms and bathrooms for tourists who visit throughout the year and seek lodging at her cottage in the heart of the Sacred Valley.

Our member is very grateful for being granted this loan, which will allow her to remodel her cottage so that she can adequately accommodate more tourists. At the same time, she promises to repay the debt within the specified period.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build rental rooms & additional bathrooms for tourists

loans.name: Ramosa

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Ramosa, ella vive en la provincia D. Calca en el distrito D. Huarán, situado dentro del valle sagrado perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

La socia tiene 49 años ella es casada, tiene 4 hijos y los últimos hijos tienen (20, 22) años ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio, nuestra socia venD. granos (maíz, habas, cebada, trigo y papas); ella también se dedica a la compra y venta D. palos, y a vender hormigón, piedras, adobes todos estos últimos para materiales D. construcción, nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder reinvertir en sus diferentes negocios. 

Nuestra socia está muy agradecida y valora el préstamo otorgado debido a que en la zona no se encuentra la banca financiera, ella se compromete a cumplir con el pago total D. sus deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This associate is Sra. Ramosa. She lives in the province of Calca in the district of Huarán, situated within the sacred valley in the department of Cusco. Sra. Ramosa is 49 years old and is married. She has 4 children - the last 2 are 20 and 22 years old. She alternates her household activities with commerce, selling grains (maize, broadbeans, barley, wheat and potato); she also buys and sells poles, concrete, stones, and adobe, the latter materials for construction. She is seeking a loan to be able to reinvest in her different businesses. Sra. Ramosa is very thankful and values the loan granted to her, as in the region there isn't a financial bank. She promises to fulfill the payments for her debt in the time period established.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Rosario, pertenece al Banco Comunal “María Gracia”, vive en el Jr. Iquitos Nº 430, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 46 años y es madre de 04 hijos, 01 aún depende de ella.

Nos cuenta que se inició con  S/. 300.00 y por iniciativa propia deseó implementar su negocio propio, la cúal se dedico a la venta de comidas, pero poco tiempo después también implemento su negocio de ventas de abarrotes.
En la actualidad, se dedica a estos dos negocios, y nos cuenta que le va muy bien, ya que es muy conocida por sus clientes, cuenta con sus pensionistas y clientes fijos.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como sacos de arroz y azúcar, aceites en paquetes, pollos y también mesas, sillas, vasos y ollas, para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. También invertirá en la compra de sus productos, para aumentar su bodega.

Ella toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. Hoy se siente una Mujer independiente, más responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Rosarito, como le dicen de cariño, manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como Mujer y Empresaria.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosario is a member of the communal bank “María Gracia.” She lives in the province of Myobamba in the department of San Martín. Mrs. Rosario is a married, 46-year-old mother of four children, one of whom still lives with her. She tells us that she wanted to start her own business and began with 300 soles. She began by selling (prepared) food but soon started to sell groceries also. Today she still has these two businesses and reports that they are both doing very well since her clients know her and she has a regular clientele. With this loan of 1,500 soles, she would like to buy supplies for the food she prepares each day like: sacks of rice, sugar, packets of oil, and chicken. She would also like to buy tables, chairs, glasses and pots since this will help her serve her clients better. She will also invest in the purchase of products for her grocery store. Mrs. Rosario makes the decisions about money in her business. Nowadays, she feels like an independent woman and feels more responsible about paying her loan installments. Rosarito, as she is affectionately called, extends thanks to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and as a businesswoman.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprara abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite) y pollos para la preparación de sus comidas.

loans.name: Amélé

texts.fr: Cette femme est née dans un village d’atakpamé, elle a quitté tôt son village pour s’installer à Lomé  où elle s’est mariée et a eu 02 enfants. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de pagnes, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de boissons. Les passants sont très attirés par les pagnes qu’elle expose, elle veut agrandir son stock de pagnes pour attirer plus de clients et mieux vendre, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 30 pièces de pagnes de différents modèles et quelques boissons.
texts.en:
This woman was born in a village of Atakpamé, but she left her village early on settle in Lomé where she married and now has 2 children. She earns her living by selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth), as well as drinks. Passers-by are really attracted by the "pagnes" that she displays, so she wants to expand her stock of "pagnes" so as to attract more customers and make more sales. She is asking WAGES for her first loan to buy 30 lengths of "pagne" of different designs and also some drinks.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of pagnes and some drinks

loans.name: Dolores Del Carmen

texts.es: Dolores es soltera, de 39 años de edad, trabaja en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa como responsable de presupuesto, de oficio contador público, con 5 años de servicio.  Esta solicitando su 3er credtio para la construccion de un sumidero con las siguientes medidas: 2 mts de ancho x 2.5 mts de largo, tambien desea construir un baño de 1.5 mts de ancho x 2 mts de largo, con inodoro y lavamanos, desea realizar esta obra ya que es de suma necesidad, pues las aguas pluviales estan causando muchos problemas y solamente a traves del credito es que se puede concreitzar la obra que tiene planificado, este credito esta garantizado, pues está pactado con un vonvenio a traves de la alcaldia y ademas respaldado con garantia de electrodomesticos.
texts.en:
39-year old Dolores is single and works in the mayor’s office in Juigalpa. She is in charge of budgets in the public accounts office where she has worked for five years. Dolores is asking for her third loan. It will be used to construct a drainage system measuring 2m wide x 2.5m long. She also wants to build a bathroom 1.5m wide and 2m long with a toilet and washbasin. It is very important to do these projects because the rains are causing many problems, and only through a line of credit can Dolores complete the work she is planning. The loan is guaranteed through an agreement with the mayor’s office, and also through a lien on her electrical appliances.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction of a drainage system

loans.name: Wilfredo Rene

texts.es: El Sr. Wilfredo René C. G., cliente antiguo de Emprender, en un principìo formo parte del grupo Santiago Felix en doce secuencias, desde el año 2002 hasra el año 2005, posteriormente solicito crédito individual, encontrandose actualmente en su décima secuencia, él tiene domicilio propio en la zona de el Pedregal, pero por el negocio ellos viven y atienden su actividad en la zona de Cotacota, la esposa le colabora en la venta de lubricantes, dedicandose él a la actividad de la mecanica de autos, ellos tienen dos hijas en edad escolar. Es un cliente bueno y responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Wilfredo René C. G., a long time client of Emprender, was originally part of the Santiago Felix group for 12 loan cycles from 2002 to 2005. Subsequently, he took out individual loans, and he is now in his 10th loan cycle. He owns a home in the Pedregal area, but due to his work, he and his wife live and work in the Cotacota area. He and his wife sell lubricants and he is a car mechanic. They have two school-aged daughters. He is a good client and responsible with his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase an engine for his car

loans.name: Armando Richard

texts.es: Armando Richard es una persona muy trabajadora de 40 años que se dedica a la confección de "Polleras" (ropa típica de Bolivia para mujer, es una especie de falda larga.). El comenzó con esta actividad gracias a su madre, ya que ella también se dedica a la costura. Actualmente él y su familia viven en su propia casa. Armando trabaja con esta actividad hace más de 15 años, durante los cuales también aprendió acerca de cocina tradicional de nuestro país. Él es muy responsable y esmerado con su trabajo ya que todos los clientes que tiene están muy contentos y satisfechos con los trabajos que él realiza.
texts.en:
Armando Richard is a hard working 40 year old who sews "Polleras" (typical Bolivian women's clothing - a type of long skirt). He started in this line of work thanks to his mother, who was also a seamstress. He and his family own their own home. Armando has made Polleras for 15 years, and he has also learned about traditional Bolivian cooking. He is very responsible and conscientious and all of his customers are very happy and satisfied with his work.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of rolls of fabric

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
La señora Ermelinda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, ubicada en la ciudad de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 58 años, es conviviente y madre de 03 hijos, tiene estudios de educación secundaria incompleta, vive en el Barrio La Capilla.
 
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años, es una de las socias fundadoras del Banco Comunal Cristo Blanco, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 compró golosinas como: caramelos, galletas, chocolates y yogurts para venderlos en su kiosco.

Actualmente solocita un préstamo de S/. 700.00 para poder invertir en su kiosco de venta de golosinas, comprara chocolates, galletas, caramelos, yogurts y gaseosas, además comprara frutas como: plátanos, naranjas, mandarinas y entre otros para su venta.

Su mayor sueño es poder seguir trabajando. A ella le gustan los ahorros, las reuniones de su Banco Comunal ya que se distrae mucho compartiendo con sus compañeras.
texts.en:
Ermelinda belongs to the "White Christ" Communal Bank, located in the city of Juliaca, San Román Province, in the State of Puno. She is 58 years old, and lives with her partner and three children. She did not complete her secondary education. She lives in the La Capilla neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos movement for 7 years and is one of the founding members of the White Christ Communal Bank. With an initial loan of S/. 300.00 she purchased sweets such as caramels, cookies, chocolates and yogurt to sell at her kiosk. She is now requesting a loan of S./ 700.00 to invest in her kiosk. She will purchase chocolates, cookies, caramels, yogurt, and soft drinks, as well as fruit such as bananas, oranges and mandarins among others, to sell. Her greatest dream is to continue working. She likes saving and enjoys the meetings of her Communal Bank, because she has a good time sharing with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chocolates, cookies, caramels, and soft drinks, as well as fruit (bananas, oranges, mandarins)

loans.name: Elva

texts.es:
La señora Elva de Huancavelica, emprendedora e ingeniosa, tiene 46 años de edad, conviviente, tiene 3 hijos mayores e independientes. Trabaja con EDAPROSPO hace 3 años, se dedica a la venta de tejidos manuales diversos como   tapetes, adornos y otros, y también a la venta de queso, para realizar esta actividad Elva aprovecha la movilidad de su esposo quien se dedica al transporte de carga pesada todos los fines de semana a la Oroya. Teniendo ella la ventaja de vender a los habitantes de la mina y otros, luego de regreso compra queso para distribuirlos según pedidos. Esta actividad  le permite cubrir gastos en el hogar  y acumular  capital  para comprar  lana y queso. 
El reciente préstamo de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles lo invertirá en comprar  más lana de diversos colores. 
En el futuro le gustaría contar con más capital para poder cubrir los pedidos solicitados de sus clientes y completar la construcción de su casa.
texts.en:
Elva, from Huancavelica, is entrepreneurial and ingenious. She is 46 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has 3 adult children who live independently. She has worked with EDAPROSPO for 3 years and sells handicrafts such as small rugs, decorations, etc. She also sells cheese. To do this she takes advantage of the fact that her husband is a truck driver who transports heavy cargo every weekend to La Oroya. She can sell to the people who live at the mine and others, and on the return trip she purchases cheese to distribute and fill orders. This activity enables her to cover her expenses at home and to save capital to purchase wool and cheese. The most recent loan of 700.00 new soles will be used to purchase more wool in various colors. In the future she would like to save more capital to be able to cover all of her customers' orders and to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more wool in various colors

loans.name: Elba Victoria

texts.es: La señora Elba se dedica a la comercializacion de edredones, almohadas y gorras en la feria 16 de Julio ubicada en la Ciudad de El Alto, actividad que realiza desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana los dias de feria los cuales son jueves y domingos, aparte doña Elba en algunas ocaciones viaja a Caranavi (Sud Yungas) a vender este mismo tipo de mercaderia.  Ella vive con Hermogenes Botello su esposo, ambos trabajan bastante para poder sacar adelante a sus dos hijas ya que ambas estan estudiando en la universidad. Requieren el credito para adquirir una movilidad, la cual la pondran a trabajar como taxi.
texts.en:
Elba sells comforters, pillows and hats in the 16 de Julio market in the city of El Alto. To do this, she gets up very early on market days which are Thursdays and Sundays. Occasionally, she also travels to Caranavi (Sud Yungas) to sell the same type of merchandise. She lives with her husband, Hermogenes Botello, and they both work a lot to be able to support their two daughters who are both in college. They are requesting this loan to purchase a vehicle, which they will use to provide taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle, to be used for public service

loans.name: Nemecia

texts.es:
La señora Nemecia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios”, ubicado en el distrito de Lampa Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 38 años, es casada y madre de 3 hijos (uno fallecido), posee estudios de secundaria completa. 

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, se retiro dos ciclos debido al fallecimiento de su menor hijo y luego retornó, reiniciando su trabajo con un préstamo de S/. 300.00, con el cual compró productos para la elaboración del Popcorn.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 200.00, luego de haber vuelto esta reiniciando su negocio de venta de Popcorn y quiere ver si le va bien para que más adelante saque una mayor cantidad de monto.

Su mayor sueño es poder darle una profesión a cada uno de sus hijos. A ella le gustan los ahorros  que dan en su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Nemecia belongs to the San Juan de Dios Community Bank located in the Lampa district, San Román province, Puno department. She is 38, married, and has three children (one passed away). She has a high school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. She left for two loan cycles because of the death of her youngest son. Later she returned, starting her work again with a loan for 300 PEN, which she used to buy products for making popcorn. She is currently asking for a 200 PEN loan. After having restarted her Popcorn business, she wants to see if it goes well for her so that she can later take out a larger sum. Her biggest dream is to give each of her children a profession. She likes the savings her Community Bank gives.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for making popcorn

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
La señora Nely, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Primavera”, vive en el Jr. Coronel Bardales S/Nº, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 45 años y es madre soltera de 03 hijos, 01 que todavía estudia y depende mucho de ella. 

Nos cuenta que se inició con S/. 500.00 y que fue por iniciativa propia que decidió emprender su negocio de venta de dulces.
Es ella misma quién se encarga de prepararlos en su casa, aparte de vender sus dulces, chifles, turrones, también vende sus aguajes y algunas frutas de estación.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio, y vende caminando por diferentes lugares dentro de la ciudad donde hay mas movimiento, nos cuenta que le va muy bien en sus ventas y ya tiene mucha acogida.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, lo invertirá comprando sus sacos de aguajes, insumos para la preparación de sus productos como Chancaca, azúcar, maní seco y galones de aceites para la preparación de sus chifles y turrones. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando panes y dulces, para luego venderlos.

Nely toma las decisiones en las ganancias de su negocio. En lo personal, nos cuenta que ahora es muy independiente, segura y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas. Manifiesta su agradecimiento a Manuela Ramos por permitirle crecer como mujer y empresaria, y por ayudar a otras mujeres que sueñan con salir adelante.
texts.en:
Nely belongs to the La Primavera Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Coronel Bardales S/Nº, Moyabamba province, San Martín department. She is a 45 year old single mother with three children. One child is still in school and very dependent upon her. She started her business of selling sweets with 500 PEN and her own initiative. She makes the sweets in her house. Besides selling sweets, plantain chips, and nougat candy, she also sells aguajes (a Peruvian fruit) and some seasonal fruit. She currently has the same business. She sells by walking to the busier places in the city. She is well received, and sales are going very well for her. With this loan for 1,500 PEN she will buy sacks of aguajes and ingredients like sugar cane, sugar, dried peanuts, and gallons of oil to make her plantain chips and nougat candy. She will use part of the money to buy bread and sweets to later sell. Nely makes the decisions about the earnings from her business. She is now independent, self-confident, and responsible about making her payments. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for allowing her to grow as a woman and as a business woman and for helping other women who dream of getting ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients (peanuts, sugar cane, sugar, and others) to make her sweets

loans.name: María Isidora

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora María Isidora C. se dedica a laborar muy esforzadamente para lograr su sueño de mejorar las condiciones de vida tanto de ella como de su familia. 

Es de relevancia destacar que hoy en día la señora María C. es soltera y con la responsabilidad de mantener a sus tres hijos y su anciano padre. Por este motivo ella requiere un crédito y ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y así salir adelante en el negocio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica of the city of León, Maria Isidora C. works hard to achieve her dream of improving her own and her family’s quality of life. It is important to emphasize that currently Maria C. is single and has the responsibility of supporting her three children and her elderly father. For this reason she needs a loan and has sough Ceprodel to be obtain a loan to purchase construction materials to be able to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Jose Abel

texts.es: José Abel vive en la colonia La fonseca a 25 KM de la colonia Yolaina, tiene 1 hijo de 8 años de edad que estudia su 2do grado de Educación primaria, su esposa se encarga del cuido del niño y de los quehaceres del hogar, Jose Abel trabaja como docente del INATEC desde hace 8 años, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 7mo crédito para invertirlo en la construcción de una habitacion y asi contar con mejores comodidades; se caracteriza por ser un profesional con mucha experiencia en docencia, el imparte sus clases con mucho amor,  es un hombre humilde, responsable con muchos deseos de seguir estudiando. El se siente agradecido con AFODENIC pues con los créditos anteriores ha mejorado su vivienda  y ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida, su sueño es tener una vivienda bonita y trabajo para así sacar a su hijo adelante y asi que no le falten nada en sul hogar.
texts.en:
José Abel lives in the La Fonseca area, 25 km from Yolaina. He has an 8-year old son who is in grade 2. His wife takes care of their child and does the household chores. José Abel has been working as a teacher at INATEC for eight years. He is now asking for a seventh loan so that he can add on another room and have more comfortable living conditions. José is considered to be a professional with much teaching experience who does his work in the classroom with much love. He is a modest and responsible man with a strong wish to continue his education. He is grateful to Kiva partner AFODENIC because with his previous loans he improved his house and his living conditions. His dream is to have a nice home with all the conveniences, as well as steady work so that he can help his son do well.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add a room to his house

loans.name: Xiomara Isabel

texts.es: Xiomara es soltera,  vive con sus padres, no tiene hijos, trabaja como Alguacil  en la corte Suprema de Justicia desde hace 2 años, está solicitando su 1er credito para la Construccion de una habitacion para asi tener mejor comodidad y privacidad, ella comparte con sus padres los gastos del hogar, se caracteriza por ser una joven humilde en su labor de trabajo y en su barrio, ademas profesa la religion evangelica, actualmente esta estudiando una carrera en la universidad URACCAN en Nueva  Guinea,  su sueño es tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, estabilidad laboral para así  ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara is single, lives with her parents, and has no children. She has been working as a bailiff in the Supreme Court of Justice for two years. She is now asking for her first loan so that she can add on a room and so have more comfort and privacy. Xiomara shares with her parents all the household expenses. She is considered a modest young woman both at work and in the neighbourhood and belongs to the evangelical religion. Currently she is studying at the URACCAN university in Nueva Guinea. Her dream is to have her own house with better living conditions, and steady work so that she can help her family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to add on a room to her parents' house

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: Pedro Pablo es casado, trabaja como docente de Educación primaria desde hace 8 años, tiene 1 hijos de 9 añitos de edad estudiando su 3er grado de educacion primaria, su esposa trabaja tambien como docente de primaria en la colonia el Escobin, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para  construir los servicios higienicos, son una familia muy unida comparten los gastos familiares y sus compromisos, Pedro Padre es un hombre humilde,  muy responsable, honesto y muy trabajador, tiene gran espiritu de superación profesional y laboral, su sueño para el futuro es estudiar una maestría, salud para su familia, tener estabilidad laboral y  tener una vivienda con mejores condiciones, como tambien ayudar a sus padres ya que estan viejitos y son de escasos recursos economicos.
texts.en:
Pedro Pablo is married. For eight years he has worked as an elementary school teacher. He has a nine year old son who is in third grade. His wife also works as an elementary school teacher in the Escobin colony. He is asking to refinance his second loan in order to build a bathroom. They are a very united family, and they share family expenses and commitments. Pedro Pablo is humble, very responsible, honest, and hard working. He has a great desire to improve himself professionally. His dreams for the future are to study for his master’s degree, good health for his family, to have work stability, and to have a home in better condition. He also wants to help his parents because they are old and have scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bathroom

loans.name: Martha Adilia

texts.es: Martha Adilia es casada, tiene tres hijos: el mayor tiene 17 años esta estudiando su 1er año en la universidad Martin Lutero, otro de 13 años estudia 4to año en el instituto Ruben Dario y la niña menor de 9 añitos de edad estudia su 2do grado de educacion primaria, su esposo es Ebanista y tiene su propio negocio en su casa; doña Martha esta  solicitando su 5to credito a AFODENIC para construir una habitacion de concreto para que su hijo mayor tenga privacidad,   ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable con buenas relaciones en la comunidad, todos los dias al regresar de impartir sus clases ayuda a su marido a trabajar en el taller que estos poseen, ademas expresa que se siente satisfecha con el servicio brindado de la institución, pues ha mejorado sus condiciones de vida familiar y han logrado  mejorar su casa, sueña con tener una casa bonita y grande con las condiciones necesarias para que sus todos sus hijos se sientan comodos.
texts.en:
Martha Afilia is married and has three children. Martin Lutero is the oldest. He is 17, and he is in his first year at the university. Another child is 13 and is in his fourth year at the Ruben Dario Institute. The youngest is 9, and she is in second grade. Ebanista is her husband, and he has his own business in their house. Martha is asking for her fifth loan with Afodenic in order to build a bedroom so that her oldest son can have privacy. She is a hard working, responsible woman who has good relationships within the community. Every day, after giving her classes, she helps her husband work in the shop that they have. She feels satisfied with the service the institution offers. Her family’s living conditions have improved, and they have improved their house. She dreams of having a beautiful, large house with the necessary living conditions so that all of her children feel comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a bedroom

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La señora Victoria, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Primavera”, vive en el Jr. Coronel Bardales S/Nº, Distrito de San Hilarión, Provincia San Martín, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 35 años, 02 hijos varones, que son su principal motivo para salir adelante.

Es una mujer luchadora y trabajadora que a pesar de haber tenido bajas en su vida, logro salir a adelante y con el apoyo de su esposo emprendió su pequeño negocio de venta de verduras en la región. Fue generando más ingresos de sus ventas, así empezó a comprar más y mas productos para vender. 

En la actualidad tiene muy buena clientela y ya es muy conocida, por sus clientes, ella vende recorriendo las calles, en las afueras del mercado o donde encuentre mayor movimiento, cuenta con lo necesario que el ama de casa necesita para preparar sus comidas.

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00 invertirá comprando verduras como: papas, frijoles y maní en sacos. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá comprando nuevas bandejas, para poner sus productos y dar más confianza a sus clientes.

Victoria, se siente aún con muchas fuerzas para seguir adelante y poder cumplir con sus metas y sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the La Primavera Community Bank. She lives on Jr. Coronel Bardales S/Nº, San Hilarión district, San Martín province, San Martín deparatment. She is 35 and married. She has two sons, and they are her primary motivation for getting ahead. She is a fighter and a hard worker, who, in spite of having had hard times in her life, was able to get head. With her husband’s help, she started her small business of selling vegetables in the region. Her sales were generating more income, so she started to buy more and more products to sell. She currently has a good client base. She is well known with her customers. She sells traveling the streets, outside the market, or wherever there are a lot of people. She carries everything a housewife needs to prepare her meals. With this loan for 1,000 PEN she will buy sacks of vegetables such as potatoes, beans, and peanuts. She will use part of the money to buy new trays to display her vegetables and make her customers more confident about shopping with her. Victoria still feels great strength to keep going forward and to be able to accomplish her goals and dreams. She is very grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for helping her establish her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy more vegetables and new trays

loans.name: Javier Alexander

texts.es:
El caballero Javier Alexander es casado y con un hijo al que debe brindarles las condiciones necesarias para su desarrollo. Trabaja arduamente para mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que ha sido dañada a través de los años y es por este motivo que ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel.

El crédito lo utilizará para la compra de los materiales de construcción para así mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y brindarle a su esposa y su hijo un techo digno donde habitar en el municipio de Telica de León.
texts.en:
Javier Alexander is married and has one child for whom he has to provide the necessary conditions for his development. He works arduously to improve the condition of his household that has been damaged through the years and it is for this reason that he has requested a loan from Ceprodel. The loan will be used to purchase construction materials to be able to improve the condition of his home and offer his wife and child a decent roof over the house that they inhabit which is located in the municipality of Telica of León.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Aris

texts.es: Aris es casado, trabaja como docente de Educacion primaria en la colonia Naciones a 35 km de Nueva Guinea, todos los dia tiene que viajar a las 6 de la mañana para impartir sus clases a los niños de esa colonia, vive  en la zona # 4  de Nueva Guinea, a pesar que no tiene hijos es un joven que ha luchado para que a su  esposa y sus ancianos padres no les falte nada, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do crédito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda (Pintar la casa y hecharle el piso a la cocina); actualmente esta estudiando su 2do año en la universidad en ciencias de la Educacion, es responsable, honesto,  trabajador,  profesa  la religión católica su sueño es tener un porvenir mejor, terminar de estudiar la carrera que esta cursando,  tener una vivienda bonita, trabajo, ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Aris is married. He works as an elementary school teacher in the Naciones colony, which is 35 km from New Guinea. Every day he has to leave at six in the morning to teach classes to the children of this colony. He lives in zone #4 in New Guinea. In spite of the fact that he does not have children, he is a young man who has struggled so that his wife and his elderly parents have what they need. He is asking to refinance his second loan to be able to improve his house (paint the house and put down a kitchen floor). He is currently in his second year of studying education in the university. He is a responsible, honest, and hard working Catholic. His dream is to have a better future, finish his career studies, have a beautiful house, work, and help his parents with their household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paint the house and put down a kitchen floor

loans.name: Blanca Nevai

texts.es: Blanca es casada, vive en la zona # 3 de Nueva Guinea donde la población cada dia crece mas, tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años de edad, los dos estudian, trabaja como Asistente de registro desde hace tres años en la universidad URACCAN en Nueva Guinea, su esposo trabaja  para la empresa lechera, ambos comparten con  los gastos del hogar, está solicitando refinanciamiento de su 2do credito para Terminar de construir un porche, cancelo credito anterior para mejora de vivienda con el fondo KIVA, logrando satisfactoriamente construir una habitacion,  doña Blanca es una mujer profesional  muy alegre,  responsable, honesta, trabajadora y muy servicial con la personas que lo necesitan y con muchos deseos de superacion,  ella se siente agradecida con AFODENIC ya con los financiamientos obtenidos por AFODENIC ha mejorado su vivienda y a obtenidos electrodomésticos con los cuales ha mejorado las condiciones de vida de ella y de su familia, su sueño es  que sus hijos estudien, salud,  tener estabilidad laboral para así ayudar a su familia y seguir estudiando para ser cada dia una profesional con mucha experiencia.
texts.en:
Blanca is married and lives in Zone #3 of Nueva Guinea, where the population increases each day. She has two children, 14 and 19 years old, who are students. She has worked for three years as a registration assistant in the URACCAN university in Nueva Guinea. Her husband works for the dairy company and they both share the household expenses. She is requesting refinancing of her second loan in order to finish constructing a porch. She repaid a previous loan used for housing improvement, satisfactorily completing construction of an additional room. Doña Blanca is a professional woman, happy, responsible, honest, hard working, and very helpful to the people who need it. She has a strong desire to advance and is grateful to AFODENIC since with the financing obtained from AFODENIC she has improved her house and obtained electric household appliances with which she has improved the living conditions of herself and her family. Her dream is that her children study, and to have health and work stability so she can help her family and continue to study in order to be a professional every day with much experience.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a porch

loans.name: Carlos Jerónimo

texts.es:
Con gran esfuerzo en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, el señor Carlos Jerónimo D. se dedica a laborar para mantener a sus tres pequeños niños brindándoles un techo digno donde habitar ya que se preocupa por mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda la cual ha estado en malas condiciones.

Hoy en día, el señor Carlos ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener el crédito necesario para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su familia y a sus pequeños hijos que tanto ama.
texts.en:
With great effort in the municipality of Telica of the city of Leon, Carlos Jerónimo D. dedicates himself to working to support his three small children and to offer them a decent roof over the house that they inhabit; he worries about improving the condition of his house, which has been in poor conditions. Presently Carlos has sought Ceprodel with the purpose of obtaining the necessary loan to purchase construction materials to offer a better quality of life to his family and his small children that he loves so much.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Zoraida

texts.es:
La señora Zoraida, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Primavera” y vive en la AA.HH. La Primavera Mza. B – Lte. 3, Provincia Moyobamba, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 36 años y es madre D. 03 hijos que aún dependen D. ella ya que son estudiantes.

Agradece a sus padres por haberla apoyado en sus estudios D. Cosmetología ya que supo valerse D. esto para implementar su pequeño salón D. belleza, ubicada en su misma casa, en un espacio bien acondicionado para atender a sus clientes.
Nos cuenta que hoy en día le va muy bien, ya que es conocida por sus amigos y vecinos, realiza diferentes tipos D. tintes, peinados y cortes, tanto para damas, caballeros y niños.

Con este préstamo D. S/1,000.00, invertirá comprando sus materiales D. trabajo como: laca en frascos, tintes D. cabello en diferentes colores, talcos, shampoos y cremas para el cabello.
También brinda el servicio D. manicure y pedicure y para esto comprara esmaltes D. diferentes colores

Es ella quien toma las decisiones en los gastos y ganancias D. su negocio. En lo personal, se siente una mujer independiente, decidida, más segura y responsable con el pago D. sus cuotas. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por brindarle el apoyo para iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Zoraida, belongs to the community bank "La Primavera" and lives in AA.HH. La Primavera Mza. B in the Moyobamba Province, San Martín state. She is 36 years old, married and the mother of 3 children who are students and still depend on her. Thanks to the support of her parents she studied cosmetology and used these skills to start her small beauty salon business, which is located in her house and is well implemented to serve her clients.

She is currently doing very well since she is known by her friends and neighbors. She performs various types of dyes, hair styles and cuts for ladies, gentlemen and children.

She is asking for a loan of $350, that will invest buying work materials such as lacquer bottles, hair dyes in different colors, powders, shampoos and hair creams. She also provides manicure and pedicure service and buys nail polish in different colors. She is the one who makes the decisions about expenses and profits of her business. She feels as an independent woman, determined, more confident and responsible for the payments of the shares. She thanks Manuela Ramos for providing her support to start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials such as dyes, lacquers, nail polish and shampoo

loans.name: Flor De María

texts.es:
Con gran esfuerzo, en el municipio de Telica en la ciudad de León, la señora Flor de María N. Ruiz se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de zapatos ofertados por ella misma en su localidad donde es visitada por sus clientes a diario.

El motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Ceprodel es para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los zapatos ya que requiere llenar sus estantes para seguir brindando los productos a sus clientes en su localidad.
texts.en:
With great effort in the municipality of Telica of the city of Leon, Flor de María N. Ruiz dedicates herself to attending to her business in the sale of shoes offered in her neighborhood where her clients visit her daily. The reason for which she has sought Ceprodel is to acquire a loan to purchase shoes given that she needs to fill her shelves to continue to offer her products to her neighborhood clients.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes.

loans.name: Reymunda

texts.es:
Con gran entusiasmo en el negocio, la señora Reymunda J. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa en el municipio de Telica en León.

Sus ventas las realiza ambulantemente en diferentes lugares donde lleva siempre sus coloridas bolsas plásticas donde traslada la ropa y cuando llega a un lugar, muestra la ropa a las personas esperando que le compren el producto. Ella necesita el dinero para la compra de la ropa ya que se le está agotando y es por esta razón que hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de la ropa y así ofrecerla para obtener sus ingresos.
texts.en:
With great enthusiasm in her business, Reymunda J. dedicates herself to the sale of clothing in the municipality of Telica in Leon. Her sales are carried out as a street vendor in different locations where she always takes her colorful plastic bags that she uses to carry her clothing; when she arrives at a location, she shows her clothing to people hoping that they will purchase her product. She needs the money to purchase clothing because she is running out, and it is for this reason that she presently has sought Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase clothing that she will offer to obtain her income.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing.

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
La señora Ysabel, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, vive en la Provincia San Martín, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Viuda, tiene 54 años, 07 hijos todos ya independientes y con familia.

Con el fin D. generar sus propios ingresos económicos en su hogar, le nace la idea D. aperturar un pequeño negocio D. venta D. comidas por las mañanas, y por las noches con la venta D. salchipollo, ubicada en su misma casa, con un ambiente muy bien acondicionado. Hoy en día ha ganando mucha experiencia en este tipo D. actividad y se hizo muy conocida y querida entre sus clientes.  

Continúa con el mismo negocio atendiendo a sus clientes que a diario acuden a su local y es ella quien personalmente los conquista con su rica sazón y la amabilidad que la caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,500.00, invertirá comprando arroz, azúcar y papas en sacos, diversas verduras,  huevos y pollos en javas. También comprará algunos utensilios D. cocina, para reemplazar a los que tiene actualmente y así brindar un mejor servicio y atención a sus clientes. 

Ysabel, se siente muy segura y con ganas D. seguir a adelante y segura D. una vida tranquila.  Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir con el cumplimiento D. sus sueños y metas.
texts.en:
Ysabel belongs to the La Mujer Riojana Community Bank. She lives in San Martin. She is a 54 year old widow. She has seven children who are all independent and have their own families. She wanted to generate her own income in her house. She got the idea to open a small business selling meals in the morning and “salchipollo” (a chicken and sausage dish) in the evening. Her business is in her own house, in a well equipped area. She has now gained a lot of experience in this type of business. She is well known and well regarded among her customers. She continues with the same business, tending to her daily customers. She personally won her customers with her delicious seasoning and characteristic kindness. With this loan for 2,500 PEN she will buy rice, sugar, sacks of potatoes, various vegetables, and crates of eggs and chickens. She will also buy some kitchen utensils to replace those that she has now. This way she will offer better service and attention to her customers. Ysabel feels very self-confident, and she has the desire to get ahead and have a peaceful life. She is grateful to the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for contributing to making her dreams and goals come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients (potatoes, rice, sugar, vegetables, crates of chickens and eggs) for her meal preparation and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Toribia Petrona

texts.es:
Toribia M. es una dama digna de imitar debido a que a pesar de sus dificultades economicas, ella ha establecido una pequeña pulpería para lograr mantener a su familia y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.

Ella es una dama muy dinámica y con gran espíritu de superación. Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería como lo son los productos comestibles para ofrecerlos y de esta manera mejorar las condiciones de su pequeño negocio en el municipio de Telica en León.
texts.en:
Toribia Mejia is a very worthy lady because despite of her economic difficulties, she has established a small grocery shop to provide for her family and improve their living conditions. She is a very dynamic lady with a great spirit to excel. She went to Ceprodel to request a loan that will be used in the purchase of grocery products such as edible products to improve her small business in the town of Telica in Leon.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy edible products for her shop

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María Cristina M. se dedica con mucho entusiasmo al negocio de pulpería el cual estableció desde hace 4 años en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León.

Ella se ha caracterizado por ser una dama muy trabajadora y preocupada por su negocio y para ello hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería para comercializarlos en su localidad y así salir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Cristina M. works, with much enthusiasm, at her small grocery store which she started 4 years ago in the municipality of Telica in the city of León. She is very hard-working and concerned about her business; thus she has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to be used to purchase supplies for her store to sell to get ahead in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to sell in grocery store

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, el señor Juan M. se dedica a la actividad de la crianza de cerdos los cuales tiene en su corral y cuando crecen los comercializa con el propósito de generar ingresos.

Hoy en día, el señor Juan requiere del capital financiero para invertir en la crianza de los cerdos como lo es en la compra de alimentos para engorde y cuido de los animales. Por este motivo espera muy confiadamente en Ceprodel para obtener dicho crédito y de esta forma salir adelante en su actividad ganadera.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of León, Mr. Juan M. works raising pigs in his corral. When they reach the right size he sells them to earn money. Nowadays, Juan needs finance capital to invest in the pig raising business by buying feed for the animals to fatten and take care of them. For this he trusts in Ceprodel to obtain the loan and to thus be able to get ahead in his livestock business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Investment in pig raising business

loans.name: Mi Charito Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Mi Charito está ubicada en el distrito D. Huancavelica, L. gente se dedica al comercio, agricultura y ganadería en las zonas altas, esta a 3680msnm. Las 17 socias del Banco comunal solicitan un préstamo D. 6,700 soles.
Maximiliana es conviviente tiene 3 hijos D. 13, 11 y 7, se inició como ayudante D. una señora D. ponche D. maca y aprendió, L. dueña le dejó el negocio ahora Maximiliana lo administra. Solicita un préstamo D. 400 soles para L. compra D. maca, aceite, harina para el preparado D. los ponches, con el tiempo piensa trasladar su negocio a Lima.
Eugenia, es separada tiene un hijo D. 15 años, inició su negocio D. venta D. productos desD. que ingresó a Finca, empezó con 2 caja D. cerveza y gaseosa, solicita un préstamo D. 200 soles para surtir su negocio, le gusta su negocio porque le permite compartir con su hijo, le gustaría hacer arreglos en L. infraestructura D. su negocio pero por ahora esta ahorrando para los estudios D. su hijo.
Juana, es viuda tiene 2 hijos D. 22 y 18 años, trabaja en un Wawa Wasi (cuna que atienD. a bebes) le gusta hacer tejidos a mano como chompas, medias, colchas para poder venderlos, su mayor problema es L. falta D. dinero que no permite que sus hijos estudien, su préstamo D. 200 soles lo va a invertir en L. compra D. materiales para implementar su Wawa Wasi. Su sueño es poner una tienda D. artesanía donD. venda sus tejidos.
texts.en:
The Mi Charito Community Bank is located in the Huancavelica district. The members work in sales, farming, and livestock in the high zones, which are 3,680 meters above sea level. The 17 members of the Community Bank are asking for a loan for 6,700 PEN. Maximiliana is in a common law marriage. She has three children ages 13, 11, and 7. She started as a helper to a woman who maD. “maca” (Peruvian ginseng) punch. The woman left her the business, and now Maximiliana runs it. She is asking for a loan of 400 PEN to buy maca, oil, and flour to prepare the punch. In time she is thinking of moving her business to Lima. Eugenia is separated, and she has a 15 year old son. She started her business of selling products when she joined Finca. She started with two boxes of beer and soft drinks. She is asking for a loan for 200 PEN to stock her business. She likes her business because it allows her to share with her son. She would like to make repairs to the infrastructure of her business. But, for now, she is saving for her son’s education. Juana is a widow with two children ages 22 and 18. She works in Wawa Wasi (a daycare program for low-income families). She likes to make hand knit things like sweaters, socks, and bedspreads to be able to sell them. Her biggest problem is the lack of money, which keeps her children from going to school. She will use the loan for 200 PEN to buy materials to set up her own Wawa Wasi. Her dream is to have a handicrafts store where she can sell her knitting.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand their businesses

loans.name: Marisa

texts.es:
La señora Marisa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Mujer Riojana”, vive en el Departamento de San Martín. Tiene 39 años y es madre soltera de 03 hijos, 02 que aún dependen de ella ya que estudian.

Marisa, decidió vender sus comidas preparadas y pollos  a la brasa, en un local  muy bien acondicionado, ubicado en una parte céntrica de la ciudad de Rioja, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, por la rica sazón que le da a sus preparados, es conocida y tiene muy buena acogida.

En la actualidad continúa con el mismo negocio, y esta muy contenta con su trabajo que realiza día a día, en las mañanas de 10:00 am a 3:00 pm, y en las noches vende sus pollos a partir de las 7:00 pm. Es ella quien personalmente atiende a sus clientes con el carisma que la caracteriza y también con la ayuda de susu hijos.

Con el préstamo de S/ 2,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz, azúcar, aceites en galones, sacos de papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Se siente llena de vida y con ganas de seguir adelante, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida como implementar otro local bien  acondicionado y al mismo tiempo también agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marisa belongs to the “La Mujer Riojana” Communal Bank. She lives in the San Martín Region of Peru. She is 39 years old and a single mother of 3 children, 2 of whom still depend on her and attend school. Marisa decided to sell prepared meals and rotisserie-style chicken at a well-equipped space in the Rioja city centre. She tells us that her sales are good every day, she is well-received and well-known for her delicious flavours. She currently runs the same business and is very happy in the work she does day by day from 10:00am to 3:00pm and at night, selling chicken, from 7:00pm. She personally serves her customers with her characteristic charisma and her children’s help. With this 2000 PEN loan, she plans to purchase ingredients used in the daily preparation of her dishes, like rice, sugar, oil by the gallon, sacks of potatoes, live chickens, vegetables and utensils to stock her business and better serve her customers. She feels full of life and wishes to succeed. She has many dreams and life goals such as setting up another well-fitted location. At the same time, she also thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients (rice, oil, sugar, sacks of potatoes, chickens y others) used to prepare her dishes and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Yolita

texts.es:
La señora Yolita, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros” que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno.Tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, no tiene estudios de educación secundaria completa (1er grado) y vive en el Barrio Miguel Grau.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, el cual lo utilizo para su negocio de compra y venta de golosinas. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 3000.00, para poder invertir en su actual negocio la compra y venta de productos de la zona, papa, quinua, ocas, habas, chuño y otros.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener un criadero de ganado para que engorde y así pueda venderlos. A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Yolita is a member of the “Señor de Los Milagros” communal bank located in the Imicati community in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province in the state of Puno. She is 36 years old, married and has 3 children. She attended school until the first year of high school and currently lives in the Miguel Grau neighborhood. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos organization for 3 years, with an initial loan of 300 Nuevos Soles which she used for her snack food business. Currently, she is requesting a loan of 3,000 Nuevos Soles to invest in her current business, which is the buying and selling of the area's products, such as potatoes, quinoa, oca (Andean tuberous root crop), beans, chuño (freeze-dried potatoes), etc. Her biggest dream is to be able to have a busines raising livestock to be able to sell. She likes saving and the meetings at her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products such as potatoes, quinoa, oca (Andean tuberous root crop), beans, chuño (freeze-dried potatoes), etc.

loans.name: Trabajando Juntos Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal trabajando juntos, esta ubicado en Huancavelica, la actividad principal D. esta zona es el comercio D. productos D. primera necesidad y también se dedican a la agricultura fuera D. la comunidad.
Rosa, tiene 3 hijos D. 20, 18 y 15 soles, es cocinera y tiene una tienda D. restaurante, le va bien, su vida es más ordenada, solicita 500 soles para la compra D. arroz, azúcar, fideos y todo lo necesario para el preparado D. comida. Su sueño es comprar un terreno en lima.
Irene, es conviviente tiene 5 hijos D. entre 25 y 16 años, ella se inicio vendiendo licor ahora venD. comida pues tiene un restaurante, ella misma cocina, el negocio es familiar. Su préstamo D. 400 soles lo invertirá en su negocio para la compra D. abarrotes, su sueño es comprar un terreno mas granD. y adecuado para su negocio pues el que tiene es alquilado.
Sebastiana, es casada, tiene 1 hijo D. 17 años, empezó comprando animales como carnero en pocas cantidades, ahora tiene mayor cantidad y tiene el apoyo D. su esposo, desD. que inicio en finca a incrementado su negocio pues ahora tiene un carro con el cual se moviliza mas rápido, solicita un préstamo D. 600 soles para la compra D. animales como alpacas y carneros y venderá repartiéndolo en los mercados, su sueño es terminar D. pagar su carro pues es una herramienta que le permite movilizar su mercadería.
texts.en:
The community bank Trabajando Juntos (Working Together), is located in Huancavelica. The principal activity in this area is the business of selling basic needs products and farming outsiD. of the community. Rosa, has 3 children, 20, 18 and 15 years old. She is a cook and owns a restaurant. It is going well for her, her life is more organized. She requests a loan of 500 soles for the purchase of rice, sugar, noodles and other products needed for the productions of meals. Her dream is to buy land in Lima. Irene lives with her spouse and has 5 children between 25 and 16 years of age. She started by selling liquor and now sells food because she owns a restaurant. She makes the meals herself and it is a family style restaurant. She will invest her loan of 400 soles in her business, in the purchase of groceries. Her dream is to buy a larger piece of land more adequate for her business, a space for which she now rents. Sebastiana is married and has 1 son of 17 years of age. She started out buying animals, such as sheep, in small quantities. She now has larger quantities and the help of her husband. She has grown her business since she has a farm and now has a vehicle which allows her to get around faster. She is requesting a loan of 600 soles for the purchase of animals such as alpacas and sheep, which she will sell in the markets. Her dream is to finish paying off her vehicle which gives her the means to transport her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in their businesses

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
La señora Agustina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Semillas del Futuro” el cual esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de  Puno, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 54 años, es madre soltera y tiene 05 hijos (solo dos a su cargo) presenta estudios de secundaria completa y vive en el Barrio Huajsapata.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 para su negocio de compra y venta de frutas. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 800.00 para poder invertir en su actual negocio y así poder comprar mas productos como: naranjas, plátanos, papayas, mandarinas, uvas y otros.

A ella le gustan las facilidades de pago y las reuniones de su Banco Comunal. Su mayor sueño es poner una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Augustina belongs to the Semillas del Futuro (Seeds of the Future) Communal Bank, which is located in the Puno District, Puno Province. She is a 54 year old single mother of five (only two of whom are still at home) who completed her high school education and lives in Huajsapata area. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for nearly two years, investing an initial loan of 300 PEN into her fruit and vegetable business.
