She is currently seeking a loan of 800 PEN to invest in buying more produce for her business, such as oranges, bananas, papayas, mandarins, grapes etc. She likes her Communal Bank's easy payment terms and meetings. Her greatest aspiration is to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Stilgoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruits such as oranges, bananas, papayas, mandarins, grapes etc.

loans.name: Las Forjadoras De Palca Group

texts.es:
El Bancomunal Forjadores D. Palca, esta ubicado en L. comunidad D. Palca en el departamento D. Huancavelica, L. comunidad esta rodeada D. cerros, ríos, plantaciones D. eucalipto, chacras, tienen una piscigranja y zonas turística D. aguas termales. L. actividad principal es L. agricultura, artesanía, tejidos en textileria, crianza D. cuy.
Norma, es casada, tiene 5 hijos D. 16, 13, 10, 5 y 2 años, su negocio es D. Internet, antes usaba proyectores para generar cine, ahora tiene intenert y una pequeña tienda D. abarrotes. Su objetivo es ser independiente por ello esta ahorrando, por ahora su esposo esta trabaja alejado D. L. comunidad, solicita un préstamo D. 200 soles para comprar algunos accesorios D. sus computadoras, su sueño es que su negocio crezca y estar al lado D. su esposo.
Donata, es viuda tiene 1 hijo D. 24 años, por necesidad se dedico a vender pescado frito, al inicio se avergonzaba, pues desD. que falleció su esposo tuvo que aprender el negocio, aprendió a luchar en L. vida, desD. que inicio en FINCA le enseñaron a ahorrar y ser triunfadora, solicita un préstamo D. 400 para comprarse una cocina para llevar su negocio a L. plaza D. palca, su sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales.
Alejandrina, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos D. 10 y 8 años, es panadera, en Lima tenia su panadería, cuando regreso a su pueblo D. Palca tuvo que reabrir su tienda que su madre le dejo, tiene a su esposo lisiado por un accidente, poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio, solicita un préstamo D. 600 para comprar verduras para mejorar su tienda, su sueño es tener una panadería granD..
texts.en:
The communal bank “Forjadores D. Palca" is in Palca in the department of Huancavelica. Hills, rivers, eucalyptus plantations, and ponds surround the community. There is also a fish farm and it's considered a tourist area because of the hot springs. People mostly work in farming, craft making, weaving, and raising guinea pigs. Norma is married and has five children ages: 16, 13, 10, 5 and 2. She used to show movies with a projector, but now has an Internet shop and a small grocery store. She wants to be independent, so she is saving money. At the moment, her husband is working away from home so she is asking for a loan of 200 soles to buy some computer accessories. She dreams of growing her business and of being near her husband. Donata is a widow who has a 24 year old son. She started to sell fried fish out of necessity. At first she felt ashamed because since her husband died she had to learn how to do business and make her own way through life. Since she has been with FINCA, she has learned how to save and be a winner. She is asking for a loan of 400 soles to buy a stove so she can locate her business in the Palca plaza. She hopes for her children to be professionals. Alejandra lives with her partner and has two children ages: 10 and 8. She is a baker and used to have a bakery in Lima. When she returned to her hometown of Palca, she had to reopen the shop her mother left her. Bit by bit she has been improving her shop. Her husband is disabled from an accident. She is asking for a loan of 600 to buy vegetables to improve her store. Her dream is to have a large bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: invertir en sus negocios

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
La señora Sabina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios”, del distrito de Lampa Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 34 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el Barrio Central en Jr. Antonio Barrionuevo Nº 577 Lampa.

Esta iniciando su trabajo con el movimiento Manuela Ramos con un préstamo inicial de S/. 200.00 para la compra de lana para hacer tapetes y colchas de distintos modelos.

Su mayor sueño es poder  educar a sus hijos, le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de su banco comunal, y agradece la oportunidad que les dan para poder hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Sabina is a member of the Community Bank "San Juan de Dios", originally from the district of Lampa Provincia in San Roman, Puno. She is 34 years old, she is a single Mom to 4 children, and she completed her high school education. She lives at 577 Lampa of Barrio Central, Antonio Barrionuevo.

She has her business with the help of Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner). With the loan of S/.200 she will purchase wool to weave rugs and blankets in different designs.

Her greatest dream is to be able to send her kids to school. She loves dealing with finances and attending meetings at the Community Bank, and she is grateful for the opportunity to improve her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool to weave rugs and blankets.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
La señora Sofía, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios”, del distrito de Lampa Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno; Tiene 52 años, es madre de 7 hijos (4 de ellos ya independientes y 3 viven con ella), es conviviente y posee estudios de primaria completa. Vive en el Barrio Central en Jr. Antonio Barrionuevo Nº 464 Lampa.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años, inició su trabajo con un préstamo de S/. 300.00, permitiéndole agregar su capital para su funeraria.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 800.00, lo cual le permitirá comprar mas ataúdes de diferentes precios para ofrecer a más clientes.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, las orientaciones de las promotoras y la puntualidad de  sus compañeras. Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sofia is a member of the Community Bank "San Juan de Dios" in the district of Lampa Provincia in San Roman, Puno. She is 52 years old and she is mother to 7 children (4 are independent, and 3 are still live with her). She lives with her common-law husband, and she completed primary school. She lives at 464 Lampa in Barrio Central of Antonio Barrionuevo.

She has been a member of Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) for 2 years. She started out with a loan of s/.300, having used it as working capital for her funeral home.

She is requesting a loan of s/.800, which will be invested in the purchase of caskets to offer her clients a variety.

She loves attending the meetings, orientation sessions put on by the Community Bank, and appreciates her colleagues punctuality. Her greatest dream is to expand her business.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of caskets.

loans.name: Juana Tarcila

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82745&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Juana continua con su restaurant D. venta D. comida criolla y arequipeña que realiza en su casa, antes vendía solo los fines D. semana, ahora venD. todos los días, sus clientela ha aumentado y le está yendo bien.
Juana aprendió en FINCA como administrar su negocio y su dinero, Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para mandar hacer una reja D. fierro en su casa por protección, le han querido robar en dos ocasiones y también comprar víveres para su restaurante.
texts.en:
First loan

Juana carries on with her restaurant selling traditional home-maD. food from the region (criolla and arequipeña). She used to only sell during the weekends but now she sells daily given that her client base has been improving and things have gone her way.

Through Finca (Kiva Field Partner), Juana learned how to administer her business and how to manage her money. Juana requires a loan of 1200 soles to have a wrought-iron fence installed for her house for protection. She has been victim of theft twice. She would also like to purchase a plot of land to build a restaurant.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install a wrought iron fence in her house for protection.

loans.name: Lidia Maria

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Bancomunal San Juan.
Lidia es casada tiene 57 años, cinco Hijos D. todos mayores e independiente.
Lidia empezó poco  apoco dando servicios, con una maquina, conforme ahorra compraba otra maquina, actualmente tiene mas D. diez maquinas ella da servicio D. confección a las empresas que exportan prendas D. vestir.  
DesD. que esta en Finca gracias a los prestamos ha podido capitalizarse, aprendió a invertir y ahorrar.
Lidia necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles, para  cambiar D. calamina y poner piso D. loseta.     
El sueño D. Lidia es exportar prendas D. vestir.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the Community Bank San Juan.

Lidia is married, she is 57 years old, and she has 5 grown children.

Lidia started out providing tailoring services, at first with only one sewing machine. When she saved enough money she purchase additional sewing machines, and now she has more than ten sewing machines that are used to make clothing for export.

Since she has been with Finca (Kiva Field Parnter) she has been able to capitalize on the loans, learning along the way how to invest and how to save money.

Lidia requires a loan in the amount of 1000 soles to remodel her flooring and install tiles.

Lidia's dream is to become a clothing exporter.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To remodel the flooring and install tiles

loans.name: Rosa Susana

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82744&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Rosa  estudio repostería y aprendió hacer dulces en su colegio  los cuales  salían a vender a los salones, hasta que tuvo la  oportunidad de trabajar en el mismo colegio que había estudiado. el administrador del colegio le dice  para poner un cafetín y ella acepto, Rosa trabaja en el cafetín con la ayuda de su mamá, con el tiempo se especializo en  repostería. 
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió como administrar un negocio,
Rosa solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de golosinas para  su cafetería.
El sueño de Rosa es tener su propio local y poner una restaurante y  dulcería
texts.en:
Rosa has studied the making of pastries and learned to make sweets in the school. They would sell them in the shops. She was able to get the opportunity to work in the same school where she had studied. The school administrator suggested that she open a small coffee shop and she accepted. Rosa works in the coffee shop with the help of her mother and in time she has specialized in pastries. Since she has been with Finca she has learned how to run her business. Rosa is requesting a loan of 1000 soles for the purchase of candies for her coffee shop. Rosa dreams of having her own business location and be able to open a restaurant and a sweets shop.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sweets for her business

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es: Maritza de 49 años de edad, vive en union libre con el Sr. Rafael Soza, durante su relacion no procrearon hijos, adoptaron una niña la cual tiene 12 años y esta cursando el 1er año de secundaria, su compañero de vida tiene un negocio propio en la casa un bar llamado El Recreo, este es administrado por el y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Maritza trabaja como responsable de enfermeria en el Centro de Salud del Coral del MINSA desde hace 10 años con horario de lunes a viernes, el fin de semana ayuda en el negocio. Está solicitando su 5to credito para utilizarlo en la reparacion del techo de su casa, el cual se encuentra en mal estado, y con el invierno no quiere que su familia, ni los clientes se mojen.  Se caracteriza por ser una persona responsable en el pago de sus creditos, y a pesar de la constante rotacion en su trabajo siempre se ha observado un excelente record crediticio.
texts.en:
Maritza is 49 years old and lives with her partner, Mr. Rafael Soza. During their relationship the have not had any children, and they adopted a girl who is now 12 years old and is in her first year of junior high school. Her life partner has his own business, a bar called El Recreo, that he administers and helps her with the home expenses. Maritza has been working as head of infirmary in MINSA's Coral Health Center for the past 10 years from Monday to Friday, and on weekends she helps him with the business. She is asking for her 5th credit to be used for the repair of her roof, which is in a bad state, and with the upcoming winter she does not want her family or her customers to get wet. She is known to pay her loans responsibly, and despite her constant work rotation she has always had a good credit record.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roof repair

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.es:
La señora Presentación, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios”, del distrito de Lampa Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 45 años, es casada y madre de 3 hijos, posee estudios de primaria completa. Vive en el Barrio Central.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 2 años, inició su trabajo con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cuál le permitió comprar abarrotes para su negocio.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 700.00, el cuál le permitirá comprar arroz, aceite, leche, fideos, atunes, jugos, gaseosas y otros para surtir su tienda.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, las charlas y los ahorros que hace su banco comunal y su mayor sueño es poder surtir bien su tienda para luego llevar sus productos a las ferias de la zona.
texts.en:
Mrs. Presentacion is a member of the community bank "San Juan de Dios", of the Lampa district of the San Roman province, department of Puno. She is 45 years old, married and mother of 3 children. She has completed primary school. She lives in the Barrio Central. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for the last 2 years. She started her work with a loan of 500 soles, which allowed her to buy groceries for her business. She is currently requesting a loan of 700 soles, which will allow her to buy rice, oil, milk, pasta, tuna, juices, sodas and other items to stock her store. She likes the meetings, talks and savings at her community bank. Her major dream is to be able to stock her store well and be able to take her products to the markets in the area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products such as oil, milk, pasta, tuna, juices sodas and others.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82743&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Maria trabajar con su  esposo tienen un  taller de carpintería haciendo puertas y las venden en la parada.
Desde que esta en Finca  aprendió a organizarse, ha crecido con los prestamos.
Maria necesita  un préstamo de Finca de 1000 soles, para la compra de madera, tripley,  pegamento. 
El sueño de Maria  es tener  taller en un primer piso con vista  a la calle, y tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
Maria works with her husband. They have a carpentry shop where they make doors which they sell at the market. Since she is with Finca she has learned to get organized and has progressed with the loans that she has obtained. Maria needs a loan from Finca of 1000 soles for the purchase of wood, Tripley (amazonian wood), adhesives. Maria dreams of having a shop on the first floor with a view of the street, and of increasing her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood, Tripley and adhesives

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
La socia JANETT, es originaría de Calca, ella vive en el sector de Huarán, ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas, posee una zona bastante cálida y rica en productos.

Nuestra socia tiene 37 años, es conviviente y tienen 2 hijos de (7 Y 3) años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura, nuestra socia exporta granos de maíz fuera del Perú, ella también tiene un abarrotes en el que vende arroz, azúcar, aceite, harinas, leche, entre otros productos, la socia desea el préstamo en razón de que deberá preparar su terreno y sembrar para la nueva cosecha de maíz.

La socia se encuentra muy agradecida con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete en cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Janett is a native of Calca. She lives in the Huarán sector, which is located in the heart of the sacred valley of the Incas. Her zone is very warm and rich in products. She is 37, in a common law marriage, and has two children ages seven and two. She alternates her work between home and agriculture. She exports corn. She also has a grocery where she sells rice, sugar, oil, flour, and milk, among other things. She needs a loan because she needs to prepare her land and plant for the new corn harvest. She is very grateful for the loan, and she promises to repay her debt in the agreed upon time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds and stock her grocery store

loans.name: Juana Angelica

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82750&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Juana se dedica al venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, y venta de lencería por catalogo. Ella tiene una casa propia  y se dedica  alquilar la parte de delante de su casa para tienda y dos habitaciones
Desde que esta en Finca los prestamos han ayudado mucho para cumplir  lo que ella se esta proponiendo.
Juana  necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, terminar de ampliar un para alquilarlo.
Su sueño es seguir construyendo su casa para seguir alquilando, y tener otro negocio.
texts.en:
Juana sells beauty products and lingerie through catalogs. She owns her own house and rents the front part for a store and two rooms. Since she has joined Finca, the loans have been of great help to her in carrying out what she set out to do. Juana needs a loan of 1600 soles to complete an addition which she will rent out. Her dream is continue building her house and renting the space, and also have another business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish expanding her house.

loans.name: Betty Amelia

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82752&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Betty es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Betty tiene un negocio de cabina de locutorio y alquila un local que tiene 
Desde que comenzó en Finca, se siente Segura,  por que puede seguir solicitando prestamos, le sirven para su negocio y para dar educación a su hijo.
Betty  necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para el arreglo del local y asegurar su local por que esta muy inseguro. 
El sueño es adquirir otra propiedad y alquilarlo y tener un centro de computo e investigación.
texts.en:
First Kiva loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82752&_tpos=7&_tpg=1 Betty is a member of the San Juan Village Bank. She has a call center and also rents out a space she owns. Ever since she started taking out loans from Finca, Betty has felt safe, because she knows she can continue to take out loans that help her run her business and pay for her son's education. Betty needs a loan of 1600 soles to renovate and secure the space she rents out, since it is currently very insecure. Her dream is to acquire another property to rent out and to have her own computing/research center.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate and secure rental property

loans.name: Salome Gabriela

texts.es:
Primer préstamo: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82755&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Salome es socia del Bancomunal San Juan
Salome no tiene hijos ha estudiado cosmiatria, trabaja cuando la llaman pero ella también vende  por catalogo lencería colombiana. 
Desde que esta en Finca aprendió ahorrar, y a ser responsable en todo. 
Salome necesita un préstamo de 800 soles, para invertirlos en compra-venta de ropa interior por catalogo. 
El  sueño  de Salome es poner un spa de belleza.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=82755&_tpos=... Salome is a member of the San Juan Community Bank. Salome does not have children. She has studied cosmetology. She works when called, but she also sells Columbian lingerie by catalog. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to save and to be responsible in everything. Salome needs a loan for 800 PEN to buy and sell underwear by catalog. Salome’s dream is to have a beauty spa.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy-sell underwear by catalog

loans.name: Victoria Bonifacia's Group

texts.es:
La señora Bonifacia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “San Juan de Dios”, del distrito de Lampa Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 47 años, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo, posee estudios de secundaria completa. Vive en el Barrio Unión Barrio Abajo en Jr. Espinar Nº 123 Lampa.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 1 año, inició su trabajo con un préstamo de S/. 500.00 el cuál le permitió comprar gaseosas para su tienda.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 800.00, el cuál le permitirá incrementar su negocio comprando una gran cantidad de gaseosas de diversas marcas para luego venderlas al por mayor. 

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para agrandar su negocio y convertirse en una distribuidora.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la forma de pago de su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Bonifacio is a member of the San Juan de Dios Community Bank in the Lampa district, San Román province, Puno department. She is a 47 year old single mother with one son. She has a high school education. She lives in the Barrio Unión Barrio Abajo on Jr. Espinar Nº 123 Lampa. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for almost one year. She started her work with a loan for 500 PEN, which allowed her to buy soft drinks for her store. She currently needs a loan for 800 PEN, which will allow her to expand her business by purchasing a large quantity of various brands of soft drinks. Later, she will sell them wholesale. Her biggest dream is to keep working to expand her business and convert it into a distributorship. She likes the savings and the form of payment of her Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different brands of soft drinks

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia ANTONIETA, es originaría de la provincia de Calca, ella vive en el sector denominado Huarán, ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas, poseedores de una zona bastante cálida y rica en productos, situado a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 30 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de (10, 4) años, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la ganadería, nuestra socia se dedica al engorde y venta del mismo, también a los derivados de los productos lácteos, ella desea el préstamo para poder reinvertir en el mismo negocio y así continuar con su producción para poder mejorar su calidad de vida y el de toda sus familia. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete en cumplir con el pago total de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Antonieta is from the province of Calca. She lives in an area known as Huarán, in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, a warm, fertile region an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. This member is 30 years old, and married with two children, 10 and 4 years old. In addition to her domestic tasks, she also raises cattle, fattening them for sale, and produces dairy products. She is requesting this loan to invest it in her business and maintain production in order to improve her family's quality of life. She appreciates and is grateful for the support offered to her by these institutions and is committed to paying off all of her loan in the period agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
La señora Beatriz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, de la ciudad de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 40 años de edad, es separada y madre de 01 hijo, tiene estudios de educación superior incompleta (Informática), vive en el barrio La Capilla Jr. Andrés Avelino Cáceres Nº 550.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años, es fundadora del Banco Comunal, inició su trabajo con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, con el cuál compró golosinas como: caramelos, galletas, chocolates, yogurts y otros para venderlos en su kiosco.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 900.00, para poder invertir en su negocio de venta de golosinas, con el que comprara chocolates, galletas, caramelos, jugos, yogurts y gaseosas, además nos cuenta que comprara libro para su hijo que esta estudiando.

Su mayor sueño es poder ver profesional a su hijo, luego quiere comprar un terreno donde construirá su casita.

A ella le gustan las reuniones, las capacitaciones y los campeonatos que realiza su Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Beatriz is a member of the Cristo Blanco Village Bank in the city of Juliaca, in San Román Province of the Department of Puno. She is 40 years old, separated, and has one son. She has a partially completed college education in Computer Science, and lives in the La Capilla neighborhood. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for the past seven years, and helped found her village bank. She used her very first loan of 300 soles to buy sweets like hard candies, cookies, chocolate, yogurt, and other items to sell at her kiosk. She is currently requesting a loan of 900 soles to invest in her candy selling business. She plans to buy chocolate, cookies, candies, juices, yogurt and soft drinks. She will also use part of the loan to buy books for her school-age son. Her greatest dream is that her son will become a working professional someday. She also wants to buy a plot of land so that she can build her own house. She enjoys her village bank's meetings, training sessions, and competitions.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy candies, cookies, chocolate and yogurt

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, de la ciudad de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 29 años, es conviviente y madre de 02 hijos, posee estudios de educación secundaria completa, vive en el Barrio Manco Cápac Jr. Ayaviri Nº 563.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años, es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, con el que compró artefactos eléctricos.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1500.00, para poder invertir en la compra de artefactos eléctricos, la Sra. Elena también tiene un taller de carpintería donde ella misma trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo.

Su mayor sueño es comprarse una casita y educar a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, las charlas, el compartir con sus compañeras y dice que ya se acostumbro a las reuniones donde tiene amigas con las que comparten.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Cristo Blanco Village Bank in the city of Juliaca, in San Roman Province of the Department of Puno. She is 29 years old and lives with her common-law husband and their two children. She completed her high school education, and lives in the Manco Capac neighborhood. Elena has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for seven years, and helped found the village bank she is a member of. She started out with a loan of 300 soles, which she used to buy household appliances. She is currently requesting a loan of 1500 soles to buy electrical appliances. Elena also has a carpentry workshop, where she and her husband both work. Her greatest dreams are to buy a home of her own and to educate her children. Her favorite parts about her village bank are the opportunity to save, the educational sessions and the chance to share with her fellow village bank members. She says that she is used to the routine of having group meetings by now, and enjoys the opportunity to spend time with her friends.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy electrical appliances

loans.name: Gladys Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia Gladys, es originaría de Huarán en la provincia de Calca, ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas, poseedores de una zona bastante cálida y rica en productos, situado a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

Nuestra socia tiene 45 años de edad y es soltera tiene 2 hijos  (18,10) años ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con la agricultura específicamente ella compra y vende granos (maíz, habas, cebada, trigo),  ella solicita el préstamo para poder comprar semillas y sembrarlas y con otra parte comprar más granos para vender en la época baja de producción.

La socia esta agradecida con el préstamo debido a que en la zona no se cuenta con banca financiera y lo cual a ella le permite realizar sus proyectos.
texts.en:
Gladys is from Huarán in the province of Calca, located in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, a warm, fertile region an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. This member is 45 years old and unmarried. She has two children, 18 and 10 years of age. In addition to her domestic activities, she works in agriculture, buying and selling grains such as corn, beans, barley, and wheat. She is requesting the loan to buy and plant seeds, and also buy other seeds to sell outside of the growing season. She is grateful for the loan, since the region has no banks and the loan enables her to bring her projects to fruition.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell grain

loans.name: Yeni Elizabeth

texts.es:
La socia YENI, es originaría de Huarán en la provincia de Calca, ubicado en pleno corazón del valle sagrado de los incas, poseedores de una zona bastante cálida y rica en productos, situado a 1 hora y 20 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco.

La socia tiene 52 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos de (29, 22, 8 años), la socia es docente de profesión, pero en sus horas libres comparte la atención junto a su esposo de una tienda abarrotes, la cual desean ampliarla y poner en un espacio una ferretería, debido a que, en la zona no existe alguna ferretería, y los vecinos tiene que viajar hasta Calca y muchas veces al mismo Cusco en busca de algunas herramientas, la socia solicita el préstamo para poder realizar su proyecto.

Nuestra socia se encuentra muy agradecida con el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el tiempo establecido.
texts.en:
Yeni is from Huarán in the province of Calca, located in the heart of the Sacred Valley of the Incas, a warm, fertile region an hour and 20 minutes from the city of Cusco. This member is 52 years old. She is married and has three children, 29, 22, and 8 years old. She works as a teacher, but in her free time also helps her husband look after a grocery store. They hope to expand the shop and install a hardware store, since there is none in the area and people have to travel to Calca and often even to Cusco in search of tools. She is requesting the loan in order to bring this project to fruition. This member is very grateful for the support offered to her by these institutions and is committed to paying off all of her debt in the period agreed upon.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Rosenberg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand grocery store in order to set up a hardware store

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es:
La señora Marleny, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco”, de la ciudad de Juliaca, Provincia de San Román, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 33 años, es conviviente y madre de 02 hijos, tiene estudios de educación superior (Profesora de educaron primaria), vive en el Barrio Tupac Amaru Nº 604.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 7 años ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal e inicio su trabajo con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, con el cuál compró artefactos.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio de compra y venta de artefactos eléctricos. 

Su mayor sueño es comprar un terreno y poder construir su casa, luego quiere comprar un carro para que pueda llevar su negocio a diferentes ferias de la zona en general.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, sobre todo las reuniones de su banco comunal ya que ha logrado hacer nuevas amistades.
texts.en:
Marleny belongs to the “Cristo Blanco” Communal Bank in the city of Juliaca, in San Román Province, in the Puno Region of Peru. She is 33 years old, lives with her partner and is a mother of 2 children. She has completed post-secondary studies (in primary school education) and lives in the Tupac Amaru neighbourhood at Nº 604.
She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 7 years and is a founding member of her communal bank. She started her business with an initial loan of 300 PEN, which she used to purchase electronic devices.
She is now requesting a 1500 PEN loan to invest in her business of buying and selling electronics.
Her greatest wish is to purchase land and to build a house. In the future she would like to buy a car so that she can bring her business to the different markets in the general area.
She likes the savings she makes through her communal bank, and above all, their meetings because she has made new friendships.

Translated from Spanish by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electronics

loans.name: Mery Marleni

texts.es:
La señora Mery, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Niño Jesús de Praga” ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 25 años, es soltera y posee estudios de educación superior (técnico en prótesis dental) y vive en el Barrio Santa Bárbara Nº 306.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 para la compra de CDS, ella tiene diferentes negocios de acuerdo a la época. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 800.00, para poder invertir en su actual negocio que es la compra y venta de lanas de diferentes colores.

Su deseo es poder ejercer su profesión.

A ella le gusta la solidaridad de sus compañeras y las importantes charlas que su banco comunal realiza para llevar a adelante el negocio de las mujeres.
texts.en:
Señora Mery belongs to the Niño Jesús de Praga (Baby Jesus of Prague) Communal Bank located in the Yunguyo District, Chuchito Province, Department of Puno. She is 25 years old, single, and has an upper level education as a dental prosthetics technician. She lives in the Santa Bárbara neighborhood. Señora Mery has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for three years now. With her first loan of 300 Sols, she bought CD's. She has had different businesses at various times. She is currently seeking a loan of 800 Sols so she can invest in her current business which is buying and selling wool of different colors. Her dream is to be able to practice her profession. She likes the solidarity of her partners and the important discussions that her communal bank provides to keep the women's businesses moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool of different colors

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
La señora Tomasa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros” que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos, posee estudios de educación primaria incompleta (2do grado), y vive en la Av. Ejercito  Nº 175.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 3 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, el cuál lo utilizo para su negocio de carpintería. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1000.00, para poder invertir en la preparación de comidas para fiestas, ceviche al paso en la plaza y en las ferias de Yunguyo.

Su mayor sueño es poder comprarse su casita.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, y las charlas que realiza su Banco comunal.
texts.en:
Señora Tomasa belongs to the Señor de Los Milagros Communal Bank located in the Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 33 years old, married and has 3 children. She has an incomplete primary (second grade) education and lives on Ejercito Avenue. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for three years now. Her first loan of 300 Sols was used for her carpentry business. Currently she is seek a loan of 1,000 Sols to invest in the preparation of meals, ceviche "to go", in the plaza and for the festivals in Yunguyo. Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1000.00, para poder invertir en la preparación de comidas para fiestas, ceviche al paso en la plaza y en las ferias de Yunguyo. Her greatest dream is to be able to buy herself a little house. She likes the savings and the discussions that her Communal Bank provides.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies for the preparation of meals for festivals.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa tiene 61 años, es una mujer noble, D. carácter sencillo y felizmente casada. Tiene 5 hijos, D. los cuales ahora sólo vive con uno D. ellos que tiene 20 años. DesD. hace más D. 42 años se dedica al cultivo y al cuidado D. sus plantas cafetaleras, las cuales le han resultado muy rentables, por ello les brinda toda su atención y dedicación. Luisa tiene el apoyo D. su esposo y D. su hijo para las tareas agrícolas, por lo que trabaja con complacencia. Entre los meses D. mayo a agosto la cosecha D. sus productos le permite captar dinero suficiente para cubrir la educación D. sus hijos. Años pasados realizaba sus siembras sin abonarlas, pero últimamente no le está dando buen resultado, por lo que ahora viene abonando sus tierras constantemente con la finalidad D. mejorar su producción y D. ese modo cubrir holgadamente la educación D. su hijo. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los ciclos anteriores demostró responsabilidad en  sus cuotas, sometiéndose ahora a la misma responsabilidad. En las pocas veces que interviene durante las reuniones D. su banco comunal, lo hace con opiniones espontáneas y muy salomónicas, que muchas veces dejan sorprendidos a sus compañeros. El dinero que viene solicitando lo invertirá en la compra del fertilizante denominado “súper fosfato” para el abonado D. sus cultivos D. café.
texts.en:
Luisa is 61 years old. She is a noble lady with an uncomplicated character and is happily married. She has 5 children, only one of whom she now lives with and who is 20 years old. For more than 42 years she has cultivated and cared for coffee plants that have been very profitable because she lavishes all of her care and attention upon them. Luisa’s husband and son help her with her farming chores so she does not have to worry about the work not being completed. Between the months of May and August, her coffee harvest earns her enough money to pay for her children’s education. In past years she sowed her seeds without fertilizer, but in the end this did not proviD. her with a good result. Consequently she now regularly applies fertiliser to her land and as a result increases her production and can comfortably cover the costs of her son’s education. This is her fifth loan with MFP. During the previous loan periods she demonstrated a responsibility in making her repayments and will be equally responsible in this one. During the few occasions that she was involved in the community bank meetings, her spontaneous and even-handed opinions often surprised her companions. The money that she is asking for will be used to buy a fertiliser called “Super Phosphate” for use on her coffee crops.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertiliser

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: Filemón tiene 66 años, enviudó hace muchos años quedándose a cargo de sus 3 hijos, de los cuales actualmente, sólo el menor vive en su casa acompañándolo y apoyándolo en las labores agrícolas. Durante toda su vida ha se ha dedicado a la siembra y venta de café, piña y plátanos. Cada vez que inicia sus labores contempla atentamente sus plantas, donde a veces suele detectar los males a tiempo; de ello dependerá qué funguicidas usará para evitar que las plagas se extiendan y logre cosechar productos de primera calidad, los cuales comercializa en los diversos mercados, con lo que cubre la alimentación, la educación de su hijo y los gastos para sus siembras. Los anhelos de Filemón son de incrementar su producción e ingresos económicos; por ello, para el próximo año quiere renovar sus chacras y seguir cultivando en las que tiene para generar las ganancias que comparte con su hijo. Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP, durantes los créditos anteriores se ha preocupado de pagar puntualmente y asimismo, durantes estos años, se ha caracterizado por llegar a la hora exacta a sus reuniones de banco comunal apoyando en sus funciones a sus compañeros integrantes de la junta directiva. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra varios sacos de nitrato (abono) para sus tierras de plantas cafetaleras.
texts.en:
Filemon is 66 years old. Widowed many years ago he has taken care of his 3 children, only the youngest of whom now lives with him at home, accompanying him and helping in his farming labours. His whole life he has grown and sold coffee, pineapples and bananas. Each time he begins work he carefully examines his plants, where he might sometimes find some bad ones so he must rely on the use of fungicides to prevent pests from spreading and to be able to achieve a high quality harvest, which he can sell in the various markets. This pays for his food, his son’s education and covers the expenses of his crops. Filemon’s wish is to increase his production and his income so next year he wants to renovate his plantations and continue his work to generate earnings that he shares with his son. This is his fifth loan with MFP, during his previous loans he made sure to make the repayments on time. Also, during this time he was renowned for arriving on time to community bank meetings, by carrying out his duties he helped his companions who are members of the board. The money he is requesting will buy several bags of nitrate (fertiliser) for his coffee plants.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertiliser

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente y no tiene hijos, posee estudios de educación primaria incompleta (2do grado), y vive en el Barrio Simón Bolívar.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace mas de un año, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00, para su negocio de venta de detergentes. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 500.00, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, la compra y venta de detergentes, ella comprara, champús, detergentes de todo tipo, papel higiénico, escobillas de zapatos, pasta dental y otros, los cuales son vendidos en su puesto del mercado de Yunguyo.

Su mayor sueño es poder comprarse su casita.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, y las charlas que su banmco comunal realiza.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sonia belongs to the Community Bank “Señor de Los Milagros” which is situated in the Imicati Community, Yunguyo district, Chucuito Province in the Department of Puno. She is 24 years old, lives with her partner and does not have any children. She partially completed her primary education (up to second grade) and lives in the Simon Bolivar neighbourhood.

She has been working with the Manuela Ramos organisation for over a year, with an initial loan of 300 Peruvian soles for her business selling detergent.

She is now requesting a loan of 500 soles so that she might invest in her existing business, buying and selling detergent. She will buy shampoo, all types of detergent, toilet paper, shoe brushes, toothpase and other things that are sold from her stall at the Yunguyo market.

Her biggest dream is to buy her own little house.

She enjoys the savings and the talks provided by her community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Lara Francis, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shampoo, detergent, toilet paper, shoe brushes, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: Angélica

texts.es: Angélica tiene 49 años, es una madre muy trabajadora, está casada con el padre de sus 7 hijos y viven en su casa propia. Cuando era joven no le gustaba el cultivo de la tierra, pero desde que se enamoró y se casó con un agricultor su trabajo se tornó netamente al labrado de esta, sembrando plátanos, piñas y mayormente café. Cuando aun sus hijos eran muy pequeños, junto a su esposo doblegaban esfuerzos, pero ahora que ya han crecido, los ayudan realizando una faena y de ese modo aminoran sus días en la chacra. Entonces se organizan para la comercialización del café en los diversos mercados en busca de un buen precio, esta dinámica les permite captar mayores ingresos para su hogar, puesto que mientras que ellos están vendiendo sus productos, sus hijos están trabajando en sus tierras. Con las ganancias acumuladas pueden cubrir los gastos de educación; tanto del colegio de los menores, como el instituto técnico de los mayores que están en otras ciudades fuera de su pueblo. Debido a estos logros que le brinda la agricultura Angélica aprendió a amar y cuidar con mucho cariño a cada una de sus plantas. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, durante los 4 periodos anteriores trabajó con mucha responsabilidad, asimismo en sus reuniones de grupo le tienen mucho respeto y consideración, debido a su puntualidad y porque es una mujer muy sensible ante los problemas de sus compañeros de banco comunal. El dinero solicitado planea utilizarlo en la compra de 18 sacos de nitrato (abono), en busca de mejores resultados en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
Angélica is 49 years old and a hard-working mother. She's married and she and her husband have seven children. They own their home. When Angélica was young she didn't care for farming, but later on she began to love it and she married a farmer. Her work soon turned to planting plantains, pineapples, and primarily coffee. When her children were very small, she and her husband redoubled their efforts. But now that they've grown, the children help Angélica and her husband with the work and subsequently reduce the number of days spent in the fields. The family organized coffee sales in various markets in search of a good price. This dynamic allows them to increase the earnings for their household, because while Angélica and her husband are selling, their children are working the land. With their earnings they can cover the cost of the children's education, including high school for the younger children and technical university tuition for the older children who live in other cities. Given these achievements in the agriculture sector, Angélica learned to love it and care for her crops. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and during her last four loan cycles she worked very responsibly. Angélica attended group meetings respectfully and punctually, because she's a sensible woman who addresses the problems of her colleagues in the community bank. This loan will be used to buy 18 sacs of nitrate fertilizer, to achieve the best possible coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Claudio

texts.es: Un hombre muy trabajador es Claudio, tiene 40 años, vive con su pareja a quien ama mucho por ser la madre de sus 2 hijos, quienes son el motivo de su orgullo. Por ellos se esforzó en hacer su casa propia para que vivan cómodamente. El cultivo de sus plantas es la única actividad económica que conoce, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde pequeño junto a sus padres. Cuando fue joven tenía el anhelo de ser chofer de transporte de pasajeros, pero como era muy apegado a sus padres jamás salió de su pueblo, hasta que se enamoró y se dio cuenta de que era necesario salir del hogar maternal. Desde entonces con perseverancia y empuje, junto a su esposa se propusieron sembrar sus propios cultivos, los cuales le han resultado muy rentables. Gracias al buen precio en que logró vender sus productos pudo comprar el terreno donde hizo su casa a base de madera y donde ahora le brinda un espacio y comodidad a su familia. Durante estos años como agricultor ha ganado mucha experiencia, por ello, aunque a veces no cuenta con los fertilizantes o pesticidas necesarios, se las ingenia en preparar humos o estiércol de vacunos para ayudar a la buena producción de sus plantas, aunque estos preparados no superen a los fertilizantes químicos. Durante los cuatro créditos anteriores consecutivos demostró puntualidad en sus cuotas con MFP, del mismo modo se compromete a ser puntual con este 5to préstamo. El dinero que viene solicitando lo va a invertir en la compra de 30 sacos de nitrato (abono)  para que proceda a abonar sus chacras de café.
texts.en:
Claudio is a hard-working man. He is 40 years old and lives with his wife. They have two children, who are Claudio's pride. He worked hard to build his own house so that his family could live comfortably. Farming is the only profession that Claudio knows, and he's been working at it since he was a small child learning from his parents. When he was young, Claudio wanted to be a taxi driver, but because he was very close to his parents he never left his hometown. He fell in love there and realized that it was necessary to leave his parents' home. Since then, Claudio and his wife have used perseverance to plant and harvest their own crops, which have been very profitable. Thanks to the good prices at which they sell their products, they were able to buy land and construct their home out of wood. They now have a comfortable space for their family. In his years as a farmer Claudio has accumulated experience, and now when he doesn't have the necessary fertilizers or pesticides he's able to prepare smoke or manure to help improve the crop, even though these aren't as good as chemical fertiilizers. During the four previous loan cycles Claudio has been punctual in his repayments with MFP, and has promised to continue this trend for the fifth loan. The money will go to purchase 30 bags of nitrate fertilizer for his coffee crop.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Aldo

texts.es: Aldo tiene 24 años, es conocido por su nobleza y su buen trato para con sus vecinos, vive con la madre de sus 3 hijos en la casa de madera que el mismo la fabricó. De niño su padre le tenía mucha confianza en los trabajos agrícolas, puesto que demostraba mucha responsabilidad en cada una de las labores encomendadas. Y ahora que lidera su propia familia trabaja con mucho ahínco en cada uno de sus cultivos y más aun en los trabajos jornaleros que realiza donde le pagan 15 soles diarios, dinero que utiliza para cubrir los gastos de su hogar mientras espera que sus chacras se carguen de fruto en forma uniforme y de ese modo sus cosechas le generan muy buenas ganancias. Durante estos años Aldo ha ganado experiencia en el manejo adecuado de cada planta, por ello se muestra muy contento con sus labores, debido a ello se propone ir incrementando sus terrenos, con el anhelo de aumentar sus siembras para que cuando crezcan sus hijos, les brinde las comodidades necesarias y puedan tener estudios superiores, que es lo que anhela como padre. En los ciclos anteriores su esposa era la socia titular de su banco comunal, pero en vista de que Aldo es muy activo, sus compañeros le han propuesto que él fuera el socio titular, por lo que ahora se compromete seguir siendo puntual en sus pagos y de asistir a todas las reuniones de mes del grupo. El dinero solicitado lo va a invertir en la compra de nitrato y urea (abonos) para proceder al abonado de sus plantas cafetaleras y tener una buena producción.
texts.en:
Aldo is 24 years old and known as a noble person who treats his neighbors well. He lives with his partner and three children in a house that he built out of wood. Since he was young, Aldo's father has been confident in his son's farming work, given that he demonstrates responsibility in all of his tasks. Now that he is the head of his own family, Aldo works eagerly on each of his crops. He works even harder as a day laborer, where he earns 15 soles per day, which he uses to cover household expenses while he waits for his fields to bear fruit. In this way Aldo's harvests produce very good earnings. Throughout these years Aldo has accumulated experience in the proper management of each crop, and as a result he is happy with his work. Thanks to his efforts he'd like to incrementally increase his lands, with the desire to plant more so that when his children grow up he can provide for them. He'd like his children to attend University. In previous loan cycles Aldo's wife was the title holder in the community bank, but because Aldo is very active his colleagues have asked him to be the title holder in this cycle. As such, he'll attend monthly meetings with the group. The money will be invested in nitrate fertilizer to fertilize his coffee plans and have a good harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Flora Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Urkupiña” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de ChuC., Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera, tiene estudios de primaria incompleta (3er grado), vive en el Barrio Central Yunguyo.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 08 años aproximadamente, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 para la preparación de tortas. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para la preparación de tortas y salchipapas al paso.

Su mayor sueño es poder  abrir una cafetería y comidas al paso, para luego comprarse una casita.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros que su banco comunal realiza.
texts.en:
Martha belongs to the Virgen de Urkupiña Community Bank, which is located in the Yunguyo district, ChuC. province, Puno department. She is 48 and single. She has a third grade education. She lives in the Yunguyo neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for approximately eight years. Her initial loan of 300 PEN was for making cakes. She is currently asking for a loan for 500 PEN to make cakes and fast food “salchipapas” (a dish made with potatoes and fried chicken). Her biggest dream is to be able to open a café with fast food so that later, she could buy a little house. She likes the savings and the meetings the Community Bank has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make cakes and fast food "salchipapas" (a dish made with potatoes and fried chicken)

loans.name: Brunilda

texts.es:
La señora Brunilda pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Urkupiña” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chuchito, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 37 años de edad, es viuda y es madre de 03 hijos y posee estudios superiores incompleta (contabilidad), vive en el Barrio Pacifico.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 03 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para la compra de colchones. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 3000.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de colchones, camas, muebles de comedor y otros.

Su mayor sueño es poder abrir una mueblería y surtirla mejor..

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la confianza que dan a las socias en el Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Brunilda is a member of the Virgen de Urkupiña Community Bank, which is located in the Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is 37. She is a widow and has three children. She has some upper level education in accounting, but she has not finished. She lives in the Pacifico neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for three years. She used her initial loan of 300 PEN to buy mattresses. She is currently asking for a loan for 3,000 PEN to buy mattresses, beds, dining room furniture and others. Her biggest dream is to be able to open a well stocked furniture store. She likes the savings and the confidence they give to the members of the Community Bank.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy mattresses, beds and dining room furniture

loans.name: Pacocsiguan Group

texts.es: Los Integrantes del grupo pacocsiguan son originario de la comunidad de Poxlajuj del departamento de Totonicapan ellas viene trabajando desde hace mas de diez años y la cual siguen unidas en el trabajo, durante este tiempo, ha realizado la crianza  de aves, cerdos, siembra de hortaliza, hace un año recibieron una capacitacion de tejidos manuales y la cual lo aprendieron  hoy necesita de un credito  y la cual necesita el apoyo de la asociación ya que en el sistema bancario no es posible por el monto y los requisitos con dicho credito sera invertido para la compra de los materiales para realizar la fajas, y cortes tipicos
texts.en:
The members of the Pacocsiguan group are from the Poxlajuj community in the Totonicapán department. They have worked together for over ten years, and they continue to be united in work. During this time they have raised birds, raised pigs, and planted vegetables. A year ago they received training in weaving by hand, and they learned how to make woven items. They now need a loan and support from the association. The sum of money and the requirements of the banking system make it impossible for them. The loan will be used to buy materials to make typical skirts and the belts used to wrap around the skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Pedro  Domingo

texts.es: Don Pedro es originario de la comunidad de Xantun del municipio de Totonicapan su actividad principal es albañil  actividad que lo viene realizando desde hace cinco años, dicha actividad lo aprendio desde niño ya que era la misma actividad que realiza su querido padre hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales para construcción  el manifiesta quiere tener una vivienda digna para su familia, con el unico objetivo de no tener problemas en la època de invierno.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro is originally from the Xantun community in the municipality of Totonicapan. He is a mason and has been in this activity for five years. He learned these skills as a child because it was the same activity carried out by his beloved father.

He is currently in need of a loan for the purchase of construction materials. He hopes to have a decent house for his family that does not bring problems in winter time.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials

loans.name: Sandra Del Transito

texts.es: Sandra del Transito D. tiene 32 años de edad reside en el departamento de Ahuachapán vive con sus cuatro hijos José de 13 años de edad, Sara de 12 años, Marcos de 10 años y Rosario de 8 años de edad todos los niños asisten a la escuela. Sandra no recibe ayuda económica de nadie ella solo ha logrado sacar a delante a sus hijos; con mucho trabajo ha superado todo obstáculo económico ya que no es nada fácil la manutención de cuatro niños que aun son menores de edad y Sandra no pretende interrumpir el estudio de ninguno de sus hijos por ponerse a trabajar es por ello que esta madre ejemplar lucha para poder  incrementar sus ingresos para darles una educación y estabilidad a su familia, hoy solicita un crédito, para la compra de frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
Sandra del Transito D. is 32 years old. She resides in the Ahuachapán State where she lives with her four children, Joseph, Sarah, Marcos and Rosario who are 13, 12, 10 and 8 years old. All children attend school. Sandra does not receive any financial help. She has managed to support her family working hard and has overcome financial obstacles since it is not easy to support four children who are still minors.

Sandra does not want her children to quit school and go to work. She is a mother to admire that struggle to increase her income to give an education and stability to her family. She is asking for a loan to buy fruits and vegetables

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jose Atilio

texts.es: Jose Atilio F. A. reside el departamento de Ahuachapán. José tiene 45 años de edad es un hombre soltero, vive solamente con su madre la Sra. Hilda de 67 años de edad quien le ayuda en el negocio. Jose posee una pequeño negocio llamado “Librería F.”, donde vende todo tipo  de artículos relacionados a la papelería, José solicita este crédito por que quiere surtir la librería con variedad de productos como papel, fólderes, lapiceros entre otros. Anteriormente José ha manejado créditos de mayor cantidad de los cuales, ya están cancelados en su totalidad y fue muy puntual es sus pagos.
texts.en:
Jose Atilio F. A. is 45 years old, single and resides in Ahuachapán state. He lives with his mother Mrs. Hilda who is 67 years old and helps in the business. Jose has a small book store business called "Libreria F.” Flower’s Bookstore, where he sells all kinds of items related to stationery.

Jose is asking for a loan in order to restock the book store and offer more variety of products such as paper, folders, pens and more. Jose has previously had loans which are already paid in full ,and was very punctual with the payments.

Translated from Spanish by Adriana Pierce, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock his business

loans.name: Evila

texts.es: Evila H. D. C. vive en San Salvador junto a su único hijo llamado Ever. Evila tienD. un pequeño local ubicado en el mercado municipal D. Soyapango donD. atienD. su negocio, una librería y tienda D. variedades, Evila solicita un crédito por que quiere invertir en mercadería para su librería D. esa manera lograría aumentar sus ventas ya que muchos D. sus clientes dejan D. comprarle a Evila por que el negocio carece D. los productos que ellos buscan. Evila ya ha manejado otros créditos D. los cuales ya están cancelados y fue muy responsable en sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Evila H. D. C. lives in San Salvador next to her only son Ever. Evila has a small location in the municipal market in Soyapango where she attends her business, a bookstore and variety store. Evila is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise for the bookstore so that she can increase her sales since many of her customers have stopped buying from her because her business lacks the products that they are looking for. Evila has had loans before and was very responsible in making the established payments.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise for store

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia
texts.en: Lucia

loans.use: Merchandise for store

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl D. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 27 years old. Liezl is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Liezl is a seamstress who provides general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. Liezl has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Liezl joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Liezl has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. She used the previous loan to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. Liezl is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which she will use to purchase sewing materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Liezl from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the her family's living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran Zamboanga del sur

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es: Reina Isabel R. D. A. resiD. en Cojutepeque ubicado en la zona occidental D. El Salvador. Reina tiene 46 años D. edad vive con su único hijo Álvaro D. 12 años D. edad que actualmente está cursando 6º  grado D. la secundaria. Reina tiene un pequeño puesto ubicado en el mercado donD. comercializa granos básicos como frijoles, maíz, arroz. Reina solicita este crédito por que quiere invertir en la compra D. granos básicos para su negocio ya que le hace falta cantidad D. arroz y maíz, D. esta manera esta madre D. familia lograría aumentar sus ganancias ya que sus clientes no tendrían la necesidad D. ir a otro puesto, ya que donD. Reina harán todas sus compras.
texts.en:
Reina Isabel R. D. A. lives in Cojutepeque which is located in the western area of El Salvador. Reina is 46 years old and lives with her only son Álvaro, who is 12 years old and currently in the 6th graD.. Reina has a small booth located in a market where she sells basic grains such as bean, corn and rice. Reina is requesting this loan because she wants to invest in the purchase of grains for her business since she needs rice and corn. That would allow this mother to be able to increase her income, since her customers won't have a need to go to another stand and will do all their shopping with Reina.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her business

location.town: Cojutepeque en el departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Diosdado

texts.en:
Diosdado B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. He is 47 years old. He is married and has one school-aged child. Diosdado is a fisherman who catches and sells ocean-caught fish in the local community. Diosdado is just starting this business.

In 2009, Diosdado joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosdado has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. Diosdado is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which he will invest in expanding the business. This loan is his second loan from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Laverna

texts.en:
Laverna G. is from the village of Sto. Ñino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 52 years old. Laverna is married and has five adult children. Laverna sells a variety of different products such as cosmetics  in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over a year and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Laverna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Laverna is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan is her first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Yanira Isabel

texts.es: Yanira Isabel R. A. reside en Lourdes Colon ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad. Yanira tiene 40 años de edad, es madre soltera de 2 hijos Diego de 19 años de edad y Eduardo de 16 años de edad ambos jóvenes están cursando el bachillerato en la escuela. Yanira ha logrado sostener a su familia con su esfuerzo y logros económicos, ella se dedica a la venta de artículos por catálogo y también maneja un pequeño inventario en su casa de productos como perfumes, cremas corporales, zapatos entre otros; Yanira solicita este crédito para aumentar su inventario.
texts.en:
Yanira Isabel R. A. lives in Lourdes Colón located in the state of La Libertad. She is 40 years old and a single mother of two sons, Diego who is 19 years old and Eduardo who is 16 years old, both in high school. Yanira has managed to support her family with her effort and economic achievements. She works selling products via catalog and also has a small supply of products in her house such as perfumes, body creams, shoes, etc. Yanira is requesting this loan to augment her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Supply her business

loans.name: Elmar

texts.en:
Elmar B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 35 years old. Elmar is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Elmar operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Elmar has been engaged in her business for more than three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Elmar joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elmar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Elmar is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP to invest in expanding the business. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Elmar from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Chem

texts.en: Chem K. is 39 years old and resides in Phnom Penh, where she has had a job as a local carver for years. She normally buys marble blocks in bulk from her suppliers who bring them to her house. She carves them into statues and sells them to people who come to buy at her home. She was married, but divorced her husband when her kids were very young. At the moment, she has two children who attend school and they help her in carving statues. Chem K. will be using a loan for capital to purchase extra marble to make more statues for sale.

loans.use: To purchase extra marble

loans.name: Ritchel

texts.en:
Ritchel S. is from the village of Biasong. She is 29 years old. Ritchel is married and has one infant child. To make a living, Ritchel owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Ritchel has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ritchel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ritchel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. Ritchel is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Ritchel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Leonor

Leonor B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 37 years old. Leonor is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Leonor owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Leonor is just starting this business.

In 2008, Leonor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonor has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Leonor is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Leonor from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

loans.name: Noralyn

texts.en:
Noralyn T. is from the village of Biasong. She is 37 years old. Noralyn is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Noralyn owns & operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from harvesting & selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Noralyn has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2007, Noralyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noralyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Noralyn is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including hooks & nets. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Noralyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
La señora Paulina,  pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Urkupiña” ubicado en el distrito D. Yunguyo, Provincia D. Chuchito, Departamento D. Puno. Tiene 60 años, es viuda y madre D. 6 hijos y posee estudios D. primaria incompleta (3ro D. primaria), vive en el Barrio Pacifico.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. la fundación del Banco Comunal, con un préstamo inicial D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles para compra y venta D. artesanías. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo D. S/. 2700.00, para la compra D. golosinas como: chocolates, dulces, yogurts, jugos y otros. Además D. insumos para artesanías en miniatura (casas, autos, etc.) los cuales los venD. en ferias a nivel nacional.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros que realiza su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Paulina belongs to the Virgen D. Urkupiña Community Bank, which is located in the Yunguyo district, Chuchito province, Puno department. She is a 60 year old widow with six children. She has a third graD. education. She lives in the Pacifico neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos since its foundation. She used her initial loan of 300 PEN to buy and sell handicrafts. She is currently asking for a loan of 2,700 PEN to buy sweets such as chocolates, candy, yogurt, juices and others. These are in addition to supplies for miniature handicrafts (homes, cars, etc.), which she sells at national fairs. Her biggest wish is to continue working. She likes the savings and the meetings that her Community Bank has.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets (chocolate, candy, yogurt, and others) and miniature handicrafts

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie B. is from the village of Biasong. She is 35 years old. Rosemarie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns & operates a manufacturing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from manufacturing & selling clay products to local businesses and community members. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosemarie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rosemarie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
