loans.name: Rahmonberdi

texts.en:
N. Rahmonberdi lives in the town of Istaravshan with his wife and two children. He has worked in agriculture for 10 years, and in that time has gained much experience and a love for the land. He began cultivating his land through his own efforts and has gradually gotten ahead in life. Rahmonberdi’s wife is a vendor and helps support the family. Rahmonberdi would like to use this loan to buy supplies for the harvest and for improving production, and thus increase the quality of his yield along with his earnings at the time of sale.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Josephen

texts.en:
Josephen T. is from the village of Masabod, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Josephen is separated from her spouse and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Josephen owns & operates a handicraft business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling bamboo handicrafts to local community members. Josephen has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately Php 18,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In May 2009, Josephen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephen is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional handicrafts. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina A. is from the village of Taboo, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 69 years old. Victorina is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Victorina owns & operates a retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Victorina is just starting this business.

In 2008, Victorina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victorina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to renovate her residential house. Victorina is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP, which will be used for the completion of her house renovation. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Victorina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To complete her house renovation

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn O. is from the town of Katipunan. She is 40 years old. Rosalyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rosalyn owns & operates a business making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Rosalyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Rosalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Dilafruz

texts.ru: Жабборова  Дилафруз- молодая женщина 31 года, вдова, имеет двоих детей.Она одна воспитывает своих  детей и ей  приходится  много работать. Более пяти лет она торгует  на центральном рынке Джаббор-Расуловского района . Она продает метражные ткани разных  видов. В  настоящее  время  её  ткани   среди  покупателей  пользуются  хорошим  спросом,  так  как  она  всегда  привозит  хороший  и  качественный  товар. Дилафруз  нравится  с  нами  работать,  так  как  полученный  кредит  помог  ей  расширить  свой  ассортимент.
texts.en:
Dilafruz J. is a young 31-year-old woman. She is a widow and has two children. Because she is raising her children by herself, Dilafruz has to work a lot. She has been selling various types of fabrics at a market in the Jabbor-Rasulov district for over five years. Currently, her fabrics are in high demand among customers since Dilafruz sells good and quality merchandise. Dilafruz likes to work with us because this loan helps her expand her merchandise assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
La señora Elena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 41 años, es casada y madre de 03 hijos (estudiantes de educación superior),posee estudios de primaria completa, y vive en el centro poblado de Imicati.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 8 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su aumentar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de ganado menor. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su actual negocio, que es la compra de abarrotes como: azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos, aceite, galletas, harina y otros para luego venderlos en su tienda.

Su mayor sueño es poder vender ropa de abrigo al por mayor.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y la facilidad en los préstamos.
texts.en:
Elena belongs to the Señor de Los Milagros ("Our Father of Miracles") Village Bank, which is located in the Imicati Community of Yunguyo Distruct, Chucuito Province, Puno Department. She is 41 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in college. Elena finished primary school, and lives in the center of Imicati. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost eight years, and used her very first loan of 300 soles to increase working capital for her business buying and selling livestock. She is now requesting a loan of 1500 soles to invest in her current business by buying basic grocery items like sugar, rice, milk, pasta, oil, cookies, flour, etc. She will then sell these items in her store. Elena's greatest dream is to sell warm clothing in bulk. Her favorite parts of participating in a village bank are her savings account and the ease with which she can take out loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, rice, milk, pasta, oil, cookies and flour

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Rosa, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros”  que esta ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 35 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos, posee estudios de secundaria completa, y vive en la Villa San Borja.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi 8 años, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de ropa. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 1,300.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en su negocio, con la compra de ropa por docenas, la misma que será  vendida en el mercado de Yunguyo y en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor sueño es poder comprarse un carro.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones de su banco comunal.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Señor de Los Milagros ("Our Father of Miracles") Village Bank, located in the community of Imicati, Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 35 years old and is the single mother of three children. She completed her high school education, and currently lives in Villa San Borja. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for almost eight years. She used her very first loan of 300 soles to increase working capital for her business buying and selling clothes. She is now requesting a loan of 1,300 soles to invest in her business by buying clothing by the dozen. She will sell these clothes at the Yunguyo market and at local markets. Her greatest dream in life is to buy a car. Her favorite parts of village bank membership are her savings account and the group meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing by the dozen

loans.name: Turdiboy

texts.en:
P. Turdiboy is 26 years old. He’s married and has two children. Turdiboy is in the business of growing onions and wheat. Turdiboy began this business with the advise of his father (pictured) who always supports him with his business. He has five years of experience in this sphere of business. With this loan, he would like to buy agricultural supplies to improve production. In the future, Turdiboy hopes to increase his production and sales, as well as provide a good education to his children and to have economic stability. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Хомидов Толиб- мужчина 1958 года рождения, женат, имеет троих детей. Он вместе со своей женой  имеют маленький магазинчик, где продают продукты питания. . Когда  он  начинала  у  него  было  маленькое  количество  товара.  Но  недавно  от  своих  соседей  по  бизнесу  он  узнал  о  кредитовании  в  нашей  организации.  Сейчас  Толиб  расширил свой  ассортимент.  Его жена Хомидова Иноят  помогает  ему  привозить и продавать товар.  В другие  дни  он  подрабатывает перевозкой пассажиров на собственной машине  и  тем  самым  пополняет  семейный  бюджет.
texts.en:
Born in 1958, Tolib H. is married and has three children. Tolib and his wife own a small store where they sell food products. When he first started his business, Tolib did not have much product variety. He recently learned about financing with our organization from his business neighbors. Now, Tolib expanded his product assortment. His wife, Inoyat Homidova, helps him deliver and sell the merchandise. Tolib also supplements the family budget by working as a part-time passenger driver, using his own car.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sugar

loans.name: Aslonbek

texts.en:
T. Aslonbek is dedicated to the production of onion, potato and wheat. With a lot of effort and sacrifice, he carries out this work every day for the purpose of improving the conditions for his family, bringing the daily bread to his table and, at the same time, saving for the improvement of his dwelling. His dwelling needs a lot of help because it is in a bad state; little by little, he has come to improve it. Aslonbek is married with four children. His family admires him for the fact that his multiple efforts have permitted him to bring food to his home and that, in addition, he has managed to keep his children in school. The need that this gentleman faces is that he needs to invest in his business through the purchase of seeds and fertilizer. He hopes that Kiva will offer him the loan to do well along with his family.

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Elueteria

texts.en:
Elueteria N. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 52 years old. Elueteria is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Elueteria owns & operates a business venture providing waste management services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from hauling plastics & other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Elueteria has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Elueteria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elueteria has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional plastics & other recyclables to sell. Elueteria is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 19th loan taken out by Elueteria from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Mukaddashon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Тошматова Мукаддасхон- женщина 23 года. Замужем имеет 2-х детей. Мукаддас занимается пошив и оформления женский национальных одежд на заказ. Она училась у хорошей швеи пол года.Теперь она самостоятельно берёт заказы и шьёт разные национальные платья. На полученного займа хочет, купит вышивальную машинку.  Мукаддас надеется,что кредит поможет ей расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Mukaddashon T. is a woman of 23 years of age. She is married and has two children. Mukaddas sews and decorates custom women's national dresses. She studied with a good seamstress for half a year. Right now she takes orders herself and makes different national dresses. She wants to use the loan to buy an embroidery machine. Mukaddas hopes that this loan will help her expand her business.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Абдуганиева Нилуфар- молодая женщина 30-ти лет,замужем , имеет двоих детей. Занимается торговлей детской  одежды на вещевом рынке Джаббор-Расуловского района. Раньше она продавала только мужскую одежду. Начала заниматься этой деятельностью, поскольку все заботы о семье лежат на её плечах, чтобы дать детям хорошее образование и улучшить уровень жизни.  Недавно  она  решила перейти на продажу детской одежды, потому что это приносит хорошую прибыль.Для этого она  получила займ в МЗФ «Микроинвест», в размере 2000 сомони.  Постепенно она увеличила сумму займа и стала расширять наименования товара, улучшила место деятельности. В будущем планирует открыть ещё одну торговую точку.
texts.en:
Nulifar A. is a young woman of 30 years of age. She is married and has two children. She sells children's clothing on the clothing marketplace of the Jabbor-Rasulov region. She used to sell men's clothing. She started this business because all of her family's expenses rest on her shoulders so that she can provide for her children's good education and improve their quality of life. Recently she has decided to start selling children's clothing because it brings good profit. She has taken out a loan for this from MicroInvest. Gradually she has increased the size of her loan and began to expand the variety of items and improved her vendor location. In the future she plans to open one more vendor location.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a stock of children's t-shirts and tanktops

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 


Исоев Шухрат – мужчина 30 лет. Женат пока не имеет детей. Жена новая невеста и сидит пока дома. Шухрат занимается переоформлением  автомобилей. Каждый день у него  есть 1-2 машины на ремонт. Таким образом у него есть постоянный  доход. Также он продает машины которые ему приносят клиенты. Он их ремонтирует и выносит на рынок. Но такой бизнес требует много времени. Поэтому ему более подходит работа оформление и ремонт машин. Кредит получает для покупки красок и необходимых оборудования для ремонта машин.
texts.en:
Shuhrat I. is a 30 years old man. He is married and does not have children yet. He has a young wife and she stays at home for now. Shuhrat remodels cars. Everyday he has one or two cars that need repair. This way he has regular income. He also sells cars which his customers bring to him. He repairs them and gets them out to the market. But this business takes a lot of time. This is why his car remodeling work suits him more. Shuhrat is taking a loan to buy paints and necessary equipment to repair cars.

MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paint and necessary equipment

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es:
La señora Isidora, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor de Los Milagros” ubicado en la Comunidad de Imicati, distrito de Yunguyo, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno. Tiene 27 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 2 hijos, posee estudios de educación primaria incompleta (3er grado), y vive en el pueblo de Choquechaca.

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace casi medio año, con un préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, para su aumentar el capital de su negocio de compra y venta de pescado. 

Actualmente solicita un préstamo de S/. 500.00 Nuevos soles, para poder aumentar el capital de su negocio, de compra y venta de pescado, que luego será vendido en la plaza de Yunguyo y también en las ferias de la zona.

Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para darles una buena educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gusta las capacitaciones y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Isidora is a member of the Señor de Los Milagros ("Our Father or Miracles") Village Bank, located in the community of Imicati in Yunguyo District, Chucuito Province, Department of Puno. She is 27 years old and lives with her partner and their two children. She has a third grade education and currently lives in the village of Choquechaca. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos movement for six months. She used her very first loan of 300 soles to increase working capital for her business buying and selling fish. She is currently requesting a loan of 500 soles to buy fish for her business, which she will then sell in the Yunguyo plaza and in local markets. Her greatest dream in life is to continue working in order to provide her children with a good education. Her favorite parts of village bank membership are the educational sessions and the ease with which she can take out loans.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy different kinds of fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more seeds for farming

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Mrs. Nou S. is 27 years old and a resident of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is married to Mr. Mon Sokha (he is shown in the picture), age 30, and they make a living planting crops in the village. This couple has given birth to three children who are of school-age. They also go to work on the farm when they are free from studying. Because the family needs to take a long time to cut their mature crop after they plant, they have no income to support their family’s daily expense. Therefore, Nou S. has decided to seek a loan on Kiva for capital to purchase vegetables from other farmers to sell at the market for a profit. She hopes to use the benefits from the farm to buy zinc to cover the roof of her house that cracks down.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables from other farmers to sell

loans.name: Ashraf Khan

texts.en:
This is Ashraf Khan, son of D.. He is married and lives in Kama, of Nangrahar province. He has broad experience in the agricultural process and has been farming vegetables for more than fifteen years. He grows many different kinds of vegetables on his land, including tomatoes and cucumbers. 

He requested an individual loan of 30,000 AFN from the center of AFS (Ariana Financial Services Joint Stock Company) to purchase seeds and some necessary things for his land. He is grateful to AFS for the trust and financial support the organization has granted him.

loans.use: To complete his stock of seed

loans.name: Shokorya Group

texts.en: Shokorya is the leader of Shokorya group. They live in Kabul, Afghanistan, and they would like to receive a loan to sustain their businesses. There are four members in this group and each of them wants to take out a loan. Shokorya wants a loan for her bakery business. Arozo wants a loan to buy two sewing machines for her tailoring business.  Shakeba wants a loan for her husband’s business of selling car parts. Nabelah wants a loan for her husband’s business of selling fresh fruit. They are happy that their businesses are supported through this process.

loans.use: To develop their businesses

loans.name: José Alexander

texts.es: José Alexander T. M. reside en San Juan Opico ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, José tiene 32 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos Katia de 6 años y Emanuel de 4 años de edad. José y su esposa tienen una pequeña tienda ubicada en su casa con productos de consumo y también se dedican a la crianza de pollos de engorde, José está solicitando este crédito por que quiere comprar más pollos y concentrado, para lograr aumentar sus ventas y satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes por los pollos que cría en su pequeña granja.
texts.en:
José Alexander T. M. lives in San Juan Opico in the department of La Libertad. José is 32 years old and lives with his wife and their two children: Katia, who is six years old, and Emanuel, who is four. José and his wife have a small store in their home, where they sell food; they also raise chickens. José is requesting this loan because he wants to buy more chickens and chicken feed so that he can sell more and fulfill his customers' demands for the chickens he raises on his small farm.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy chickens to fatten up

loans.name: Faiz Ilahi Khadim Hussain Group

texts.en:
Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Aneela baji wants a loan to buy sanitary supplies (taps, pipes) to sell.

Ayesha baji wants a loan to buy material (beads, colored thread and clothes) for her embroidery business.

Parveen akhtar baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

My name is Faiz ilahi and I have belonged to a city named Vehari, Pakistan, for the past fifteen years. I am an uneducated lady and I don’t feel hesitation to mention it, but I know the skills of embroidering clothes. This art encourages me to start my own embroidered clothes business. I started taking order from the clothes shops and earn income. I use my income as of need.

My husband’s name is K. H. and he deals with his clothes-selling business. He buys clothes from the city Multan because, in it, the clothes prices are very low. Then he sells those clothes to the community and earns income. I am applying for a loan to increase the profit of my husband’s clothes-selling business.

loans.use: To buy clothes for her husband to sell

loans.name: Zahra Group

texts.en: Zahra is the leader of Zahra group. There are four members in this group and they live in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. The total requested amount is 40,000 AFN. Each of them would like to receive a loan for her own business. Zahra and Torpekay want to receive a loan for their tailoring business. Salaha wants a loan for her son’s business of selling gasoline. Nasema wants a loan for her son’s general store. They appreciate this loan process and want to thank Kiva.

loans.use: To sustain their businesses

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es: Blanca Rosa F. V. reside en Lourdes Colon en el departamento de La Libertad. Blanca vive solamente  con su hija Jessica de 17 años de edad  y está cursando 9º grado en la escuela. Blanca cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo quien está fuera del país por darle a su familia una superación económica. A pesar que Blanca recibe ayuda de su esposo ella es una mujer que trabaja día a día y es así como lleva ya 8 años en su negocio, ubicado en el mercado de Santa Tecla donde vende sopas de patas, un plato muy difícil de preparar y también bien muy demandado por los salvadoreños. Blanca solicita un crédito para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima de los ingredientes para la sopa de patas, así incrementara sus ventas y las necesidades de sus clientes por tan cotizado platillo.
texts.en:
Blanca Rosa F. V. lives in Lourdes Colon in La Libertad Department. She lives with her daughter Jessica, who is 17 and currently in ninth grade. Blanca's husband is currently working outside El Salvador in order to help support his family economically. Even though Blanca receives help from her husband, she is a woman who works every day at her business, which she has been doing for the past eight years. She works in the Santa Tecla Market selling pig's feet stew, a dish that is very difficult to prepare and for which there is very high demand in El Salvador. Blanca is requesting a loan to buy more ingredients to make her soup, in order to increase her sales and fulfill her customers' demand for this popular dish.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ingredients to make pig's feet stew

loans.name: Francisco Tomas

texts.es: Francisco Tomas G. F. reside en Ciudad Arce en el departamento de La Libertad. Francisco vive en casa propia con su esposa la Sra. Maritza de 43 años de edad, Francisco tiene una pequeña tienda dentro de su casa donde vende productos básicos de consumo, aparte de las ganancias que le deja su negocio Francisco tuvo la idea rentar cuartos de su casa para poder conseguir un poco mas de dinero al mes. Francisco solicita este crédito por que quiere invertir en su tienda, surtiéndola con más productos que le ayuden a seguir a ampliar su negocio al igual que sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Francisco Tomas G. F. lives in the city of Arce, which is in the La Libertad department. Francisco lives in his own house with his 43 year old wife, Maritza. Francisco has a small store in his house. He sells basic consumer goods. In addition to the earnings that this business gives him, Francisco had the idea to rent out rooms in his house in order to get a little more money every month. Francisco is asking for this loan to invest in his store by stocking it with more products. This will help him to continue to increase his business and his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stock his store

loans.name: Shagufta Asghar Hussain Group

texts.en:
Shabana baji and Musarat baji each want a loan to buy clothes to sell.

Fozia baji and Asia baji each want a loan to buy material (beads, clothes and colored thread) for their decorative embroidery business.

Shagufta baji is the group leader of these aforementioned ladies who belong to a city named Vehari, Pakistan. Shagufa baji and her members are very responsible. They handle their own businesses to give ease to their husbands. They are all involved in a clothes-sewing and decorative embroidery business.

Shagufta baji is married to A. H. who runs a grocery shop in the community. He has been doing this work for the past three years. She is applying for a loan to buy groceries to expand her husband’s grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy groceries for her husband's grocery shop

loans.name: Jacquiline

texts.en: Jacquiline S. is from the village of San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 33 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Jacquiline owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling groceries and daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She is just starting this business. In 2008, Jacquiline joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to invest in renovating her business. Jacquiline is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business and to supplement the needs of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offerings

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ahmad Samer Group

texts.en:
Ahmad Samer is the leader of the Ahmad Samer group. There are six members in this group and they all live in district 11 of Kabul, Afghanistan. They want to take out a group loan to develop their separate businesses, and to bring about some changes and improvements.

Ahamd Samer wants a loan for his general store; he would like to increase the size of his shop. M. Rahem wants a loan for his tailoring shop. Deba wants a loan for her husband’s photo shop. Palwasha wants a loan for her tailoring business; she hopes to enlarge her shop. A. Rawof wants a loan for his business as a taxi driver. Ahmad Shafeq wants a loan for his ice cream shop.

They would like to say that this loan process is a good one which can support all entrepreneurs around the world.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Саидумар

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

 Саидумар Нумонов проживает в городе Истаравшане. Он занимается предпринимательской деятельностью.У него есть две точки продаж на рынке города. В первой точке он реализует сладости (конфеты и печенья), а во второй точке хозяйственные товары. Вторую точку он открыл недавно, после того как первый раз получил у нас кредит. 
 Он закупил 40 кг. пряников и 36 кг. российского шоколада. Продал товар и получил хорошую прибыль.   
 На доходы открыл дополнительную точку по реализации хозтоваров.
Саидумар обратился в нашу организацию за повторным кредитом, для закупа хозяйственных товаров во вторую точку продаж.В этой точке сын Саидумара будет торговать.
Саидумар преобретает товар у поставщиков, который привозят из Китая.
 Жена Саидумара Махбуба и его невестка помогают ему в его бизнесе.
texts.en:
Saidumar Numonov lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is an entrepreneur, who has two retail outlets at the city market. Saidumar sells sweets (candies and cookies) at the first store and household goods at the second. He recently opened the second store, soon after obtaining his first loan from us. He bought 40 kilograms of pryanik cookies and 36 kilograms of Russian chocolate. He sold the products and made a good profit and then used the profits to open the household store. Saidumar requested another loan from our organization in order to buy household products for the second store. Saidumar’s son will start selling at this store. Saidumar buys his merchandise from suppliers, who bring it from China. Saidumar’s wife, Mahbuba, and daughter-in-law help him with the business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of household goods

loans.name: Lhagvasuren

texts.en: Lhagvasuren C., 34, is a single mother who lives with one daughter. Her family lives in a ger (nomadic housing tent) district on a plot of land she owns in Arhangay, one of the Mongolian central provinces. Her daughter,Temuujin, age 8, is attending a local elementary school. In 2005, Lhagvasuren started running a butcher shop. When she began her retail business, her working capital was 150,000 tugrugs (~ $120 US). She has been renting a small stall at the local food market since she started her business. Her friendly and trustful character has attracted many buyers, hence she has many repeat clients. After four and a half years of hard work, her working capital has increased 1,000,000 tugrugs. Her future dream is to have her own supermarket. She says, "I'll keep working hard to give a better life to my only daughter." With this loan she will buy the meat and organs from a whole animal to increase her business inventory.

loans.use: To buy meat

loans.name: Chhlorm's Group

texts.en:
This small loan has been requested by a group of four borrowers. Mrs. R., 28, has been selected to be the leader. She is a local vendor, selling a few grocery items out of her home and earning an average of $2.50 profit a day. She is married with four children who are still young and under her care. Her husband works in construction. 
R. is a fantastic woman who has been managing her investment well and bringing in a lot of income. She will be using this loan to grow her business by buying additional groceries to sell. 
The other borrowers are:
L., who will use the loan to repair her old house.
S., who will use this loan to build a restroom for her family's hygiene.
P., a motor taxi driver, who is asking for a loan to repair his broken motor.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Narantsatsral

texts.en:
Narantsatsral S. is 31, married, and the mother of three. Her family lives on the plot of land she owns in Arhangay, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her eldest son goes to an elementary school, and the youngest two are attending a kindergarten.

Since 2007, Narantsatsral has been running a food product sales business. For the first year, she was selling food products such as fresh bread, milk, and other beverages, by going door-to-door. With the profit, she started renting a stall at the local food market. Narantsatsral says that "my business capital and profit are keep increasing and I’m getting experienced day-to-day. Thus, to expand my business and save costs, I'm planning to buy a food stall instead of paying rent." She requests a loan to buy food products for her tiny business.

loans.use: To buy food products for her business

loans.name: Bathuyag

texts.en:
Bathuyag B. is 27, married and father of one. His family lives in a ger (nomadic housing tent) on rental land in Baganuur, a small town located 120 kilometers from the capital city. His spouse stays at home to take care of their three-year-old daughter.

Bathuyag runs a taxi service. Most of his customers are local residents, since he serves in town. To increase his profit, he is planning to expand taxi route and drive between cities, since many people come and go every day from Ulaanbaatar, the capital city. With the profit from his business, he sold his first car and bought a better car, a second-hand Japanese vehicle that is his second car ever.

Bathuyag is a very humble person. His hope is to have his child grow up healthy and become a good person. He plans to open a savings account for his child, and then start accumulating small amounts. With this loan, Bathuyag is aiming to buy a ger cover and pay for his sibling's graduation ceremony expenses.

loans.use: To buy a ger cover and pay for sibling's graduation ceremony

loans.name: Каромат

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Каромат Бобонорова работает преподователем в местной школе. Но так как  зароботная плата учителей в нашей стране не вилика, она откармливает домашний скот в домашних условиях.
Стаж работы в сфере животноводства у Каромат 30 лет. Она передает свой огромный опыт в сфере животноводства своей невестке Хуршеде.
Муж и сын Каромат уехали на заработки в Российскую Федерацию, и присылают оттуда деньги.
Кроме животноводства Каромат работает бригадиром в дехканском хозяйстве.
На сегодняшний день у нее дома 3 голов домашнего скота, которых она должна откормить и продать осенью. С этой целью она обратилась в нашу организацию. Хочет получить кредит в размере 1200 сомони.
texts.en:
Karomat Bobonorova works as a teacher at a local school. However, since a teacher’s salary in our country is small, Karomat raises livestock at home. She has been involved in the animal husbandry field for 30 years. She is also passing this extensive knowledge to her daughter-in-law, Hursheda. Karomat’s husband and son left to work in the Russian Federation and send money home. Besides animal husbandry, Karomat works as a foreman at a dekhan farm. Today, Karomat owns 3 heads of livestock that she has to feed and sell in the autumn. She requested a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni from our organization for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa D. est une femme de 38 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants. elle est revendeuse d’ignames, depuis 7 ans, à Lomé. Son activité consiste à aller payer ses marchandises auprès des agriculteurs et devenir les revendre en ville aux détaillants. Avec ce crédit, Yawa souhaite augmenter la capacité de son commerce en augmentant achats. Ceci lui permettra de répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et par conséquent une amélioration de son niveau de vie.
texts.en:
Yawa D. is a woman of 38, married and the mother of 2 children. She has been selling cocoyams for 7 years in Lomé. Her business consists in buying her merchandise from the farmers and coming to sell the produce to retailers in town. With this loan, Yawa hopes to raise the capacity of her business by increasing her purchases. This will permit her to better respond to the needs of her clientele and thus to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of yams for resale

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar O. lives with his wife and three small children in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest child is his 9-year-old son, who goes a local high school. The other two small children stay home under the care of their parents.

Erdenebayar runs a small shoe repair shop in the town. He has been running the shoe repair shop for the last nine years and it is known as a good repair shop in the town. Since the start, his business has done well; his business capital has increased from 30,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) to 500,000 MNT. He says that he hopes to expand his shoe repair shop by hiring an additional worker as the demand for his services steadily increases. He requests a loan to purchase shoe repair materials for his business.

loans.use: To purchase shoe repair materials

loans.name: Abdul Ahad Group

texts.en: A. Ahad is the leader of A. Ahad group. There are three members in this group and they all live in distract 15 in Kabul, Afghanistan. They want to take out a loan to improve their businesses. A. Ahad wants a loan for his business of selling vegetables. A. Ahad wants a loan for his general store. Nasema wants a loan for her carpet-weaving business. They all want to affirm that this process will definitely help them advance.

loans.use: To improve their businesses

loans.name: Erdenezorig

texts.en:
Erdenezorig B. lives with his wife and her 3-year-old daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Her daughter goes to a local kindergarten.

Erdenezorig runs a small retail business in food products with his wife. He buys food products, including baked goods, soft-drinks, dairy products, etc., from the local wholesale markets and his wife sits at the rented stall and retails the products in the local food market.

Erdenezorig started his business in 2007 with small capital of 50,000 MNT ($1 = 1,450 MNT). Their business capital currently ranges from 400,000 MNT to 500,000 MNT. In the future, they aim to expand their food retail business by adding more variety of food items. Erdenezorig requests a loan to purchase more food products for his business.

loans.use: To buy more food products for his business

loans.name: Bulgantamir

texts.en: Bulgantamir B. is a single father who lives with his four children whose ages range from 9 to 18. He currently resides in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. His oldest daughter is a college student and the other three children are all in high school. He drives a cab in the town. He has been doing the taxi business since 2003. His daily income has increased from 3,000 MNT ($1 USD = 1,450 MNT) to 8,000 MNT. He says that he is working very hard to be financially able to support all his children's education. Since all his four children go to school, the expenses for their education can be very high. Bulgantamir requests a loan to purchase new tires for his car.

loans.use: To buy new tires for his car

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe N. is from the village of Calabayan, Ozamiz City. She is 39 years old, married, and has three school-age children. Fe owns and operates a "sari-sari" or general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Fe joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Fe is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her fourth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children and for family needs. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Gift

texts.en: Gift B. sells poultry. She is married with six children and she is 30 years old. She is requesting the loan of N70,000 to purchase more poultry to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poultry to sell

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: MLF
texts.en:
Marifat N. lives in the city of Istaravshan with her husband, Habib, and their children. Marifat has 2 sheep and a cow at home. She feeds and sells livestock. She uses part of the profits from livestock sales to buy lambs and calves to feed and resell again. She uses the rest of the profits for family needs. Marifat has 15 years of experience in the animal husbandry field. Her sons, Fahriddin and Zainiddin, help with the business. Marifat’s husband is involved in agriculture. Marifat is requesting a loan in the sum of 1200 somoni for livestock feeding.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock feeding

loans.name: Kokouvi

texts.fr: Ce monsieur vit dans le quartier d’adidogomé, il est célibataire et travaille dur pour subvenir à ses charges, il exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente d’appareils et de pièces électroniques. Il a ouvert sa propre boutique qu’il a appelé «ETS ELECTRO STORE ». Il fait ce commerce depuis 2007. Actuellement une partie de son stock est épuisée, il veut se réapprovisionner c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter des pièces et appareils électroniques.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Adidogomé district. He is single and works hard to support himself. He earns a living by selling electronic goods. He has opened his own little store that he calls «ETS ELECTRO STORE ». He has been in this line of work since 2007. Presently, part of his inventory is expended and he needs to re-stock his business. For that reason, he is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy spare parts and electronic goods.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of parts and electronic goods

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris A. sells shoes to her customers. She is 39 years old and married with two children. Doris is requesting a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more shoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes to sell

loans.name: Nho's Group

texts.en:
Nho Thị Chử was born in 1950. She is living in Loc Ha village, Dong Anh district, Ha Noi city. There are five peopL. in her family. She is a group leader and has a monthly income of about $170. Nho breeds pigs and poultry and she needs 5.014.000 VND (or $280) to buy food for pigs. There are 4 other fund participants in her group, all of whom want to borrow the same amount as Nho:

Kết Thị Trần was born in 1957. She wants a loan to breed pigs and poultry. Nụ Thị Nguyễn was born in 1980. She wants a loan to invest in her cosmetics shop. Hoa Thị T. Lê was born in 1983. She wants a loan to invest in her shop. Hải Thị P. was born in 1964. She wants a loan to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy food for pigs

loans.name: Calixta

texts.en: Calixta E. is from the town of Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 37 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. Calixta owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling soft drinks and sari-sari (general store) products like shampoo, soap for laundry and for taking a bath, sardines, salt, etc. Calixta is just starting this business. In 2008, Calixta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Calixta is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for family needs and to improve and expand her business. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie B. makes a living primarily from selling clothes in her local community. She is 46 years old, married and has three adult children. They are from the village of Pines, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. Rosalie has been in this business for over five years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2007, Rosalie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from GDMPC. Rosalie is now requesting a loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to buy new items to expand her product offerings. This will be her fifth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Premitiva

texts.en: Premitiva C. is from the village of Manga, Tangub City. She is 59 years old, widowed and has six adult children. Premitiva owns and operates a business selling products like coconuts and charcoal, buying and selling coconuts and making charcoal. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Premitiva joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Premitiva is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase general supplies and equipment. This loan will be her second from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase general supplies and equipment

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en:
Adamu U. sells sarongs of various colors to her customers. She is married with eight children and she is 48 years old.

She is requesting the loan of N50,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Adamu U. says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell
